Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel, Boutique Feel”
Reviews.Author: ridethestallion
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago offers visitors an excellent location on Michigan Avenue, in downtown Chicago. The location of the hotel puts visitors within easy walking distance of various museums, great restaurants, and shopping. I've stayed here many times. My consistent impression is that the Hilton Chicago is a big hotel. It's really big. But the service level of the staff make the Hilton Chicago seem like a boutique hotel. The staff is friendly and highly attentive. Ditto for the restaurant and bar staff. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Yes, it's an older hotel. It's an old fashioned decor throughout the property. However, to escape the weather of Chicago (summer or winter) and enjoy excellent views of Lake Michigan or downtown, this hotel offers travelers an excellent choice. Given the physical size of the hotel and the number of people staying here on a busy night, there can be a considerable wait for elevators. Unless you are running late for an engagement, a long wait for the elevators is a minor inconvenience considering the positive aspects of this property. One word of caution if you choose to use the "L" (public transport elevated train) to transfer from O'Hare to the hotel (use the "Blue" train line), the closest "Blue" stop is "Jackson." Despite the appearance of proximity to the hotel, getting off at Jackson with more than one bag does not make for easy walking distance to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and historic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RandPEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Chicago was made more special by staying front and center at this lovely hotel. The service was awesome, we even got upgraded to a suite which was very comfortable. The beds were supremely comfortable, the bathroom was not very big as you would expect in an older hotel, but they had been nicely updated. We could access amazing restaurants and great jazz clubs and walk everywhere from this great location. You really get a taste of the Chicago of the 1930s when you stay here. We really loved it. We got a package that included parking and breakfast which was really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: Barb826
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Chicago Hilton this past weekend! It was St. Patrick's day weekend and the hotel lobby was packed and the check in line was rather long. We were very fortunate for my boyfriend's Gold Hilton Honors membership because that got us in the Hilton Honors line! We walked right up to the counter and got checked in. Our room was on the 23rd floor and we had a beautiful view of Lake Michigan! The room itself was not very large. The bathroom was a nice size and both were very clean. The hotel lobby area is absolutely beautiful, but overall, we found the hotel to be a bit dated and it can use some renovations! The location is good....depending on what you want to do. We were able to walk to Adler Planetarium, but it was definitely a $10 cab ride to the Water Tower/John Hancock area for the 2 of us. We enjoyed the Hilton Honors Hospitality suite (for Gold members...I think!) in the morning. They served coffee, juices, cereal, bagels/toast, muffins, fruit, hard boiled eggs. In the afternoon, they served snacks and soda, etc. We never seemed to be around for the evening refreshments, but we were able to take a few cans of soda and I did get some popcorn one day too! A few issues that caused some disappointment... 1. When we received our bill, were over charged by $100 for the nightly rates. Thankfully, my boyfriend had his reservation printed off showing the rates he booked for each night. However, we should not have had to have this proof. When the woman at the desk rectified the bill, she never apologized. She just simply said, "OK...it's taken care of." We expected at least an "I'm sorry for your inconvenience." This was rather disappointing. 2. We had parking included as part of the package. However, when we went to leave, the ticket that was supposed to be validated for us wouldn't work. So, there we were in the garage...gate would not go up! So, my boyfriend pushed the "help" button and explained the problem. The man asked for his name and our room number to verify with the hotel. Without missing a beat, my boyfriend responded. After verifying that we already paid for the parking, they still sent a guy to check my boyfriend's id! We thought this was a bit much. Getting out of the parking garage took much too long. It honestly shouldn't be so difficult! 3. My boyfriend had asked for 2 Champagne glasses to be left in our room one day. When we got back to our room, it had been cleaned, but there were no glasses. He was trying to surprise me...and they blew it. It was a simple request they agreed to and it didn't happen. After the second request, the manager brought him the glasses. Again...no apology. Although our 3 issues weren't a real big deal, they were just a few things we don't expect to face with Hilton. Or rather, when things don't go exactly as planned or as they should, a simple apology would go a long way. We really aren't unreasonable people, but when we didn't get any acknowledgment from the staff on their mistakes, it became a bigger disappointment to us. This is why we would have to say that our stay was good...but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great View but need renovation”
Reviews.Author: yayatran
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Chicago for St. Partrick's day weekend. When we check in, it was long line but no waiting. The receptionist, he said he will give us corner room with king size bed in 15 FL. We were very happy to get that room with great view of Michigan.Until we got to the room, there is a door to connect the next room. We can hear everything that family talking from the other side of the door. I was kinda disappointed and annoying. I do love exterior of building, however, they should renovate everything inside of building especially the elevators and carpets and drapes from the window. Elevator was too old; I thought I was riding the Twilight elevator from Theme Park. Hotel is located in South Michigan so you need to take either bus or Taxi to go all the action from North Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay and service”
Reviews.Author: MMD198
Reviews.Content: We had great service from the staff. We found the lobby staff friendly and knowledgeable about the history of the hotel. Our room was a bit on the small side, but we loved the 2 bathrooms. Service at Kitty O'Shea's and the restaurant were great, the conceirge booked us into some great restaurants in the area for suppers. My only bug a bear was the cost of internet service AND the fact that there is not wireless in the conference rooms. It is a rare presenter nowadays that doesn't need internet for their presentation. There needs to be wireless throughout the hotel AND it needs to be a more reasonable fee charge - regardless of the "support" for internet provided it is simply FAR too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; lovely historic building”
Reviews.Author: kentisland
Reviews.Content: We had none of the "bad service" experiences of some other reviewers. Check in was fast, hotel staff we had interactions with were friendly. We had one of the 2 bathroom rooms, and that made the stay even more comfortable and convenient. The room was small but nicely appointed. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub (actually 2 hot tubs). I agree with other reviewers that the $45 for parking was ridiculous, and probably would have bothered me more if we hadn't gotten a good rate on Hotwire. Walking distance to quite a few good restaurants, quick cab ride to McCormick Conference Center and other places. A lovely big-city hotel and if you can snag a good rate, all the better.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to hilton name - bad service”
Reviews.Author: gjnbln
Reviews.Content: Typically, I think of hilton having good customer service. Not at this location. First off, I dropped my wife, kids, and luggage off at the front since I wanted to go park on my own and save $20 a night. (btw....if you park behind the hilton, it's $25 bucks a day versus $45 in the Hilton). I asked my wife to check in for us. She waited in line for 10 minutes, and then I received a call. She told me they would not check her in since it's under my name. I asked her to put them on the pnone, and she said they would not talk with me. 3 minutes later, I walked in and by then they had already moved on to the next customer. Of course, I was mad, but I figured I could handle waiting in line for a few minutes. Then, another line started to form as many people began to arrive at once. I realized we were all standing in the Hilton Honors line, and others were entering on the main line. So of course, the clerks started helping those people just arriving in the other line (not the Hilton honors line) before us! Why are there two lines and if so, shouldn't they be helping us in hilton honors line first regardless (i'm not sure most people noticed the difference in lines and no one was helping funnel traffic). So there were 3 desk clerks to help the 20 people in line. I thought they were short staffed for such a nice hotel. Of course, there were 7 bellmen waiting to grab our luggage! Maybe they should switch up their staffing and prioritze what guests really want? fast, speedy check ins after long drives in traffic. When I got to the clerk, I told her it was rediculous that my wife couldn't check us in? She never even asked for ID to see if the same address and last name? Also, I put a sign on some pizza boxes to throw away each day, and they never threw them away. the bar (not the irish place) has sllow service too! Overall, a nice looking hotel with horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Too much money for too little service”
Reviews.Author: Excalibur_NYC
Reviews.Content: No question that the hotel is nice looking. I saw a lot of mentions of this in a quick skim of other reviews. Yes, the aesthetics are great. But the greed is out of control. $200+ per night is not unusual these days. But it would be nice if that came with something more than just a bed. Took nearly 10 minutes to get the TV to show TV programming. It had level after level of sales pitches that you had to get through. They wanted to sell you movies, hotel food, other services (because NONE are included!). Wi-Fi Access was $15 a day! Seriously?? Even if it's not included (which, for the price one is paying, it should be) at least don't gouge for it. $5 is not sufficient? I showed our Hilton Honors membership card and they said "if you were a Diamond Member, maybe we could do something about the Wi-Fi". Maybe? And only top tier? So, where's the Honor in Hilton Honors? What am I getting in return for my continued patronage of this chain? I have traveled around the world and stayed in all sorts of places. This is the first hotel I've experienced that did not (and would not) provide bottled water for morning coffee. Yes, they did provide a coffee maker. But we shouldn't have to make it with tap water. Every other hotel I've stayed at in the last 10+ years has provided water for drinking and making coffee. All hotels have late check-ins and early check-outs. No problem. It makes sense. So of course you just ask them to hold your bags before and / or after your stay while you do other things. EVERY hotel does it. Hilton Chicago did also. But they charged $2 per item. I can understand charging extra for everything when you're a small place charging $65 a night. A hotel that is part of one of the biggest chains in the world, charging full price (and we are "members", no less) shouldn't have to nickel and dime guests to death. I'm sure there are plenty of other places in the area that are nice and make you feel good about your stay. Doris Amidei, Manager at Hilton Chicago, responded to this review March 7, 2012 Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for taking the time to share your comments. It was a pleasure to receive your comments and to learn of your appreciation of the Hilton Chicago. We are always delighted when we hear we have a nice looking hotel. It appears as we fell short in meeting and exceeding your expectations especially, as it relates to the water, TV, internet & baggage charges and for this, we sincerely apologize for any disappointment this may have caused. As for the internet charges and other hotel fees, please be assured, the Hilton Chicago works hard to offer guests one of the most competitive pricings for the downtown area. We understand staying connected is important, and that as a business traveler internet service is critical to getting work done, we have dedicated our hardwire and wireless systems to run off a 100-Meg Metro E Circuit. Powered by AT&T when purchasing any internet services you will also receive onsite technical assistance along with 24-hour technical support via our help line. We truly hope you will allow us the opportunity to service you again, as we look forward to many more years of serving you in the true spirit of hospitality for which Hilton Hotels are known. Sincerely, Damien G. McArdle Hotel Manager Dear Doris / Damien (canâ€™t even be sure who was writing that). The rest of it was equally confusing. I say how disappointed I am and they essentially indicate that I shouldnâ€™t feel that way and that they hope Iâ€™ll be back. Why on earth would I?? There are 87 hotels in the area with better ratings. I think Iâ€™d try each of them before going back to Chicago Hilton. I have been a Hilton Honors member for years. Not much â€œhonorâ€� going on. It is a loyalty program and certainly *they* are showing no loyalty. I think their attitude (nickel and dime customers to death on top of a fairly high nightly rate) is already a poor one. But when they donâ€™t offer any improved services for â€œmembersâ€� thatâ€™s even more messed up. EVERYTHING in this place is extra. Health club, Internet, bag check, etc. The fact that Iâ€™d get tech support with $15 per day Wi-Fi fee is not a consolation. I donâ€™t need tech support. I just need a connection. I like it in my room. Iâ€™m not paying $200 a night to go sit in the lobby. If youâ€™re going to charge extra for every single thing, then cut the nightly rate in half! Donâ€™t just ask me to feel differently. Give me better service and cause me to feel differently.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for dental convention”
Reviews.Author: techiebug
Reviews.Content: This is the third year we stayed here. The rooms are adequate. Convenience to the convention was key for us. We are usually there just for sleeping. We asked for a corner room, and it faced the essex hotel, and the park. This year, had a back problem, and was in the room most of the first day. There was some construction, but not loud. Maid was extremely polite, offered to clean up and pick up, yet was not pushy. I was just not interested. There were 3 conventions staying there. Check in was a bit congested. There is no way around the valet parking. Felt great to have a security guard posted at the front door at night. Beds were comfortable. Did not attempt the fitness room or pool this year, although I believe there is a charge. Love the kitty o'sheas wings-they're hot! and the homemade chips with dip. Fish and chips was ok. The gift shop had some interesting pieces from local artists. Nice to wander through. The breakfast at 720 was great. Fresh fruit, serviced immediately. Yes, there are other choices, yet for us it works great for the convention. BE SURE to walk down the street and check out the bean.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vipercincy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to the Field Museum,Art Museum, and the Shed. I asked for an upper floor at check-in and the lady was very accomidating. The room was larger than most hotels, and very clean. Join the rewards club before you go and go to Spothero.com this will save you on parking and most hotel fees. Staff is first class and always helpfull. Yoke is two blocks south for breakfast. Also purchase a City Pass to save half on admistions.

Reviews.Title: “just too big”
Reviews.Author: abcpoet
Reviews.Content: heating that doesn't work, sinks missing pieces, ragged carpets and wallpaper--and worst of all, windows that face other wings of the hotel: no daylight on the plus side, the staff is great and helpful but i would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Hidden Costs!”
Reviews.Author: professorBgirl
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the room was fine--very clean and elegant--and the hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. However, let me give you a summary of the "hidden costs" of this hotel. 1. $14.95 per day to use the wireless internet 2. $25.00 for your stay to use the fitness center, unless you are a "silver or gold" hilton honors member. 3. In-room movie 16.95 PLUS 3.00 tax that will show up on your bill so it's actually 19.00 4. "Hotel City Tax" $7.43 per night 5. "Hotel State Tax" $19.64 per night 6. IF you park here--$45.00 PER DAY (I did not park here, thank god) So, if you are planning to stay here just remember to read the fine print and undestand that you will be paying all these other charges. I stayed here for a conference but now wish that I'd shopped around a little more carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historical Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: vacateKnoxville_TN
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago is a great old hotel with alot of character and charm. I stayed there for a week with my wife for a work conference/couples getaway and really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is a landmark and convieniently located in front of the transit line which will cheeply and quickly take you to the miracle mile or in our case Wrigley Field. The hotel is within walking distance to most major attractions, the peir, sears tower, miracle mile, etc. if you dont mind a good walk. The hotel is just what you would expect from a Hilton, clean, comfortable, and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: IwaRuggerBuggerIowa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a perfect location. I recently visited Chicago to attend a Convention at the McCormick Cent and feel like The Hilton is a winner. I love this place! It's a bit outdated but still has a lot of charm. The new renovations make this hotel better for business travellers. They updated their restaurant and added a shop where people like myself an grab a Red Bull or coffee. I love it. I highly recommend the Hilton for anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Conference winner”
Reviews.Author: patio53
Reviews.Content: If this hotel is on your conference/business schedule and you are sharing with someone, snap it up. Or, if you are a couple for whom the idea of two bathrooms and two closets sounds wonderful, book it. This is a grand old Chicago hotel that has been rejuvenated without losing its charm. The foyer is a tribute to bygone days, with beautiful murals, grand staircases and lovely chandeliers. There are plenty of spaces to meet with people, both formally and informally. Check-in moved promptly and the generous supply of elevators took us quickly to our double room. There were two comfortable beds with plenty of pillows, two closets with enough hangers and two bathrooms. The caveat is that the bathrooms don't have a lot of counter space, but there are two. The hotel is quiet, all the staff is friendly and there are lots of meal options. The cafe serves Starbucks coffee along with tasty food options. The macaroni & cheese was really good. There is the typical coffee shop and an Irish pub as well. We found the hotel to be more centrally located than guidebooks indicated. It is across the street from the park and it's only two blocks to State St. It's also a short walk to the Art Institute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a few problems!”
Reviews.Author: cyclopsina
Reviews.Content: The good is very good here! My daughter and I stayed here for two nights to visit University of Chicago and Northwestern. We had Lake Michigan view room with two double beds and two bathrooms. The room had just recently been remodelled. - so it was really large, beautiful, clean and comfortable. We slept very well - the hotel is quiet. Of course - the lobby is stunning, and not to be missed. I understand that some floors have not been remodelled yet, so get a remodelled room! We were up in time to see the sunrise over Lake Michigan - WOW!! We also used the fitness center - has an indoor track, every weight machine, cardio machine or other equipment you could ask for. The cardio machines have individual tv screens! If you are driving, it is easy to get to the major arterials and freeways from this location. Several tourist locations are within walking distance - the Art Institute is a few blocks away. There are always taxis in front of the hotel. We were unfamiliar with the city the first night there, so instead of driving, we took a cab - it was $7 (before tip) each way to go to our destination, so very reasonable. The two complaints - hotel parking is ridiculously expensive. Almost $50 a night? Are you kidding?! However, there are several paid parking lots in the block behind the hotel for $20 - $25 a night. We used these. Complaint two - charging for wifi? I have a data plan for my phone, but the Hilton service blocked it so I had to leave the building to get my data. Really really annoying. I think this hotel would be one of the best in Chicago if they adjusted their data policy, and made parking a more reasonable price. This is the reason I'm giving only three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel With Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JanLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's location and also because we wanted to stay in a nice hotel since it was our wedding anniversary. I know it was a restored hotel and so I was not expecting a modern room. What I was not ready for was the size of the room - it was tiny! I almost felt claustrophobic when I walked in (I am not exaggerating). Next time we visit Chicago, we are not going to be paying a premium to stay in such a small room. On the upside, the hotel was beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Great location for College Visits”
Reviews.Author: FunFamily04
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in the past and I love it. We paid a little extra for two double beds with two bathrooms. Room and bathrooms were spotless and beds were comfortable although small. We were in town with our high schooler to visit Roosevelt University and Columbia College. This hotel is the perfect location as it is about two-three blocks away from both campuses. We had drinks in Kitty O'Sheas which is located inside the hotel, great service and paid what you would expect in Chicago. My only issue is we paid $45 for overnight parking (pretty standard) but they charged me an additional $26 for ONE HOUR over the allowed 24 hrs. I tried to get them to waive the $26 but no luck. Otherwise, I think this is a beautiful property and I love it's history.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickeyWest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times before but the recent renovations have added to the atmosphere and efficiency of this hotel. It's very clean with welcoming professional management & employees. Kitty O'Sheas is a stand out place for me, being Irish makes me biase but anyone of various creed and colour all seem to have enjoyed themselves while my wife and I were there. Eamonn Brady from Kilkenny and Ronan Dalton from Tullow, Co Carlow, Ireland are a credit to both the Hilton & Towers but also to that sincere Irish Welcome that only the Irish can do well.... I'm not being over the top here I hope but if anyone reads this and are visiting Chicago in the future they should definitely stop by and visit Kitty's.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of history, great location, needs some updates”
Reviews.Author: divelovers
Reviews.Content: I love old restored hotels and I understand that may mean you give something up in exchange...a small bathroom, leaky windows (air), or musty smells. I wish that the Hilton change would commit more resources to this beautiful property. Bathrooms are circa 1985. Carpets about the same. Linens and tech updates were more current to Hilton standards. I attended a conference with about 12,000 colleagues that converged on the city. The Hilton staff was wonderful considering the sudden increase in numbers. The maze of meeting spaces on the 4th floor were difficult. The large group areas were gorgeous and true to their history. Overall, Hilton should do more with this gem. It could be a destination in and of itself if they chose to make it such.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: beachbride0811
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a business meeting and have traveled to many other Hilton properties, I was looking forwared to this meeting. Unfortunately I was disappointed. Seems like the rooms need an upgrade. Upon checking into my room, I was taken aback by the strong smell of cigarette smoke. I immediately switched rooms and was statisfied with my new room. The biggest problem with this hotel is the location. You have to take a cab everywhere, very inconvenient!

Reviews.Title: “Expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago has a lot of history, and they teach you that in the elevator with small TV screens. I was expecting more based on the history, but it seemed to be an old hotel with some fix-ups. Check-in was fast as a Diamond member, and I was upgraded to the Executive Floor. Unfortunately, the room was less impressive.. very small. They've obviously tried to make it more than it really is. The bathroom had marble and gold-plated fixtures, but still appeared old and boring. THe most annoying thing was a computer monitor with some new touch-screen features that kept coming on at 4 AM to wake me up despite my attempts to turn it off (there was no "off" button). While it was great to have 2 phones in such a small room, the cordless phone didn't work at all. I always love coffee makers in the room, but they didnt refill my coffee one day. The beers were $7 in the bar. I could buy a 6-pack for the cost of one beer. Parking was very expensive. Definitely not worth the expense of this hotel. Next time, I'll try the Palmer Hilton. It's just as far to the darn convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Good but extra charges are annoying”
Reviews.Author: biophiliac
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice room facing Michigan Avenue. The location is excellent (although just getting into the less desirable section of Michigan Ave.) and in general the hotel is comfortable and has character. But it bugs me that they charge a high price each day for internet and, even more annoying, for bottled water. They display this large bottle of water as if it's your welcome and then charge ($8?) for it. Seems like very bad PR.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Jill W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction during our stay, so the side lobby was cordoned off by plastic draping. The main lobby however, was very impressive. The room was comfortable, but VERY small. We had a king-sized bed which allowed for what seemed like one foot of room on either side of the bed. Very tight!

Reviews.Title: “Excessive Gym Charges”
Reviews.Author: R P
Reviews.Content: $15/day charge for gym ($25/week) and no warning of fee. Water never really got hot. Otherwise hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't like this place”
Reviews.Author: rikwynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sterile, unfriendly and every time I check in here I feel like I'm in a machine. I've stayed here 3 times for conventions and almost every time here I get sick when I'm here I'm convinced their HVAC system pumps dirty air into all the rooms. The C pushes lukewarm into the room all winter and the tiny rooms are just not comfortable. Good luck printing a boarding pass in the lobby - they have some kind of crazy computer system that doesn't work. And get this, they charge you like $18 for Internet in the rooms for EACH device you use. Isn't that nice? Very hospitable. Won't stay here again. The Marriott Miracle Mile is a much nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Doyouknowwhatitmeans
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Hilton on south Michigan avenue. There is a good breakfast bar in the morning, with a small irish pub/restaurant on the corner inside. Very good service. It was renovated some years ago, but still in decent shape. The lobby and entrance are very impressive. I'm sure the executive suites are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic!”
Reviews.Author: FBINA
Reviews.Content: What a majestic hotel with history throughout! I was there on a business trip and was amazed at the hotel's grander, the historic peacock doors designed by Tiffany, and the hand painted ceiling. More importantly, the rooms were perfect, the staff great, and the quietness throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Sonyacm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 night at this Hilton which is across the street from legends where we went to see buddy guy, Its a elegant hotel which was used in the movie the fugitive and the building in ww11 was used for the Army before it had been a Hotel, Nice staff, clean rooms the beds and were very comfortable, just wished they had bottled water in rooms !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovenyc0886
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in December, and we both we very impressed! It's a great hotel with the staff being very very helpful and rooms very lovely! Great value for money! A little bit of a walk down the magnificent mile but not too much! The Irish pub on the ground level is also great, affordable with a good menu! Definately would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatsyCha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real classic , many original features and you have to look in on the ballroom/function room. Many celebs have stayed here . The rooms at the front have amazing views and the prices for such a wonderful hotel are reasonable . Staff extremely helpful and in a good location. I have stayed here 4 times on visits from the U.K

Reviews.Title: “great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie3446
Reviews.Content: This is what you would expect in a Hilton in a world class city. The Hotel is a classic extremely well kept building. The lobby and facilities are impeccable and the staff is helpful. The wait staff in the irish pub was knowledgeable about both the food and the city and provided some great tourist advice. Even though I now live in Illinois I have not been here long so I still need advice when visiting the city. I was there for a very large convention at McCormick Place and the hotel was close and travel back and forth was easy. There is plenty to do around the hotel both within walking distance or a short cab drive away. The basic rooms are a little tight, but that is the norm for older city hotels so it was not a surprise. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were well appointed. I don't that you would be disappointed by your stay here. It is not cheap but its Michigan Ave...what were you expecting?

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: HHTn
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for a conference and stayed at this hotel, which happened to be one of the main conference sites. I was pleased with my choice. The year before, I had stayed at the InterContinental on Michigan Ave, and I was much happier with this hotel. Not only was it convenient, but I was surprised that the room was quite large for a city hotel. The bathroom was also a good size. The size of the room/bathroom was very different than the room I had at the InterContinental. Although there were many people at the conference/hotel, I never had to wait long for an elevator. I believe that there are 3 groups of hotels, each of which goes up to different groups of floors of the hotel. The only aspect of this hotel that I didn't enjoy was that the corridors felt a bit closed-in. There weren't windows on the floor on which my room was located, and because the ceiling is not high, it seemed a bit claustrophobic. I had requested a room on a higher floor, and the hotel granted my wish, but once I went up to my room, I regretted my choice because of the closed-in feeling. (If I recall correctly, my room was on the 25th floor.) If you are at all claustrophobic, I would recommend requesting a room on a lower floor. At least that way, you don't have to deal with the closed-in feeling of the hallway and an elevator ride.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSP1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed their a while back ago and enjoyed the stay very much. Rooms were very nice and luxurious for the price. The lobby and bottom floor had a nice old style elegance to it. The pool was very nice and large for a hotel and was nice to have 2 Jacuzzi at the pool. However the pool hours weren't the greatest, they closed at 9:00pm! I found out later the reason why they closed was because they allowed the public to come in if they payed a fee for the gym and pool. I they need to drop that and extend the pool hours for their guest, not the public. Also when we first arrive the guy outside in charge of calling for a valet and bell boy was VERY rude. All we wanted to do was to park the car their and run in and check in real quick but he would let us and pretty much started to yell at us about it. Their was Plenty of room for cars, so their shouldn't have been a problem, but the guy made a federal case out of it. But other than the pool ours and the guy outside, it was a very good and pleasant stay. The rest of the staff was helpful, kind and very nice!

Reviews.Title: “A classic Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: birdsley14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Cubs Convention and were for the most part pleased. The hotel definitely has some old-world charm to it. The lobby and the grand hall are both very nice. All of the convention spaces were very nice. The rooms here are all relatively small due to the age of the building. We stayed on the executive floor and the room had everything we needed including a computer for our use. We also had access to the executive lounge, which was nice, but a little understaffed. Food items frequently ran out. The food and drink options were somewhat limited, but it was ok for being a free add-on. I have no complaints whatsoever about hte view from our room. We were 21 floors up with a great view of lake Michigan, Grant Park, Millenium Park, and Michigan Ave. We could see from navy Pier to Soldier Field and everything inbetween. It was awesome. One final note is that the walls in this place are thin. We had a room the adjoined another and we could hear the people in the other room talking all night.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SometimesSkiing
Reviews.Content: Visiting Chicago for business conference. Very well appointed hotel, what you would expect for a upmarket Hilton establishment. I found it very close to everything and you could walk to the city centre or to the conference centre very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jamreg7
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after a successful $99 "name your own price" bid on Priceline. The hotel was categorized as a 5-star on Priceline. It is definitely not a 5-star. Here's our assessment: Room: The room had two full-size beds and two bathrooms. Yes, the decor is very outdated, but that didn't bother us much. The flat screen TV was good. Our two biggest complaints were noise and cleanliness. I found numerous black hairs in my sheets and duvet cover. I realize they can probably creep in during the laundry process, but this seemed like an excessive number. The bed was not comfortable, and the carpet didn't appear to be vacuumed well. A large wedding reception was going on while we were there, and we heard the loud music into the wee hours of the morning. Perhaps our room was facing a ballroom; I'm not sure. The architecture in the main lobby and ballrooms was definitely worth seeing. Location: We liked the location very much, and we walked everywhere (lakefront trail, Grant Park, Adler Planetarium, restaurants, Metra). The Harrison Metra station is very close. Be sure to get a daily/weekly pass at the CVS across the street; it will save you a lot of money. Lou Malnatis and Yolk (great breakfast) are just a short walk. Jimmy Green's was also a decent place for watching sports. Service: We arrived around 10:30 p.m. and asked for a room with two bathrooms. The front desk agent didn't seem too thrilled with the request but did change our room free of charge. The Wi-Fi is pretty expensive. I wasn't pleased when I noticed an extra $10 charge on my Visa card several days after being home. When I called Hilton, they said we were charged for drinking one of their Smart waters in our room, which was not at all true. They refunded me after I clearly denied drinking the water. Several other reviewers noted being "nickel and dimed" here. I wouldn't stay here again. I'd rather pay a little more money for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Business_Traveler_MI
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids enjoyed two nights at the Chicago Hilton. Very pleasant staff. Nice room. It was not busy and that likely improved our experience. Walked to Shedd Aquarium. Used HHonors points so the value for us was great. Only complaint was the noise on day of departure while there was renovations in an adjoining room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: southamericandude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last winter and it wasnt bad, the rooms are small but comparing with other hotels in downtown Chicago they are bigger. The hotel is an average hotel of its class. It is close to the buckingham fountain(from married with children tv show). When we were there it was cold and they turn off the fountain and we had to take a taxi to go to the restaurant on the top of the Hancock tower. I would stay again in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but forgettable”
Reviews.Author: Snowkarver
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here alone for a convention, and while this hotel offers comfortable enough accommodations and a central location on Michigan Avenue close to Millennium Park, there are many other options that I would personally consider first, especially for leisure travel. The property is old and full of character, which means grand old marble staircases and an impressively ornate ballroom, but also long, dimly-lit corridors and waiting areas that make it seem tired and hard to navigate. Guest rooms are on the small side, and while a valiant effort has been made to keep things fresh, many of the fixtures and furnishings are outdated and in need of renovation. I stayed on an Executive floor, and compared to other concierge levels including those offered by Fairmont, Pan Pacific, or Westin, it was really nothing to write home about, and not worth the additional cost in my opinion. Staff barely recognized or acknowledged that I was a premium guest, and the lounge was closer to the breakfast room at an upscale motel rather than a true executive lobby. Neither the primary in-house restaurant (more of a pub) or room service were noteworthy either - good enough, but completely forgettable and somewhat overpriced. My stay was fine for a solo, expense-account business trip, but if I were spending my own money and travelling either as a couple or with my family, I would seriously consider spending just a little more to stay at one of the newer hotels a little further up Michigan Avenue, closer to Navy Pair and the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Two beds - two bathrooms: GOOD DEAL!”
Reviews.Author: PDCE-85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and had to share a room with a colleague. But as it turned out, not only did the 'suite' have two double beds, but also two bathrooms, which made everything a lot easier. The room was pretty small, but nicely appointed in citified Hilton style. Well located, right on Michigan Avenue, (about a 10 minute walk from the train) the lower public areas are pretty impressive, with big marble staircases, et al. The coffee bar (serving Starbucks brew) drew a long line every morning, but that was still a better option than the typical $20 hotel breakfast. I'll NEVER get over paying so much for internet access in full service hotels, and don't stay in such places enough to achieve Gold status so I don't have to. That said, in the category of big city hotel stays, this was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Ok accomadations & service”
Reviews.Author: cubusinesstraveler01
Reviews.Content: Frequent traveler who has stayed at this hotel twice for conventions. Choose to stay for a family trip to Chicago anf was very dissapointed with lack of service from staff and noise from construction/renovations in hotel. Will not stay again at this location when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kimkfarm
Reviews.Content: This expansive, ornate hotel provided a lovely stay for my husband and I over a weekend in early December 2011. The rooms are tasteful, quiet and comfortable, and the staff is efficient and pleasant. Just a few blocks south of Millenium Park and the Art Institute, Hilton Chicago is also close to many of Chicago's architectural treasures, as well as to the train from Midway. Conveniences such as the pharmacy, liquor store and a Trader Joe's are also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “From okay to great”
Reviews.Author: jermmom
Reviews.Content: The check-in attendant was delightful. We were given a room on the 20th floor which is not on the exec level. Rowdy teenagers kept me up all night so I requested a room change and was moved to the exec 25th ( I am Hilton Gold). What a difference! It was so much nicer, it made the inconvenience of moving worth the trip. It looks like all the guestrooms will eventually be brought up to exec level standards. I love having two bath rooms which is an option the Palmer House offers as well. Not a long walk to the Orange line which brings you right to Midway.

Reviews.Title: “No free internet!”
Reviews.Author: PolarBear777
Reviews.Content: Amazing and well preserved hotel. Rooms and public areas are well kept and of high quality. Location is a bit away from the busier areas of downtown, but still walkable to Grant Park and close to an L station. I really liked this hotel, but the major downside was that there was no free internet, not even in the lobby. This is the only reason I wouldnâ€™t stay here again â€“ everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE THIS HOTEL IS DOING MAJOR WORK ON GUEST ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: teafree
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night of December 22, 2011. We were there for a party in the hotel that was slated to finish at 2am. The party was magnificent and the hotel is perfect for any grand party. After all Queen Elizabeth had a dinner for 7000 people here during her tour of America in 1951, who could resist- it is a magnificent room and the stairs and the halls around the ballroom are perfect for any dramatic event. BUT the hotel knowing that we would probably get to bed very late put us on the 15th floor- BEWARE the four floors below us were under serious construction and at 7:30!!! AM the jack hammering, sawing and banging began. WOW if this were a New York apartment building the workmen wouldn't be allowed in the door before 9:30. What are they thinking? The hotel manager, after my calling at 7:30, 8:30 and 9:30 did take off all the room charges and the room service charges which I feel was fair. But be warned: do ask all about the construction and where it is and WHY it starts at 7:30AM!! before you book a room here. Now that being said. We had tea in the Irish pub and it was probably the only time in the US that I have had a proper cup of tea rather than a pot- they actually put the teabag into the cup before the boiling water! The breakfast was also wonderful. Not a prepackaged piece of butter or jam in sight- both in their own individual small container and delicious jam it was. A lovely breakfast. Our room service dinner was very good too. So top marks for the catering. We also had a charming view of the lake. Fantastic location next to the lake. So on every other level this was a wonderful hotel. Just beware and I hope the construction ends before your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, great location, updates needed”
Reviews.Author: AKurt
Reviews.Content: This grand hotel is full of history and is a visual treat. It is also massive with 1000s of rooms. I was glad to see some renovation was in the works and hope more is coming. The rooms I believe were last updated in the 1980s and it shows but not to say they weren't acceptable. I wouldn't stay here if having an ultra modern room was the goal. No, you stay here for the location and the lake views and the historic feel. The grand ballroom is a must see. The front desk was friendly and even upgraded us to the executive lounge when we checked in. Anything Hilton can do to make it feel less of a massive hotel would be encouraged. I think everyone should check this hotel out at least once.

Reviews.Title: “A solid stay at a Grande Dame... mind the renovations, though.”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three night stay with Mrs. Gardiner and Kiddo. Upgraded to a very, very nice suite. Weâ€™d stayed here (all 3 of us) in 2005 for a large conference, and they needed a renovation thenâ€¦ Well, renovation now partially completed. (More on that later) Our room was terrific, well appointed and clean. Beds were comfy, and flat screen tvs were nice. That said, there were touch screen computers on the desks, and access to anything of value was behind a firewall. At check-in, I was given instructions for wifi (which worked great), but the desk computers are clearly designed to be little profit centres. Please, donâ€™t throw fancy tech at me and then give me a choice between my tech for free or your tech for costâ€¦ youâ€™re going to lose. I used the USBs for charging ports, but nothing more. Couldnâ€™t even get weather on themâ€¦ which I CAN get at a Courtyardâ€¦ Also, I was disappointed that in a 2-room suite there was NOT an in-room safe. You got two mini-bars and a dorm fridge in there, but no in-room safe. Big omission for a property of this caliber. Then (and I write this first half of Dec 2011) they had only ONE restaurant open, and that was Kittyâ€™s Pubâ€¦ Either they have spent enormous amounts of money to hire Disney to engineer and recreate an authentic, dark, grungy, dirty, well worn Irish pub, or they have a dark, grungy, dirty, well worn pub that badly needs to be renovated. We ate there one evening, and certainly never went backâ€¦ Kiddo had dinosaur chicken fingers and mashed potatoesâ€¦ they didnâ€™t even get those right. There were four adults and one Kiddo for dinner, and NONE of us finished our dinner. Jeepers. So, until they have other food options, be aware of this. (Nice looking restaurant reno across from Front Desk, but thatâ€™s only open for Breakfast, so youâ€™re at their mercy for lunch/dinner) In short, a dire lack of in-house dining. Nearby, I can verify that Eleven Deli (Wabash at 11th) was quite good, as was Tamarind (Asian, on Wabash, 200 feet from Hiltonâ€™s porte cochere ). Both are a short walk from the Hilton. (Of course, short walk is a relative term in Chicago in the winterâ€¦) Concierge Lounge was reasonably nice. Evenings had two hot dishes and a full selection of soft drinks and coffees. Wine and Beer selections were available, although they never tell you precisely what wine they served. Also, $8.50 for a glass of unidentified Pinot Grigio was a bit steep when a very nice Kiwi Sauv Blanc was available in the lobby for $9. GM, please help me out hereâ€¦ make me feel like you and Hilton want me back. Breakfast was Continental, with NO hots, no chafing dishes. Big bagel selection, variety of pastries and cerealsâ€¦ Fully acceptable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. I did use the Parcel Shipping Center, and the gentleman there happily taped together two boxes for me, and wouldnâ€™t charge me. Nice. Very nice. So, this was our second visit to this Hilton property. Looks much nicer now, but the lack of restaurants is a serious drawback at this timeâ€¦ If eating in will be important to you, check what is open/finished there. Would I return? Probably so. Iâ€™ve stayed at the Hyatt Regency, the Hyatt McCormick, the Sheraton, the Marriott, the Allerton, and so on. It depends on what I am doing and where I need to be. Yes, Iâ€™d go back, but if location was not an issue, Iâ€™d probably choose further North in the city. It was a good stay, not great... Maybe if F&B had been better, I could've gone with four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Slimsluvbeach
Reviews.Content: Overall very nice hotel. We had gone to the Bears game that weekend and could not have asked for a better location. The Bears players were actually staying here too for the night before the game. The hotel is nice. Rooms a little dated but the common areas are updated and very nice. The only downsides were the parking. The self lot was full so the only option for parking was valet at $55.00 for the night. IF we wanted to park at the hotel, it was the only option. Also the fitness center. You can walk the track or use the pool complimentary but were charged to use the fitness equipment. But overall, it was a great location for what we needed for the weekend and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly faded dowager-I remember when she was queen”
Reviews.Author: MBFW
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights here on a visit to the University of Chicago. Beyond a good S. Michigan location there is little to recommend. The hotel was almost sold out to convention visitors and I checked in later in the day. The first room offered was tiny with a partial view of an interior roof. The staff cheerfully and promptly found me another but it really wasn't much better. The bathroom was tiny, ill-lit and redolent of cigarette smoke from another room....or was the the odor counteractant? One tiny window with an interior view added to the gloom. The walls, furniture and furnishings were tattered and chipped. And it's sad: I have stayed at this hotel for decades; first as an excited young child seeing his first big city, later when searching for a college and still later over holidays with my own young family. It has beautiful bones but faces perhaps insurmountable challenges with too many small rooms and out of date mechanicals.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had more time!”
Reviews.Author: cy1229
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old daughter and I stayed here for one night before I was to give a workshop. We had a 2 double beds / 2 bath room on an executive floor and everything was clean, comfortable, and exactly as we needed it to be. Having 2 bathrooms was a real plus even with just 2 of us on this trip! The executive floor is very much worth the extra amount paid because the continental breakfast is wonderful and the lounge is very nice. Great coffee! It's very easy to get in and out of the hotel but the turns inside the parking garage are VERY tight so you have to be really careful maneuvering around inside it. Desk staff were great and while we were there less than 12 hours, everything was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again, and am considering it for a family trip in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay but could be better”
Reviews.Author: spicykit
Reviews.Content: Great historic hotel (built in 1927's) situated in a very convenient location. However, there is much needed improvement inside the hotel. Our heater is totally broken on our second night and we had engineer came to look into the issue in the morning. But there is no update whatsoever from them to entire day. When I got back from conference at the end of the day, I called the front desk and they have no idea regarding the issues. Eventually they did provide a room switch but communications among the staffs/department is poor. Rooms are bigger compared with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Massive hotel, huge conference centre, dimly-lit rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mutiny
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel on S Michigan Ave and decorated very much in a classic, European style. The location is perfect for the galleries and museums of Chicago, however, a 15-20 minute walk to any significant shopping areas. I was there for a conference and the facilities and amount/variety of rooms are enormous. In terms of accommodation, the rooms are large with big comfy beds, ample working space, and plenty of hanging space with real coat hangers. However, the bathrooms are small with very little space sround the basin for your toiletries. Another down side is that rooms have very small windows for natural light and there are few options to brighten the rooms with light fittings - it feels quite dim in the rooms. I found the staff at the hotel to be friendly and efficient without being obtrusive or obviously hanging around for tips.

Reviews.Title: “whatever happened to the minibar?”
Reviews.Author: ParisFifi
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay in the Hilton Towers in Chicago. Very comfortable bed - where one can really get a good nights sleep. Although the TV screen kept turning itself on every so often duting the night. One of those touch screen ones, I suspect that I wasn't deactivating it properly. But then surely you don't have to read the users manual just to use the TV screen! Other small but strange thing - the minibar was locked and there was just no key to be found. not sure what tthat was all about. Breakfast very good - quality of products and plenty of them. Fresh omelets made to order too which is always welcome. Doormen and bellboys extremely helpful and couteous. I would recommend this hotel - only thing is that its about a 7 dollar taxi ride to the main shopping area. Oh, and a great sushi restaurant can be found just two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing good other than being in downtown”
Reviews.Author: BK-AD
Reviews.Content: Happy that I stayed here for a single night only. The hotel is old, carpets need updates, furniture reminded me of 80's movies and there was nothing charming about the hotel. I was on a business trip and needed a hotel closer to downtown. Nothing other than location is recommendable about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCorrente
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to Chicago to see the Bears play at Soldier Field and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. The hotel was close to the cta (train from O'Hare) station and within walking distance of Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Soldier Field, and so much more. We had a room with a lakefront view. Everything was absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Enwier
Reviews.Content: Hilton Chicago is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The staff were so sweet, the rooms were very comfortable and the view was INSANE! I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of history but that's in the past”
Reviews.Author: herethereneverywhere
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and rooms royally appointed with comfy beds, 6 pillows, a very nice large HD flat screen TV, great toiletries, two airline check-in kiosks and numerous fast elevators etc. Overall if was a fairly good stay BUT there are some drawbacks. I got a room with two bathrooms which was great EXCEPT that when the neighbors on either side took their showers at 6 a.m. the bathroom in my room acted like an echo chamber and made it feel like I was actually in the shower with them. When the folks next door came home one night overly inebriated screaming in the halls and bouncing against the walls (not the hotel's fault) and THEN ran their shower at 4 a.m. for 30 minutes I was NOT a happy camper. The biggest issue was Internet access charges that are about as non-business friendly as it gets. Paying $7.50 for up to an hour for net use is highway robbery to begin with but that's PER DEVICE. Have a pc and an iPad? Ca-ching times two, Even if you just use the Internet for 5 minutes you are charged $7.50. Log on again? Another $7.50 You can opt to pay $14./95/day for unlimited access but again that's per device. If you are staying for 4 or 5 days pay the $39.95 flat rate for up to 5 days, but better yet, if you are like most who just read and respond to 1-2 e-mails at best accessing the net for 10-15 minutes a day, throw yourself at the mercy of the front desk clerk and they may give you a promo code that lets you access the Internet for free. Most of the charges in the gift shops, bars, restaurants etc, are dramatically overpriced but opulence has its price for sure. A couple of gems- Tamarind around the corner on Wabash had incredible food at incredibly low prices. The same can be said for Uncle Henry's Chicken (dont laugh- they have killer fried chicken). Eleven about 4 blocks south had great breakfasts too.The concierge desk was very helpful as were the bell clerks. They could have used more people at he Hilton Honors desk- I am an Honors member but it was faster in the non-Honors line. There is construction going on here too so if you sleep past 8 a.m. you may be outta luck cuz the jackhammers start early... I would stay at the Hilton again for sure BUT they need to get real with Internet charges and I need to make sure I close my bathrooms door. One shower is usually more than enough...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ironman1991
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for walking the Magnificant Mile. The rooms are a different story. The best thing about the rooms are the showers! Great water pressure! The rooms are set in a suite giving you alot of space. After walking the streets all day, it would be great to come back a sit down and relax but the couches are terriblly uncomfortable. The beds are awful, you sink to the middle. The rooms were clean. The housekeeping folks were very friendly, however we did have one come to the door, once to give us the news paper, and then came back twenty minutes later to see if we wanted the room cleaned. In other words, get out so I can get my work done. It was only 8 o'clock in the morning! If you need a cab, you won't have to wait. They are everywhere. The hotel has a restaurant, we didn't try. We did hear the food was good. Checking out was a problem. We were scheduled for a 4 day stay. Somehow someone put us in for 6, we were charged $150 for an "early check out" fee! Pretty bad for a Hilton Gold Card member. Oh yes, there is a beautiful view from the 30th floor, worth the trip up!

Reviews.Title: “More of a Kennel than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allen006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel often, until it became pet friendly. At our visit, there was some kind of dog convention, and there were dogs everywhere, including in the eating area on the concierge level. I complained to the manager who seemed to have no problem at all with this. The reply was, "Dogs are much cleaner than children". The hotel is beautiful - Conrad Hilton's first hotel, purchased from the family of supreme court judge Stevens. Its a shame that this wonderful old hotel is not valued more by Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location across McCormick Park”
Reviews.Author: jkchen1
Reviews.Content: This is one of those classic, old, lots of character hotels. Similiar to the St. Francis on Union Square in San Francisco. Great location across the street from the park and musuems. About 1.5 blocks from the train. Great pool and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: M E
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the marathon weekend in October 2011. First time running the marathon and first time in Chicago. The room was impeccable, comfortable and everything was like brand new. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The service at the front desk was better than I have ever experienced. They accommodated my every request. I needed oatmeal & brown rice heated on a daily basis for my marathon and they supported my requests in the lobby restaurant. The hotel was across the street from the starting line and finish line. This is the best place to stay if you're running the marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Brent L
Reviews.Content: Hotel like this aren't for our budget but we had won gift voucher for a free night stay. So our reservation was arranged on a slow night. The place is great, it is like a palace. The rooms are awesome, and quite a bit of space to do what ever. The staff was very professional with sharp business style clothing. If they see you wondering around a 1000 feet away, they would walk up to you and ask if you needed anything or if they could help in anyway! We were also served food at the discounted price! Overall 500 out 100 for this hotel. If I get too rich, I would probably get a paid room here!

Reviews.Title: “Big room”
Reviews.Author: Voyagian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Chicago during a recent conference. The hotel is classy, clean, and the staff's nice. I like the gym, which is the biggest indoor hotel gym I've ever known. You can run in the park just across the street too. The buffet breatfast is just average. I ordered some books during my stay, and the hotel charged me 10 dollars for each package. I think it's too much.

Reviews.Title: “Classic big city hotel in the grand style”
Reviews.Author: mk14617
Reviews.Content: Plusses: one of the best gyms I've ever seen in a hotel (including a great jogging track and a quasi-olympic indoor pool); great executive floor; historic lobby with many films made there; very comfortable room (mine had two bathrooms! they must have broken a wall down between two tiny rooms to make my average room). Minuses: each of my two bathrooms was small, with a tiny tub/shower; the EL roars even with windows shut; only USA Today, no Wall St. Journal as befits a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional and stuffy.”
Reviews.Author: kminichan
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference in Chicago, located at The Hilton on South Michigan Avenue. I love the city of Chicago and when I travel prefer staying in a hotel that reflects a city, not a historic landmark. If you are looking for traditional and low key, then this hotel will work for you. However, if you are like me and want the modern, upscale, flair of the city, then look for another hotel. This was too expensive for the services that I received. I upgraded to the executive floor and I was glad I did. If you do stay here, I would recommend doing so. Its worth the price of unlimited drinks, snacks, breakfast, and appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Old style charm”
Reviews.Author: Spinefx1
Reviews.Content: Overall hotel is very nice. As others have said somewhat outdated but purposefully. The Hotel has maintained old pictures and interior from the past for a truly retro feel and gives a very nice idea of how it was when the was THE hotel in Chicago. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are good. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I had to use "The Voice"”
Reviews.Author: SineNomine69
Reviews.Content: This was the HQ for a national conference I was attending. Even at the conference rate, this was by no means cheap for me, a retiree. I booked it with my Hilton Honors card and arranged with the hotel itself to pre-pay my total stay over a period of several months prior to my arrival with my credit card. This was a rather laborious procedure involving several telephone calls to talk with someone who actually knew how to initiate such a transaction, monthly faxes, etc. (I quickly learned to simply Xerox one form and send it 5 times - the number of nights I stayed). I took the train to Chicago. As is often Amtrak's wont with long-distance travel, the train arrived 6 hours late at Union Station. I took the cab to the Hilton and, upon checking in, was told all the king-sized bedded rooms had been assigned. It was at this point that I employed "The Voice" - a firm, resonant, and potentially terrifying instrument which had served me well as a 38-year veteran school vocal music teacher. I reminded the young man at the front desk that (1) I was an HHonors member and (2) I had pre-paid the entire rate through Hilton and not some discount travel site and (3) that I had booked the room over 9 months before specifically requesting a king bed. As a salve, he placed me on a Tower Floor with express elevator access. My room was near the elveator bank, had two windows from which I could see Lake Michigan, had two double beds and two full bathrooms thought the furnishings appeared a bit dated. I forget if a morning paper was delivered to me but I got a turn-down chocolate every night. In fact, the nice woman who distributed them started giving me handsful of them as I'd had a chance to chat her up my second evening. The corridor was quiet but one could hear whistles of arriving trains at the nearby South Shore commuter station. The hotel's location was excellent for my needs - an easy walk to The Orchestra Center and the Art Institute and across the street from Grant Park. There are two restaurants. One serves a good buffet breakfast (and buffet lunches and dinners as well) but food ordered off the menu is fresher and hotter and offers a wider choice. Chuck quickly became my waiter-of-choice each morning. He was experienced, efficient, and had a droll sense of humor. At the opposite end of the lobby was one of those typical Hilton cloned Irish pubs which had Guiness, shepherd's pie and what-not. It was adequate, but more guests, I'm sure, would head to Chicago's many appealing and nationally recognized dining destinations. Maid service was timely and unobtrusive. Elevator waits - even on the 2lst floor - rarely exceeded 30 seconds. There are architectural and decorative vestiges of the hotel's older glory days asThe Stevens with historic photos, sweeping staircases, huge chandeliers, and an over-all faux Versailles look to many of the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ILuvtotravel48
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel over Veterans Day weekend. We were there to visit the University of Chicago. The Hilton Chicago is one of the hotels that UChicago recommends and the hotel provides a free shuttle service to and from the university. Our room at the hotel was very nice and very clean. I did not have any issues with the room at all. I ate 3 meals at the hotel and all were very good for the most part. The only complaint that I have is that the food on the breakfast buffet was lukewarm. Other than that, the food was good, and the wait staff was very attentive and friendly. I was greeted at the front desk when I arrived by a very friendly young man who was very helpful in explaining how the shuttle worked and where I could find different things in the hotel. I walked to the magnificent mile from the hotel, and also walked to Soldier Field and the shores of Lake Michigan. The hotel is in a nice safe area. Taxis are always out in front of the hotel so there was never a wait for a taxi. There is a great blues bar right behind the hotel called "Buddy Guy's Legends" and the food was very good and the live entertainment was very good too. We went to the early set from 6PM to 8PM since my son is under 21 and have a great time. There is no cover charge during that time either.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly outdated but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jannaweber
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice but not overly large for a standard 2 full bed room. The windows in my room were blocked by furniture so I couldn't really check out the view. The bathroom was beautiful. I was staying at this hotel for a conference, and I would say it was great for this. There is a lot of history and grander at this hotel as other reviews have mentioned. I've never seen so many chandeliers in one place. Even in the elevators. Overall, fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: ekeller22
Reviews.Content: While the lobby and rooms appear to be above average, we were disappointed with the cleanliness, service, and ammenities. Upon checkin, I informed the clerk that I was a AAA member and showed her my card. She told me it was "too late" to apply the discount. I find this hard to believe, being that things like mini-bars and movie rentals can be added at a later time.. why wouldn't a discount work the same way? The room was comfortable; however, my bathroom had no hair dryer and the tub still had an opened, previously used bar of soap sitting on the edge. It obviously hadn't been cleaned. If I had planned on staying at this hotel for more than one night, I would have left at that point and found another hotel. Additionally, the hotel charges for WiFi, even for HiltonHonors members.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Czar
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest Hilton I've been to. Full of character and history but renovated at some point in the modern era. Beautiful decor, excellent Executive Floor, excellent service, reasonable price point. Overall, a great hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianu73
Reviews.Content: One of the most historic hotels in Chicago. Great bar and location within walking distance of great restaurants and lively bars. Staff couldn't be more helpful and the place oozes class. My room, located on a corner, was spacious and well decorated. The lobby is impressive and loved the historical updates given in the elevator

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: Lauren K
Reviews.Content: The whole bad experience started when I checked in. I was there for a conference and even though the person I was sharing the room with had called and given all the info, they didn't have me down. They didn't give me the code for the complementary wi-fi (otherwise $7.50 per HOUR) and they "forgot" to tell me that although the gym costs something like $40 per day, the indoor track and the pool were free. The food at the casual restaurant was terrible. The room was alright but the sink was tiny with no counter space. The bathroom was very poorly laid out so even though there was room for a double sink, there was only the one small sink and a big empty space w/ no table to put anything on. The night b/f I was checking out, I wanted to print the boarding pass, the computer in the room said you can print it in the room but when I couldn't, I called the front desk they said the computers were down and they would do me a favor and print it out for me if I came down to the desk. I wasn't too happy that I had to go all the way down to the front desk but that was better than what they told my colleague- they told her she should go to the Fed Ex office in the lobby and she would have to PAY to print it. The whole experience was terrible and they have the nerve to charge me $130 per night per person. They do have a beautiful building and central location but they need to do a better job w/ service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay..Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogirl537
Reviews.Content: I was working at a tradeshow and it was easier to stay at the hotel even though I was in my own city. The Hilton Chicago is a huge hotel with beautiful charm and decor in the comon areas. It's definitely a convention hotel so it's an operation, no real warm and fuzzies but I had a great stay. From what I heard from my colleagues, my room was bigger than most because I had a sofa and arm chair in my room and a sitting area. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room had a new flat screen TV and was very clean. The bathroom was a bit dated with an old toilet with a handle flush and a shower with a super small tub. The only thing that was disappointing is that the dresser that the TV sits on is obviously built for a mini bar fridge but when you open that door its empty with just an empty spot where the fridge should be. I had a great dinner one of the nights and I wished I could have brough my left overs home. There isn't a whole lot within walking distance but again, this is a convention hotel so most people staying are here on business. I would definitely stay again and would recommend to others staying on business or those who may need to stay on the south side because of a Bears game, event at Grant Park, etc

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Picky_but_reasonable
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here on business, and found it a great hotel. As some reviews say, it is dated, but the rooms have been upgraded, they are clean, and the food is excellent. I was an incredibly needy traveler this trip (I travel 3 out of 4 weeks a month and usally handle everything in stride) but the serivce folks handled me with aplomb. My first room smelled like smoke (even though it was non-smoking) so they put in an ionizer, and when that didn't help, they upgraded me to the executive floor for free. The bellman helped me move my things and wouldn't take a tip because it was "their fault" and a "terrible inconvenience for me." The room service was fast and very good - albeit a limited menu. And the location was great - I felt safe doing my walks in the morning and evening, there are great restaurants nearby, and a nice path to walk on by the lake. For tourists and business travelers, I would recommend this hotel for the service and location.

Reviews.Title: “A faded classic, sure, but still hanging on to that classic status”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: Granted, work was footing the bill, but I was more than happy with my brief stay at the Hilton Chicago. The service I received checking in and checking out was top-notch...efficient, friendly, helpful. My room was on a corner, at the end of a labyrinthine hallway, overlooking Grant Park and the lake. Some of the fixtures -- in the bathroom especially -- seemed byproducts of the 60s, but the touch screen controlling my music and airline web check-in almost made up for it. My bed was very comfortable, as I've come to expect from a Hilton. Lots of good vs. only a little bad? Considering I didn't even have a choice in where I stayed, I was pretty happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Tired”
Reviews.Author: travelbug90587
Reviews.Content: There's no question that at one time the Hilton Chicago was a grand hotel, however that time has come and gone. We paid $350 for one night in a "lake view" room. The windows were so small and dirty that you could hardly see the lake, not worth the extra money. The wallpaper in the room was depressing, a plastic "moray" pattern that looked it's been there since the 1960's. The carpet was worn and I had to wear my shoes the whole time since I forgot to bring my slippers and I didn't want to go barefoot. The bathroom wasn't too bad, marble counters and floor, lots of towels. The bed was comfortable, but I did worry about bed bugs (I didn't look). I know this hotel is huge and would cost a ton of money to renovate, but it is in dire need of some TLC. I don't plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the action!”
Reviews.Author: flygirl75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my ex for 5 days and the location is amazing. We were in Chicago in August when there are festivals every weekend in Grant Park, and because this hotel is right across from the park, you get the bonus of going to the festivals. Also, there are buses that run up and down Michigan Ave, so it is really easy to circulate. In terms of the hotel itself, check-in staff are super nice and the concierge was great at recommending a tour and pizza restaurant to us. We went on the boat architecture tour and it was amazing, definitely worth the money. The room was a bit small, but we had everything we needed. The king-size bed, as per Hilton's standards, provided a nice sleep. We tried out the hotel gym, where you can get a 3-day pass. It's a bit pricey, but the gym is well-equiped for a hotel. We saw non-hotel guests working out with their trainers, that's how nice the gym is. The only complaint I have is that the bathroom could have been cleaner and the area where the coffee maker was, needed upgrading (the outlet was falling out of the wall). All in all, I would recommend this hotel to couples, families and anyone looking to do sightseeing and shopping. The sights were very close to the hotel, including the Museum Campus.

Reviews.Title: “Has its own charm”
Reviews.Author: Pngster
Reviews.Content: Stayed briefly at this establishment for a meeting. It had reliable, albeit pricey, internet connection, and efficient service at check-in/out, and by the concierage. The fitness centre is rather grim, with banks of machines massed together in the middle and a running track encircling the machines. There wasn't much decent space to do stretching or some floor mat work. Hence, to charge $15 for one day's use for hotel guests seemed a bit much, since most of us just wanted an early morning work-out. Got a rather spacious room, but it was quite windowless and the dim lighting didn't help. However, apart from the lake view rooms, the rest of the views are nothing to shout about. Because it is such a big hotel, the elevator banks can be confusing - I often went into the wrong elevator that did not serve my floor. Nonetheless I found the elevator cars, the olden-style decor, all had its own charm. Revamping all this would render it to be just another modern-day 5-star chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot of bang for the buck....”
Reviews.Author: jabragg77
Reviews.Content: Room that I stayed in was basic at best. Lamps in the room worked part of the time. Outlets in the room were installed very poorly. Very pricey for a small room, basic cable and a bed to sleep in. Parking prices and WI-Fi fees are out of this world. Restaurant was very appetizing, but very expensive also.

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious overhaul”
Reviews.Author: ladyninjitsu
Reviews.Content: I had a very small room with a king size bed. The furniture was old and too large for the room. There was an oversized dresser/minibar/TV stand that was an absolute waste of space since I was informed they were no longer offering minibars in the rooms (what!?) so the big opening in the middle where the refrigerator was supposed to be was essentially non-functioning and served no purpose. It also meant there was no bottled water in the room so you had to drink tap water, get your own water from outside, or order it via room service which cost an arm and leg. The desk in the room was also essentially a waste since the big "ergonomic" desk chair was wedged in between the desk and bed making it quite uncomfortable to sit and move around. But, probably my biggest complaint was the gigantic computer monitor that occupied 80% of the desk space. I'm assuming Hilton thought they would get with the times and put a computer in every room providing guests with "technology at their fingertips". I think the idea is a good one but would make more sense if we were able to access the hotel's services via an iPad or other tablet device instead of some big, archaic LCD screen.
