Also, if the whole point of it is to offer convenience then why did it tell me to dial "52" on my PHONE to order room service? Sort of defeats the purpose, right? Not only was this huge, thoughtless piece of technology neither helpful nor convenient but the screen would randomly turn on in the middle of the night! Since it was 12 inches from my sleeping face I would wake up in the middle of the night cursing and wishing I could throw it out the window. Even when I thought I turned off the screen it went into some weird standby mode and still emitted a fair amount of light. I ended up having to cover it with a pillow and towel. The food in the hotel was atrocious. I was there for a conference that charged each attendee $2,000. The food we got was worth -$2,000. I won't go into details, only to say it was some of the worst I've ever had. Also, to the room service guy who brought us our breakfast -- don't stare sullenly at the receipt after I sign it and then sulk out of my room because I didn't give you anything extra on TOP of the 18% gratuity fee that is ALREADY on the bill and all the other miscellany charges Hilton added on to my $60 breakfast that was worth about $12. The only positive thing I will say about the hotel is that you do feel like you've stepped back in time and the lobby and ballrooms are all grand and beautiful, but it doesn't make up for everything else the hotel lacks.

Reviews.Title: “True old stile Hilton”
Reviews.Author: NikolaKujaca
Reviews.Content: I was there for 10 nights and the memories are very fresh. When you walk in this hotel, especially after 13 hours in plane, like I did, you don't want to spend time on anything but the hot shower and clean sheets. But walking into Hilton Chicago is something different. First impression was that it will be a disaster, considering that the last Hilton I was in was almost brand new one in Orlando... But, I was sooo much off. Every step you take, there is a peace of history, and you can almost taste it. I was expecting to see Fred Astare and Ginger Rogers to start dancing when I heard piano in the grand ballroom. For a building built in 1926, this was quite a surprise. You can, of course see sings of usage where ever you look, but everything was functional. It takes a moment to figure out the elevators setup too :D. They were doing some inside modeling and reconstruction, but for 10 days I spent there, I have not heard a single hammer drop. Service is perfect like in every Hilton, with very kind and helpful staff. I would say that, if you like hotel with history and taste of wisdom in satisfying his customers, it is worth the money. Bed is something that you will definitely want to take home with you, and you can for only 1700 USD. Hotel is clean, even on the first look appears dirty, it is due to the age. It will not shine to poke your eyes out, but it is clean. You will see small damages all around, like chipped of part from the toilet, etc. Location is on the middle of the South Michigan Avenue, so it is 20 minutes walk towards McCormick Place, as well as from the bridge and the water tower, where the "magnificent mile" starts. Lots of restaurants around and some shopping sites as well. In the hotel they have a nice Irish Pub, All in all, it could use some renovations, but I loved my stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jobinlt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for our 23rd anniversary and stayed on Michigan Ave. at the Hilton. Beautiful Hotel, Great Service, Friendly staff. There major restaurant was are under construction but there is a pub and breakfast buffet which are both acceptable. Little gift shop and a Starbucks in the hotel. The room was comfortable and big. I loved that you could open the window and hear the city noise. Would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Great price, fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: BostonHarbor
Reviews.Content: I landed at the Hilton Chicago using Expedia's "unpublished rates". It said there was a four star hotel within a mile of where my meeting was being held. This is a very last minute meeting and since I was only going to be in the room for less than 12 hours, I didn't want to pay too much. The price was less than half of what other hotels in the area were charging. The lobby is very pretty--1930's pretty--grand circular stairway etc. The room was huge, the pillows great, the bed very comfortable, the bathroom very "tired". The internet charge was something like $14 for 24 hours which was OK with me (athough pretty pricey), however it only worked for about two hours and then went dead. The hotel network went down, but they immmediately took the charge off my bill. All it all, it was fine and the price couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: roseyposey133
Reviews.Content: The Hilton had some very nice features. A beautiful place with a grand ballroom. Our room was very small though, and everything was considered extra. From local calls to wifi, even in the lobby. We stayed 4 nights and the sheets were not changed once. The location was great, lots to do and see. Like many big city hotels, the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT recommended.”
Reviews.Author: p_tone75
Reviews.Content: This "historic" hotel is not aging gracefully. I had two main issues with this hotel: 1. The room I was in looked like it could have been in a one-star hotel chain. The inside of the room was incredibly run down, things in the bathroom were broken, and there was mold growing in the bathtub. I travel a ton and see a lot of hotels, and this one was appalling in terms of the room quality. 2. I am allergic to down feather pillows. I requested to have the pillows and comforter swapped out upon arrival. I was busy at a conference all day, had a late dinner with a client, and came back to my room only to find that I still had down pillows on my bed. I called customer service and it took them 45 minutes to bring me a few pillows. Unacceptable. I will not be returning to the Hilton....

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and gracious stay!”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom844
Reviews.Content: My son and I attended a conference, one that I have attended in various cities over several years, and te Hilton Chicago made this the best conference yet! The elegance of this lovely hotel, complemented by wonderful updating that does not compromise its historic significance, makes each guest feel as though they have stepped back in time to a grandeur that is often lacking. The informative screens in each elevator detailing the history of the hotel was fun and enlightening. We were upgraded to a room with two bathrooms and on the corner, so we had a lovely room. Staff was amazing and gracious--from registration to housekeeping to concierge to the bartender--no one had an attitude. Location was wonderful, walked to everything I needed or was able to take the train easily. Wonderful restaurants abound (loved YOLK for breakfast) and easy walk to museums. Only downside was the internet connection fee - - -which was PER DEVICE!!! So sorry we went to the trouble to pack both of our laptops and iTouches--we shared a laptop for the duration of the trip (5 days) and cost us an arm and a leg; not having free internet in this day and age is inexcusable :( But that was the only negative. Ready to make a return visit to this wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Shiffled
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay. Hotel was clean and staff was friendly and helpfiul. Rooms are a little small, but typical for the age of the hotel. I would recommend then hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ichoosejoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Chicago for a conference and fortunately the $$ for the rooms did not have to come out of my wallet. It is quite expensive but beautiful and clean. and the staff is very, very friendly and helpful! The bed in my room was incredibly comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Classic style”
Reviews.Author: cals27
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay over a holiday weekend. It is a HUGE hotel. Room was a little dated but the beds were super comfy, I was sick so I spent quite a bit of time napping. We had a sliver of a view of Lake Michigan. The room was small but we had two full bathrooms, which was unexcepted but plesantly welcomed. Did eat down stairs in the pub, good food, oudoor seating with good people watching. Did not use the work-out facilities- looked amazing. Good location for the aquarium, Fields, Soliders and Millennium Park. Quick walk to the orange line. I'd stay again but would not pay premium prices.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, it is a great hotel to stay at for being at the park and listening to music in the summer. It is dated, and a little worn, but definitely a classic Chicago hotel. We loved it, and had great service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely don't pay Hilton prices for this place”
Reviews.Author: babycobalt
Reviews.Content: This old, beautiful building has great bones, but it really needs a deep cleaning and some TLC. We were upgraded to a room with two bathrooms, which turned out to be a good thing since one bathroom featured a toilet which sprayed water from the flush handle and the other featured significant mold on the shower tile grout (not that the other shower was without mold, the one just had more!) The room had a weird chemical smell, which I initially attributed to cleaning products, but the room was certainly not overly clean. I am far from a germophobe, but this was definitely a shoes-on, hesitant-to-relax-on-the-bed kind of room, which was only confirmed by the food on the carpet (which was not mine) I noticed when I first got to the room which remained there during my entire stay. On Sunday, our room was not cleaned at all, although someone did come by in the late afternoon to offer fresh towels. Location-wise, it is directly across from Grant Park, convenient to the financial district, and only a little over a mile to Soldier Field. However, it is about a mile to the southern tip of the Mag Mile and River North attractions and I was actually quite surprised to find almost no bars/restaurants in the immediate neighborhood open past 11 pm on a Friday, so I might suggest a tourist look elsewhere. If you're CTA-savvy, it is about 2.5 blocks to the red line and half a mile to the loop trains and there are always plenty of cabs out front. Also, as others have noted, they do not offer free wifi--which does seem a bit chintzy in this day and age--but if you have an ATT Wireless login, you can access free wifi that way. (We also only had two working plugs in the room, so they're clearly not set up the best for business travelers!) Overall, there was nothing catastrophically wrong with the hotel, but even with the watering-down of the Hilton brand, I don't think this hotel provides the experience one expects when reserving a room at a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEGADAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference at McCormick Place. Hotel eludes classic elegance. The hotel was very nice and the rooms were clean. My room was on the 8th floor with a view of the other rooms in a u-shape. Had to keep my windows closed at all times. The room was spacious with 2 double beds,2 full bathrooms, flat screen tv and nice pc with flat monitor. Internet was not free and I did not find a safe in the room. Be sure to request a view when you check in. The only positive about my room location is that it was on the same floor as the health club. There were several elevators and the layout of the hotel was easy to navigate even though it takes up a city block. I found the location of the hotel to be great. You can walk to the restaurants by the river, it is within a 1 mile radius and it has the lovely park right across the street. The hotel is undergoing renovations so there weren't many dining options except the pub. I didn't try any of the restaurants nor room service but the bartender in the lobby bar was excellent. She was quick and mixed great drinks. The front desk and bell service reps were very nice and both individuals at the concierge desk were extremely helpful and friendly. I would stay here again mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “classic but tired”
Reviews.Author: USVItravel
Reviews.Content: the Chicago Hilton is one of the nation's classic hotels... but she is tired and weeping at the edges. too bad, of course, as the most ordinary of clean redecoration would have (and will stlll) avoided disappointment. the Palmer House -- also Hilton branded - delivers what this grande dame could but does not.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gagirl47
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! We stayed in a room overlooking Lake Michigan on the 19th floor and had a fantastic view of the lake and Soldier Field. The hotel is just magnificent and reminds me of the grand hotels of the past. The location is perfect. We walked everywhere. We walked to Soldier Field, Buckingham Fountain, the parks and Navy Pier. The rooms were clean, the beds were so comfortable and we were content with everything EXCEPT the restaurant choices. They were renovating their main restaurant, so our only option within the hotel was an Irish Pub or room service. The Irish Pub was packed with people and the menu was pub food - as one would expect - except we didn't want pub food. Also the bar in the lobby was frequently closed, even in the evening which surprised us, so the only place to get a drink was the Irish Pub. However, despite the lack of resturant options, there are plenty of great restaurants nearby, so it wasn't a big problem. I definitely hope to stay in this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic hotel ... and priced as such”
Reviews.Author: Mike-n-Ginni
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Hilton Chicago for over a week each of the past 3 years so it feels a bit like a "home away from home" to me by now. The good: It is a grand, historic hotel in a decent location (directly across from Grant Park). The staff is helpful, the rooms are relatively comfortable and the bar (Kitty O'Shea's) is an authentic Irish Pub -- brilliant! I love the blues and Buddy Guy's Legends blues club is on Wabash, across the street from the back of the hotel -- easy. There are some decent dining choices walkable from the hotel that include a good sushi restaurant and pizzeria (Lou Malnati's). Most other activities require a cab ride. The not-so-good: Other than Kitty O'Sheas (pub grub) the hotel's dining choices are very limited. The location is OK if you want to stroll through Grant Park or Millennium Park -- other than that you'll pretty much need a cab since the hotel is ~ 1 mile south of the river and most of the coolest places to visit in Chicago are north of the river. The downright ugly: Very expensive for what you get. Not sure if they hike up the rates during trade show periods (which is when I stay) but it costed $279 + taxes for a total ~ $329/night. What made the price harder to swallow was the fact that I had just stayed in The Whitehall Hotel up near the top of The Magnificent Mile (same age as Hilton but much smaller and boutique-y) in a bigger room, better restaurants, excellent staff and a MUCH better location for just over $110/night!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too spendy!”
Reviews.Author: Josh W
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but it was too spendy for what you received. First complaint, wireless was not free. Seriously? Room was pretty small. Other than that, the room was nice and location with being right on Michigan Avenue was very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: averagejames1
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why this hotel is not rated higher among Chicago hotels. I can only assume it is age-based. It is an older hotel, for sure, but beautiful in that regard. Very clean, and the service from the staff was outstanding, especially considering that the hotel was full. If the location works for you, this is a great choice. If you are a stickler for newer, bigger rooms, modern sleek decor, etc., then probably not your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to ask for a non-smoking room”
Reviews.Author: mnonthego
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Priceline and paid about 200$ for a room at Hilton on the night before the Chicago marathon. When we checked in, we were given - much to our surprise - a smoking room. Honestly, I had no idea that there was still such thing as smoking rooms! Anyway, we asked for a different room and were told that they could not change our room because our booking was not confirmed since it was through a third party (Priceline). Bad, bad excuse, as the room was entirely paid by credit card at the very moment that we booked it, a few days before. So we decided to check the room to see if the smell was bearable. It was not; in fact, it was really horrible. We called the reception to ask for a non-smoking room; the front desk manager told us he could not change our room but could have the room 'ionized' to purify the air. This operation required that we stay out of the room for 45 minutes, not convenient but we were really desperate. After waiting for an hour for the purifying machine to arrive, we went back to reception to ask that the operation was made asap and then, we talked to a different manager who simply offered us a non-smoking room instead of waiting for the room to be cleaned! Obviously we were very pleased with this outcome even though we wasted about an hour and a half on this issue. It would have been so much nicer for us and more effective for the hotel if they had given us the non-smoking room when we checked in. The room we finally got was ok - nothing to write home about - and a bit disappointing for a Hilton. Given the experience we got there and the great choices that Chicago offers, I doubt that we will ever go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!!”
Reviews.Author: pumpkin1062
Reviews.Content: This is the first Hilton hotel. It was built many years ago and it looks it. It was clean but not real nice. The rooms and restrooms are small. We stayed on the executive floor(floor 23) and it is just an old hotel that has not be remodeled in many years. The employees are nice. For the price we have stayed in much nicer hotels. Would I recommend this hotel maybe if you have reason to be in this area of town, if not no.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone downhill fast ...”
Reviews.Author: ninja92
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for the Chicago triathlon. This was my third stay at this hotel. I have not had any issues until this visit. After the 3rd day of my stay I requested my room to be serviced and returned to what I thought was a clean room. While getting out of bed I was cut by a piece of glass in the carpet. I must not have been the first person to be cut in the room because I found dried blood on the bathroom floor afterwards. I had not noticed it before so I was very disgusted. We notified the staff and asked that the room be vacuumed and the bathroom mopped. We returned to the room after 5pm to find that the dried blood was still on the floor. After making a complaint to the customer service I have gotten no reply from the hotel. Considering the price point of this downtown hotel I would think that they would try to live up the 5 star rating but instead they have failed miserably. Luckily there are many hotels to choose from in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Being refurbished”
Reviews.Author: cjmunro
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this one. Great location for museums and the loop area of Chicago, overlooks Grant Park, CTA buses right outside and taxis are easy to get, also near to subway stations. There's loads of places within walking distance for food and drink. Parts of the public areas are beautiful, it was undergoing a lot of refurbishment when we were there, (due to finish in November) I expect it'll be spectacular then. Very handy to have PCs in the lobby for airline check-in. We got an executive room on 21st floor with 2 bathrooms which was nice. On the downside the breakfast wasn't usual Hilton standard, nothing wrong with it, but I think you're better off getting breakfast from the menu instead of pre-paying for B&B buffet like we did. It's also a bit in need of a lick of paint here and there, but the worst thing was no free wi-fi if you aren't an AT&T subscriber.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TwilightOverBoard
Reviews.Content: My 1st visit to Chicago and I thought the hotel was great. Nothing to rave about. My husband had a business/convention meeting at the hotel. We had a suite with a separate living area. The hotel is older and I would suggest some wallpaper seam glue. Other than that, the bed was very comfortable and we had a great view. Being a Hilton Honors member, we were able to eat the free breakfast and happy hour each day. The coffee in the room was terrible, but the coffee in the honors club was great! I took a taxi (about $8.00) to North Michigan Ave to go shopping while my husband was in meetings. I thought the city was beautiful. The shopping was GREAT. I walked back to the hotel and didn't think it was a bad walk at all. The lobby was under construction and only 1 restaurant on site - Kitty O'Shea's - which is more like a bar atmosphere. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: Third time staying in Chicago and all at different hotels. This one was the nicest, the beds were easily the most comfortable ones I've ever had at any hotel. It was also the quietest stay I've had. Great historic hotel, the lobby really gave the impression that you are staying in a quality place. The trivia while in the elevators was a nice touch since it shared the rich history of the hotel. Only a few negatives to touch on. The bathroom had some leftover hair in it, one in the sink and one very long one in the shower. I do realize that things get missed when cleaning so many rooms but it does kind of gross you out when you see that. Only other negative for us was location. If your there to shop on N Michigan avenue than you may want to find a hotel that's in that area. It's a long walk from this one. Of course if your planning on doing taxi's or the bus than it's not an issue. If your there for the aquarium and museum then this is a great spot. Also a great spot if your there for a Bears game. My last two stays in Chicago were on the North end of Michigan Avenue and I liked that area better. It was alot easier to walk to where the action was. Overall it was a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great History, Nice Size Rooms”
Reviews.Author: OneAverageJoe
Reviews.Content: We booked the Chicago Hilton based on it's location relative to Soldier Field, since we were in town for a Bears game. It also had very competitive rates. When you first walk into the hotel, you may find the layout odd. But after a few minutes you realize it's because it's a very old hotel. Not old necessarily in a bad way, but in a good way. You feel like you're living in times past, like you might see Sinatra walking by. But it has its quirks too. I found the front desk/reception area to be oddly placed and difficult to find when you first walk in. And while the hotel did provide that "classy" sort of feel, it could have used more work to make things more elegant. As a 4-star hotel, I would say it's middle of the pack in terms of lobby, rooms, etc. It had some nice amenities, but all at a price. For instance, the fitness center was large and had plenty of equipment. But it cost $15 per day or $29 per stay, which is not terribly high, but it would be nice for that to be included. The bed was slightly firm but the pillows were plenty and very comfortable, as were the sheets and comforter. The bathroom was too small but nicely decorated. The room itself was rather large but ackwardly designed. The view was decent and I liked that the windows opened a little. The AC worked great and kept the room as cool as you'd like it. The onsite restaurant/pub called "Kitty O'Shea's" served good food in a Pub-style atmosphere. My only real complaint was the TVs were extremely small, so on game day there were throngs of people piled inside all looking at tiny television sets. For Pete's sake, someone put some large-screen TVs in there! The other restaurant that served a daily breakfast buffett was excellent for the price. The buffett was good and was $16 per person, but included coffee and juice. Overall, I would stay here again if I were doing another quick trip to Soldier Field. But if I were just in town to enjoy the city, I would consider another hotel closer to Wacker or just north of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: Lucyznana
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to the Chicago Hilton was just as good as the first. Great location and helpful staff. The rooms are getting a little tired but still clean and well equipped and more importantly when you are traveling for an extended period (as we were) the beds are comfortable and the linen lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Debit Card Owners Beware!”
Reviews.Author: dabears-mv81
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel back in January to be close to Soldier Field for the Packers vs. Bears NFC Championship game. The service was absolutely unacceptable. It took me over 1 hour to check in. Then, throughout my 3 day stay I had experienced random charges on my check card totaling over $1,000USD. In the end I ended up disputing the entire stay and won my dispute. The hotel is nice, but overpriced and in my opinion treats you like a criminal if you use a check card. In the past I stayed at this hotel with a credit card and my experience was completely different. Will not stay in this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice historical hotel in the center of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: stefqatar
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the Executive floor where the rooms are really nice. The room was spotless including the bathroom. The bathroom has nice amenities with nice branded soap/shampoo.... The location is great, by the lake in the center of Chicago close to metro station on red line. Check-in/Check-out was fast and very efficient with hardly anyone queuing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room - huge hotel”
Reviews.Author: henna47
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a quick anniversary weekend. We took a gamble using Priceline's negotiable price, and ended up with the Hilton for $100. It was a great place to stay. Nice pool and work-out facility. The room was comfortable and quiet, a nice surprise considering the hotel itself is huge. It reminded us of an airport. But the hotel size is ingrained in the hotel and Chicago's history. The shiny, sparkly touches felt like we were reverting back to the 1920s, which I liked.

Reviews.Title: “So appreciative of the customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Liz B
Reviews.Content: I live in Indiana, but work in Lincoln Park , Chicago. More often than I'd like, unforeseen events occur that warrant my staying in town. Just as I hit the road to head back home at 7:00pm on a Saturday, I hit a pothole and got an instant flat tire. I couldn't find a place to assist me in a timely fashion, so I started my hotel search. By the time I arrived at the Hilton, close to 10:00pm, I had spent over 2 hours assessing the damages: AAA, finding a replacement tire/rim, contacting my career associates, etc. You get the picture: I had a bad day. Chun greeted me at the check-in desk. I have to say that she really turned my night around. I was tired and frustrated with the day, but her positive energy and welcoming attitude put a smile on my face. This is why Chun is great at customer service: She has found the perfect balance between friendliness and professionalism. She treated me with respect and poise, but still found a way to insert her sunny personality into our transaction. While she tapped away at the keyboard (making adjustments to accommodate my requests), she continued to engage in a genuine conversation. She seemed to actually care about what I was going through, and she NEVER stopped smiling. What a delight. I have stayed at many hotels in Chicago. My experience? Most of the nice, luxury places are: a) so snoody that you feel alienated, or b) so over-the-top that you feel uncomfortable. The Hilton Chicago has found the perfect medium in Chun. Professional, yet welcoming. Luxury with personality. There is often a huge mistake made in guest service: Ownership and/or Management focus so much on the precision of rules, verbage, and pre-written script that the individuality of the employee is lost. I don't want to deal with robots. I want to deal with human beings that relate! They listen, care, feel... and maybe even have a sense of humor (gasp!). I also give much deserved credit to Kelly Walsh for creating such a great team. After my interaction with Chun, I asked her for the name of her manager. I called a few days later to directly relay my experience to Kelly. She was just as pleasant as Chun, and extremely appreciative of the feedback. While I only dealt with Chun on my stay, I assume that the rest of the reception staff is equally as helpful. Now to quickly address the actual accommodations: As other reviews have said, the hotel is a bit older but really beautiful. It is huge, and I didn't take advantage of the many amenities offered. I definitely will in the future. My room was VERY clean and a good size; the bed was super comfortable with high-quality sheets and down blanket. The bathroom was quite large. This didnâ€™t make a big difference for me, being the only one in the room, but is a definite plus for multiple guests. I stayed in a King with lighted desk and armchair. In-room coffee maker and bar. Touch screen flat panel TV and computer: they offer multiple options on both systems. I am unsure of the pricing for bar/snacks/internet/movies. Probably pricey, but I challenge you to find a place in downtown Chicago that's not. My only complaint would be the two lamps by the bed: They each hold 2 light bulbs, but only had one, making the lampshades lopsided and revealing a bit of the bulbs. I'm sure that this was an oversight by maid services. Had I REALLY cared, I would have called reception, but I was ready to turn them off, anyway. (On the flip-side, the bases of the lamps have outlets which were very useful in charging my phone.) My only suggestion: I would love to see robes in the room! Thank you Chun and Kelly! After this great experience, I will absolutely be back to the Hilton Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I'd happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sue2000000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 3 nights but our experience was very good and we'd happily return if we visited Chicago again. We were assigned a very nice and well appointed room overlooking the lake. This is a very large, grand hotel with plenty of facilities and quite a history (snippets of information are played in the lifts e.g. details of scenes from films that have been shot there). The location is good for sight seeing - not far from Navy Pier, the Field Museum, Magnificent Mile, etc. The rooms have computers from which you can access the Internet and information on local attractions and hotel facilities. The content needs developing but it's a great idea. It was good to see the use of energy saving bulbs in the lamps and a bag provided in the rooms for recyclable material. Despite this, I think the hotel could do more to encourage more environmentally friendly behaviour in customers and in their own practice (e.g. lighting). One tip - buy coffee/tea from the Starbucks concession rather than in the dining room at breakfast - it's much better and cheaper. A great hotel - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Mega-sized historic hotel w/ga-jillion people during convention, but ok”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Our rating, if available, would have been a 3.7 vs. the 4.0 we had to select for this hotel. This is a giant hotel right on South Michigan Ave, with a historic, grand, still-trying-to-be-opulent lobby-entry. The hotel is located further south than many of you Magnificant-Mile shoppers may want, though walkable/bus-able/taxi-able, but also convenient to the Field museum, and all the others nearby, as well as the park for those with families/kids, history buffs, etc.. For us, the location was fine. We've already done the museums from prior trips, and we're not big shoppers of the Mag-Mile. It was however limiting in terms of nearby good restaurants, bars. Let's go to our review: Good stuff: The room was a generous size. A tad-bit dated, but not too bad. We got a corner room, though facing back side of hotel vs. facing the park on East side of hotel (b/c we declined the upgrade charge for our Priceline deal). Plenty of room with our double beds, to get comfortable, featuring club chair & ottomon, LCD TV, credenza with drawers, writing desk, usual over-chargeable snacks/drinks, good-sized bathroom with nice toiletries. So much room, that they could have put another double bed, and still have plenty of room. The room was very quiet, even though we could see the "EL" subway rumbling nearby. Beds were fine, and room cooling was very comfortable. Additionally, there is a separate flat-screen on the desk to offer information or local places to visit. We didn't find it useful so really didn't care for it, and it took a few attempts in order to turn off. We were worried that the room would be very dated, old, musty, etc., but were pleasantly surprised it was fine. The location was just ok...but so reachable via bus or extended walking from other parts of the city. It is a few minutes walk to the museum area further East, if so inclined. It is however, not very close to the Art Institute museum, or the "Bean" sculpture, so please note there will be some walking or other options needed. If you're into fitness, lots of good walking. We were also told of large pool and fitness center, but did not utilize (chargeable?). Bad stuff: Like we said, the location was just ok... away from Mag-Mile shopping, good restaurant options, and other parts of city. A bit remote, but not truly. If you don't mind walking/public transit, not as big a deal. Given its size, there is a large check-in reception area with the long requisite felt-ropes, to queue up in a snake-like route, to a fairly indifferent staff. Everything seemed to be chargeable. We asked for a room facing the park, chargeable. Fitness center, chargeable. You get the idea. We were there over a weekend, with a convention for good measure, and sure enough, there were lots of people. This made the elevator area crowded & noisy, and the waits for elevators was long. Once you get past the lobby/main floor of the hotel, much quieter. Summary: A good hotel for the price we got (well under $100/night). It was a good-sized room with comfortable beds and basic amenities. Yes, needs a little updating, but fine as-is as well .. depends on your tastes. As mentioned, the location may be an issue for some...depends on what you're doing/visiting. We wish it was closer (walkable) to some good restaurants, but this city has plenty of transportation options. Would we recommend it as first choice, no. There are so many other fine hotels that we've stayed at, closer to the hub-bub that is Chicago. Of course, the price goes up accordingly (?) We would recommend this hotel as a fall-back option if others (based on location) are too expensive, or fully booked. It's a back-handed compliment of the hotel, but we had no major issues with staying here. It's a fine hotel. (Sorry, forgot to take pix!) Happy Hotel-ing !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shows age.”
Reviews.Author: AkulaTheShark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place recently for an engagement in the city. If you drive to this place, parking is expensive. The hotel is showing age. The front desk will claim they have upgraded you, if you have booked an executive room. All in all, a nice property but needs modernized.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to do it, go all the way”
Reviews.Author: travelbug4646
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and were taking a weekend in Chicago and we wanted to do something special above and beyond our usual Best Western, Travelodge, HoJo repertoire. So I was very excited when, after I booked our "Mystery Hotel" through one of those travelocity deals, I discovered that we had gotten the Hilton for around $100 a night. The hotel was in a great location, and it was certainly the most beautiful and historic hotel we had ever stayed in. But I was expecting that the high price would mean that the hotel would come with some amenities you don't find with budget hotels. And it did, there was a Starbucks, a restaurant, a salon, etc but EVERYTHING cost extra. The hotel offered 24 hour parking but it was for a steep $40 a day (do some searching around the block and you can find overnight lots for as low as $18 a day, or there's always street parking if you're willing to feed the meeter at 8:00am). They didn't even offer free internet ($7/hour?!). So if you're looking for an upscale experience but you're still on a budget this isn't for you. But if you've got the money to blow on all the extras, it's quite fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: cunningtim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the 90's and I remembered it as being very nice. Well, time has taken it's toll on this property. The room was very dated and the Club lounge had very little to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Illiniwek66
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a typical large city hotel in an older building. Room was nice, and service was good. Only problem was that it would get cool enough. A/C was set on 65 and it never got below 75 and room was just stuffy. Only there for one night, so did not mention to hotel. I would stay here again and ask to move if my room was too hot.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is nice in general but few reception need training”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the location is fine. However I had bad experience with one reception when I checked in. It was just sad the hotel hired one inexperienced employee and ruin their image. I arrived the hotel 9/3 night at 10pm. The reception asked me if I would like to pay $25 more per night to upgrade to a bigger room. I booked though price line and had already pre-paid everything so I told her a standard room would be fine. Then she told me the hotel was overbooked that night so there was no more standard room available. Wasn't I supposed to be upgraded for free? I didn't know if the hotel manager asked her to trick the customer to pay more or it was just her own idea. She worked on the computer for another 5 min, then told me she would give me a bigger room on the first night, but I had to move to a standard room on the 2nd night. I was a bit upset and told her I would like to stay in the same room for all 3 nights. She told me she would give me a free breakfast if I agreed to switch room. It was already 20 mins after I arrived and I was really tired, so I agreed. However she worked on the computer more but still could not locate the room. Finally she asked a more senior guy's help. This guy immediately found a bigger room and I could stay in the same room for all 3 nights. Then she told the guy she didn't need to give me free breakfast anymore because I got the same room for 3 nights. She just said that right in front of me!! The guy was very reasonable and told her that was at least she could do to let me wait for so long during checking in. At the end, I got free room upgrade and breakfast. However I am still not happy. I like the hotel in general but I hope the hotel hire the right person in the future. Just one bad employee can ruin the image.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravel3r
Reviews.Content: I'm not one for luxury hotels due to price, considering I'll only be sleeping there. But, 'Priceline' offered a great deal on this Hilton that I couldn't refuse. The hotel is super clean which is a plus. Staff are fantastically nice, which is a super plus. The rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable. Amenities in the room are great, including the flat screen tv. They recently added an ipod player which was also a bonus. Check in and out are smooth. The rooms with 2 double beds are very spacious, and have 2 separate bathrooms. It's a great layout if you're sharing with a friend. But if you're a couple, I suggest getting the queen or king size bed, and compromise the 2 bathrooms. Something to watch out for (not negative, but to consider): the hotel rooms include a touch screen computer. Great! Right? I'm not sure how much they would charge to even click on different web pages, but just be cautious of costs. Location is good. A little outside of all the action, but close enough for walking and/or taking the Red Line train. Also good to stay away from unnecessary noise, if that would be a problem for you. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend this hotel for others.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Credit Card Bill”
Reviews.Author: Realwoman4ya
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, It even had two bathrooms.. Everything was acceptable until I got my credit card bill. There were two of us in the room. My room mate had made the reservation. I checked in and the clerk agreed that the bill would be split. At check out time I received my half of the bill and provide my credit card to pay for it. They gave me a receipt for my half. When I got home looked at my credit card bill I had been charged twice. I called the hotel and they claimed they did not have a credit card for my room mate, who just happen to make the reservation, so they decided to charge me for the full bill. My roommate gave them a credit card to make the reservation and to check into the hotel. I have contacted my credit card company, the amount is in dispute. The billing clerk was very mean too...

Reviews.Title: “If this is a 4-star hotel, one star is definitely hanging by a thread”
Reviews.Author: lubger
Reviews.Content: This is one of your typical huge downtown hotels which habitually (according to my observations) have one problem: high guest traffic - which somewhat depresses their interest/capacity in maintaining the top-line standards. Besides, the hotel itself is quite old, as far as I understood. We had to go through FOUR rooms to find one which wouldn't smell of stale tobacco (on the one hand, this is not the hotel's fault - some people have a nasty habit of ignoring the "no smoking" designations in rooms - but on the other hand, why should I care, I hate sleeping in a stale-smell room). The staff was friendly and helpful, though, and upgraded us to a larger room, in the end, which was more or less neutral in odors. We ordered dinner through room service, and the food was okay. They try to be modern and offer all the info on the hotel via the in-room internet service, including the menu - the only problem is that the internet service is reset every time new guests are checked in, and it takes the system about half an hour to initialize, so we ended up calling the help desk, and they brought us a printed menu. The breakfast at the restaurant was good - a wide selection of foods, hot and cold, prompt service. We were charged for breakfast separately (but this seems to become a wide-spread practice these days). All in all, an okay place - but they need to brush up to stand to their 4-star status.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lytlea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Hilton Chicago during Labor Day Weekend 2011. We got a room off Priceline and then upgraded at the time of check-in to a lake view. It was a beautiful room. It was small of course, but I'm pretty sure all hotel rooms in Chicago are like that. The service was great. We left our car in a garage across the street for the weekend (Hilton is too expensive) and were able to walk to mostly everything. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Changed My Routine from Staying in the NW Suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Familytravlr
Reviews.Content: I will have to say the Hilton has changed our usual "stay in the suburbs to save money" routine. The hotel staff was very helpful, friendly, and interested in making sure our stay was enjoyable. Finding the parking entrance was easy, the place takes up an entire block and the entrance was easy to find. The slightly southern location means less traffic congestion. You are close to the parks, museums, and the Harrison CTA station. We took an evening stroll and soon was in the heart of the Jazz Fest and Millenium Park excitement. The room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. I did find it odd that the breakfast buffet did not have a price listed on the menu at the restaurant entrance. It would have been nice to try but I didn't want to go through sticker shock when the bill arrived so we ate at a nearby restaurant. Thanks Hilton for a wonderful Labor Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: yoontaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chicago Hilton for two nights at the beginning of August. Location and Getting There: We flew into Chicago O'Haire in the morning and took the blue line to Jackson Station, walked through the tunnel to the Red Line, then took it two stops to Harrison. It is a short walk (also seemed very safe) from the Harrison Station (on the Red Line) to the hotel. Total cost for 2 adults and 2 children was around $7. Transfers from airport were about $80. Huge savings. Trip took about 1 hour, and if you have a lot of luggage the stairs and train can be a hassle, but we did it with two small children and suitcases. The hotel sits right across the street from Grant Park, a beautiful location. The park itself has a lot to offer, so definitely check it out. There is always some event going on during the summer. The Hotel: The hotel is quite ornate, though a bit dated (which is part of the charm), on the inside. We had reserved two rooms, one for my family of four and one for my father and his wife. We arrived early, around 12pm, so the rooms were not ready. They took our cel phone number to call us when they were ready. We went to a nice NY-style diner nearby for lunch (Eleven City Diner), it is only a short walk from the hotel. During lunch, the hotel called to say the room was ready. Nice touch. However, when we got back, only one of the rooms was ready. We checked in anyways, headed to our room with a bellman, only to discover that the rooms were not adjoining. (which they had promised when we arrived) Well, the bellman was fantastic! He called down to his "connection" at the front desk, they did some juggling, and we ended up with adjoining rooms on the front of the hotel (these were supposed to cost extra, which we didn't pay for) with a great view of the park. Definitely recommend using a bellman to show you to your room, he said they can typically take care of things for you, and it only cost the price of a tip. Best money I spent all weekend! BTW, he was very courteous and didn't solicit for the tip. Overall, our stay at the hotel was very nice. Rooms are comfortable, a bit older, but very clean and everything was in working order. There was no "musty" odor, once the air-conditioning was on. Breakfast was very good (it was included with our rate), the cook at the omelet/pancake station even made us some special pancakes, guaranteed to be nut-free, for our daughter who is allergic. The rootftop pool and sundeck was nice, though we didn't end up using it, too much to do in Chicago. Overall, a very nice hotel in a good location (if you want to visit the park, aquarium, Field Museum, etc....). It's a bit of a walk to the "magnificent mile" and shopping, but still very do-able, especially when the weather is nice. We walked it with two small children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great for Buisiness Travel”
Reviews.Author: TracyD25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 6 day business trip that included a trade show/expo at the hotel, and was extremely impressed with the service from the parcel room, the business center and the lobby desk. The people were polite, friendly and efficient. But be careful - the hotel charges big fees for shipping, receiving and storing large packages. Lobby is beautiful! The rooms were nice - I'd recommend getting 2 double beds with 2 bathrooms for more space (versus a king room). My only compalint - and it's big - is the onsite restaurant Kitty O'Sheas. The menu lacks good options, the food was bland, zero wine list (I know it's an Irish pub - but they still need decent wine). Venture to one the many many good restaurants in Chicago before settling there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service - a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: jaycer02
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful hotel with great service; however, better suited for business or adult only trips. The hotel was very expensive and in addition to the nightly stay we had to pay $20 for parking. We rented a movie one evening which cost $15 - I could have gone to other rentals and paid $1. This was my first trip to Chicago and I thought I was choosing a hotel within walking distance of the shopping and restaurants on the Magnificent Mile and I was wrong. The first night we walked and had to take a taxi back because it was simply too far for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MN_FunSeeker
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline using the "Millennium Park" area as one of our prerequisites. Although it was about a mile from Millennium Park, it was still in a very nice area of Michigan Avenue (right across from Grant Park). The hotel was extremely busy due to the Lifetime Chicago Triathlon that weekend. We arrived way before check-in on Friday. We requested a king, non-smoking room overlooking the lake/park. Steve (the desk attendant) was very professional and personable and put us in a fantastic room on the 22nd floor overlooking the lake/park/marina/fountain. We couldn't have been happier with the room, especially for the price. We went back down to thank Steve for the great room and inquired about about local restaurants and taverns. Steve told us about a couple gems west of the hotel about three blocks on Dearborn Avenue. Hackney's Restaurant and Kasey's Tavern - two great places to eat and hang out. Very friendly, laid back atmosphere - compared to the rush and busyness of Michigan Avenue. Steve's recommendations were right on the money. The hotel is a historic gem. It's a grand hotel with massive ceilings and ballrooms. Our room was newly renovated so we felt we go the best of both worlds - a beautiful historic hotel with modern, comfortable rooms. The only thing I didn't like was the extra fee for use of the Wi-Fi (and I'm a Hilton Honors member) and the fact that they never removed the glassware we set outside our room (sat there for two days).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience! Will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: domare
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an elegant, older hotel with over 1,000 guest rooms. The customer service was outstanding from check-in through check-out. I ate several meals in the small restaurant off the lobby and the food was fresh and delicious. I was traveling alone and I felt very safe and comfortable. One special feature of the hotel is that the guest rooms have 2 bathrooms. This is a great feature for families traveling with children. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back, love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blm0098
Reviews.Content: This Hilton has the elegance of an old hotel with the cleanliness of a new hotel. The best part is that many rooms have 2 bathrooms. Great for families! The hotel is about 2 miles south of the Water Tower shopping.mall.. ( the furthest North shopping center from the hotel) All of the Michigan Ave shops are within reach by foot or bus. Grant park is across the street, good for tourists going to the museums and planetarium. Walking to Millenium park and Bean is also an easy walk. If you can walk 2 miles you can also walk to McCormick Place Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Shivan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: This hotel are part of history, one of the original Conrad Hilton major purchases when he was creating his empire. Keep that mind if you are seeking an ultra sleek and modern hotel, because this is one of the more classic Hiltons you will come across. Check in was wonderful; I am an HHonors and considering the size of the hotel I was very impressed to be checked in within five minutes of getting into line, they even delivered the package waiting for me directly to my room which was handy. The hotel is huge; so most rooms are going to be a bit of a trek from the lobby and the signage is a little lacking if you don't enter from the main lobby door to find the elevator but once you have that figured it its pretty straight forward. My room configuration was a little strange as it was a rectangle with a king sized bed in the middle with two full bathrooms on either side, however the room was very functional and the new touchscreen hotel directory was simple enough to use to find the room service menu. The room still allowed for me to work at a desk, and the bed like with most Hiltons was consistent. The Room Service was something that was noteworthy, I had dinner and breakfast in the room once, and both times they were delivered within 15 minutes and was fantastic both times. In terms of location, you really can't beat you are basically right in the thick of downtown and within walking distance of any number of restaurants and sights. Internet was pretty good considering the size of the hotel; I was expecting some questionable connection speeds but it was pretty average but certainly functional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Staff Integrity”
Reviews.Author: Curt909
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on S Michigan at the last minute after obtaining an incredible $100 a night rate through Priceline. Expecting to be given a small interior room, we were surprised to see that our 17th floor room overlooked Lake Michigan and Buckingham fountain. Furnishings were quite nice and the room was large and very clean. Breakfast buffet the next morning was also among the best I've had. The fruits, baked goods and breakfast entrees were very fresh and of excellent quality and variety. Wait staff was exceptionally attentive and friendly. Upon returning home, we noted that we had accidentally left two $120 wifi controllers in a drawer in the room. We called the hotel and spoke to lost and found. Amazingly, they had both controllers turned in by housekeeping and sent them back to us FedEx at their expense. Kudos to management and staff for their honesty and fine service.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Happiness”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneManhattan
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was greeted and quickly checked in...and to my delight, offered a choice of two upgrades. I took a king suite on a high floor with a wonderful view of Lake Michigan and the museums. The room was well appointed, with a comfortable couch. The only somewhat downside was the bathroom. I couldn't get any water to come out of the shower/tub on the first morning, and it took about 40 minutes longer than anticipated for maintenance to arrive and address the issue. The bar soap holders in the shower are a bit scarred, and so the soap you leave in it picks up some of the metallic color or something. It seemed a bit like a science experiment. The suite was quiet, as you can imagine. The concierge staff was helpful, and the lobby had plenty of space to wait for others or people watch. I thought the bell staff/taxi stand staff were a bit aggressive/unfriendly. I would definitely stay here again. P.S. The trolley and open air double decker bus have stops at the corner of the hotel, so it makes it easy for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Got a deal on Priceline or we wouldn't have stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: Adkins_jen
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal on a room at the Hilton Chicago. The price was great but when we got there the room was the size of a closet (we booked a king suite). The wireless internet, workout area, and basically anything else was an extra cost. Nothing comes free at this hotel. The location was fabulous and I would recommend the hotel just because of the location. Also be prepared to pay A LOT for parking whether you park in a public garage or the one provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A well sited hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on a brief visit to Chicago, the building itself has some very grand public rooms, with chandeliers, a wonderful ball room and lots of space. It is a very busy hotel. We stayed on the 21st floor and the lifts were organsied in such a way that there was never a wait. We were offered an upgrade to a room with a lake view but didn't take it. The room itself was well presented, a little more attention could have been paid to the cleaning and dusting, it was fairly small with 2 beds but we liked the luxury of a bathroom each! we chose the buffet breakfast for $21 which was varied and unrushed. The hotel itself is well placed for a walk to the lake front, the loop, millenium park is about a mile away, we could get to most sights on foot. It has a pool with a roof terrace which was greatly appreciated on a very hot day, and a well equipped gym with running track. Overall this was a lovely hotel, but I thought it was overpriced for the size of the rooms and the amenities on offer. At $200 a night (incl taxes) we would have expected sufficient tea and coffee facilities, and not need to be hunting down milk!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business stays and meetings, business staff were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Brotherlard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in August 2011 and thought this gave good service with excellent value for money? I would watch the breakfast as it was not a buffet but they charge for each item and it can be expensive. The team who run the meeting rooms were fantastic and could not be any more helpful. I had a meeting on the Sunday and they were as good at the weekend as during the week? This is my 1st trip to Chicago and the location was great for sightseeing with the limited free time I had. I will return for a few days next year with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel, fabulous updates”
Reviews.Author: ramblingman49
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago has tremendous historic appeal (many famous movies filmed here), all with updated amenities and convenience for the business and pleasure traveler. The service from the staff is excellent. The location is good and close to Chicago Art Museum and within a mile and a half of excellent shopping on the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good location”
Reviews.Author: aparad2
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago, but decided to book a room downtown for a special occasion. I didn't spend tons of time in my room, but I must say that the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in at any hotel. Also, the bathroom was awesome. Very well designed with sleek and modern fixtures. I also had a great view of the city. The location is great and a short walk from many downtown attractions. I definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location, and Stay.....much cheaper parking next door”
Reviews.Author: kupkakekelci
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hotel though Priceline and got an awesome rate. Through Priceline you can never be promised to have a certain room with certain amenities. When I got to the hotel it was packed out with people, completely booked. They worked us into non smoking rooms with king size beds and nice views. And while we were waiting an hour for our rooms, they let us stay in another hotel room to rest. My husband and I have a newborn and they requested a room with two bathrooms so we could put her bed in one to sleep. They were very on top of things; everything was very clean. The location was really perfect and safe. Still on the Magnificent Mile, but not in the midst of all the traffic. Close to the museums, parks, and lake. The parking is very expensive, but there are safe, over night parking lots right next to the hotel for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Classic old hotel, dated, with few public bathrooms and poor ADA access”
Reviews.Author: DrKatieRN
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days here at a work conference. The hotel is a "Grand Old Dame" hotel in Chicago and still boasts having the largest number of rooms. Rooms are small. Room bathrooms are updated. There are many conference rooms, but all have poor ADA access. The conference rooms are up and down stairs and escalators. I was shocked that there were absolutely no bathrooms near the ballrooms. One had to go down 3 flights of stairs or to another tower. The hotel states it has done lots of renovations to modernize the 1927 facility. They have NOT invested in bathrooms, however, near the conference rooms or ballrooms. The hotel's restaurants aare not good. But, just a few blocks away there are good restaurants. The hotel is located on South Michigan Ave. It's a bus or taxi ride away to the "Miracle Mile." If your budget is limited, than the tiny rooms and challenges of this old hotel may be worth it. Otherwise, I'd recommend something newer, with improved facilities, and nearer the primary end of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star service and well-appointed room made my weekend!”
Reviews.Author: marktwothousand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Hilton for a weekend in August to celebrate a birthday and meet some friends also in the city. My travel companion booked our room on a third-party website. Although the hotel is located more southerly than its competitors, it's very close to the red line CTA metro station, and major attractions like Millenium Park, the museums, etc. We checked in late and as we had a Run of the House reservation, we didn't bank on being able to receive a room of our choice. When we walked in, we were absolutely delighted to find a very nicely-sized room on a high floor with executive access. The room was extremely well appointed, featuring polished cherrywood furniture in a classical style, suitable for the age and period of the building. A computer terminal with local information adorned the desk, piping out soothing new age music as we opened the door and welcoming us with our name on the screen. The large LCD TV was also a great pleasure because it didn't obstruct the glorious lake view at all. Although the property was regarded as 4-star on our booking site, it really stood out against its competitors by offering 5-star service. The executive access allowed us to have complimentary continental breakfast, hors d'ouvres at dinner hour, internet access and pop and snacks at other times of the day. The lounge was also a great way to relax in a common area, but not in too busy of an environment like the main lobby. We also had access to the fitness centre, and had I known, I would have brought a bathing suit to enjoy one of the hot tubs available to us on the sky terrace, which had an obstructed view of the city and Willis Tower. It gets better. After some small-talk with staff and mentioning we were there celebrating a birthday, we were absolutely floored when we came home the next night and found a gourmet dessert specifically prepared with "Happy Birthday" in chocolate writing, and a greeting card, personally addressed, welcoming us to the Hilton Chicago. As a Green Star Reviewer, I take all my reviews very seriously and offer crticism where it is due. This is one of the few vacations where I was not atall let down by the hotel. Two maintenance requests we had on our first night were fulfilled by the next day. The Air Conditioning was adjusted to our comfort level. If you want a quieter room, I would ask for a room not as close to the park because there were festivals going on when I was there and the muffled noise of music and people were heard occasionally - but that's the offerings of a big city. You wouldn't be staying in the Loop if you weren't prepared for some noise. After having a pleasant stay at another Hilton-branded location in Chicago two years ago, and now at the Hilton Chicago, I am convinced the Hilton brand is among the highest quality. Thank you to the staff who made it one of the highlights of my weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Melanie S
Reviews.Content: I am a long-time Chicago visitor but this was my first stay at the Hilton Chicago and it could not have gone better. We were in town for the Rock 'n Roll Chicago half marathon and this was the host hotel. Parking deck was crowded but we found a spot and made our way to check-in. Short line and I was checked in, but the clerk informed me they did not have a 2-bed nonsmoking available right then and it would be a half hour wait. Not a big deal. Normal checkout time is 11 a.m., but they moved it to noon for all the marathoners. I asked nicely if we could get an extra hour (since we are slow runners!) and she moved our check-out to 1 p.m. at no additional charge. We waited in the lobby and about 30 minutes later I got a call that a room was available for us. Since we had to wait a whole 30 minutes, they knocked $50 off our already great rate. Score! Got up to the room and had a nice corner room with a view of the lake, Solider Field and the Field Museum. The room was huge, as was the bathroom. As a convenience for us runners, the restaurant in the lobby had an all-you-can-eat pasta bar for dinner and with the rain outside it was nice to not have to leave. All-in-all, a great experience with fantastic customer service and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: anitajd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Hilton for a conference at the hotel. I was immediately impressed by the grand lobby--absolutely stunning! My hotel room, which I shared w/ a colleague, was very large with two bathrooms. The double beds seemed small (rather than 2 queens), but it allowed for more space in the room. Since we each had our own bed AND bathroom, this wasn't a big issue. The room was very clean, as was the hotel. The hotel restaurants did not price-gouge for meals (lunch and dinner) and were actually quite good (as were the catered confernece luncheons). There is a Starbucks on the main floor--but it was pricey. Instead, we chose to go to the Caribou Coffee behind the hotel for breakfast. Overall, the staff was friendly, the room price was very reasonable, the location was great. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great!....clean and very dog-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Usedtolikeit
Reviews.Content: My husband, who had stayed here previously, made arrangement for us to get away for a few days for our anniversary. It was a pleasant experience and we will be returning! Our free upgraded room, with two double beds, a sink, refrigerator and one bath, faced Lake Michigan. I am a 'clean nut', always looking in corners and on the floor for dirt and dust.....there was none....this room was spotless. Did I mention the comfortable beds and pillows? The well-trained staff was friendly and helpful but never invasive. And boy, does this hotel know how to welcome dogs! I was surprised at how dog-friendly this hotel is. This Hilton is in a prime location, close to Millenium Park, Lake Michigan, Navy Pier, Shedd Aquarium, and a fenced in dog park (just on the other side of the Metra tracks and a bit south of the hotel) Please note: if you are a person who thinks that shiny chrome, Ikea-like furniture and retro light fixtures indicate a great hotel, Hilton Chicago is not for you. This hotel is about graciousness, pride in history, old-world superior craftsmanship, and well-trained, formal staff. A great experience. Thank you, Hilton Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand”
Reviews.Author: dropnby
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was excited to stay in a hotel along the Lake that was a staple of the city. We drove up from DC and pulled into the underground lot and were immediately told that we would have to pay an extra $55 per night for valet parking or $45 per night for self parking. There was also 24 hr parking across the street and since we were there to visit my aunt in a nursing home nearby and needed to get in and out quickly, we opted for the 24 hr parking at $30 per night. I made it a point to call 2 nights before check-in and ask if they could get me a room with a Lake View and 2 beds. The person at the front desk said she would make a note of it on my confirmation. However, once I got to the Registration desk, the clerk informed me that Lake Views are an extra $25 per night which was NEVER mentioned during my phone conversation. She tried to compensate by offering us a 2 bed with 2 bathroom but still no lake view. The 2nd bathroom is a stand in shower, not a full bath. That was fine since we had my 12 year old step daughter with us. Overall, I felt like I was being nickel and dimed for what is normally just accommodated to guests and the whole experience left a bad taste. The rooms are average at best for the price, which I booked through Priceline and got the cheapest rate available and it was still expensive for what little you actually get. I would suggest looking elsewhere. Not a good deal at all.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review for huge historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: soresident
Reviews.Content: This is a massive, historic hotel we picked because of UChicago connection when we came to visit school. Pluses: two bathrooms in upgraded 19th floor room made for easy family dressing for early morning campus visit; great a/c; hotel provided limo service to campus when shuttles were fully booked; next door to terrific tapas restaurant overseen by Iron Chef Jose Garces! Negatives: hotel charges for internet access and gym (though Chicago Bears were studying playbook that Sunday am in [free] hot tub); impossible to get concierge on phone at busy hotel and inaccurate info given when finally reached; no 'grab and go' breakfast option, and nearby Starbucks was never open when we checked; double-bedded rooms have full beds, not queens, and not very comfortable; location not on Magnificent Mile felt far from shopping and center of Chicago on a short visit; charged $2 per bag for holding bags between 12 pm checkout and 2:00 departure; took 30 minutes for bags to arrive at room at 11 pm. Wonder if some of hotel might have been more recently renovated, as contrary to some reviews seen here 19th floor was very clean, with great ac; every time we got into elevator there were other people going to that floor as well so perhaps at a time when hotel was not full guests were being placed on that nice floor?

Reviews.Title: “A historic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bernicez10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Chicago for a recent conference. The hotel was in a great location within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The hotel employees were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is a little tired, especially the rooms. While my room had two bathrooms, one didn't appear to have been cleaned in a few months. The sink and drain in the bathtub were clogged every time I turned on the faucet. Overall, while the bathrooms needed some improvement, the bed was comfortable. The hotel has an amazing history, having played host to various diplomats and political leaders since opening in 1927. The first floor is elegantly appointed; entering the hotel is like taking a walk back in time to the 1920's. Despite the issues with my room, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: KimH925
Reviews.Content: Took a trip w/ a friend for an impromptu weekend getaway and had a lovely time at the Chicago Hilton. The staff from check in to check out was very friendly and helpful from extra towels to suggestions on where to eat lunch. The bed was undoubtedly the most comfortable bed I've slept in EVER!!!! The pillows were like comfy marshmallows, I found myself in one of the most exciting cities in the U.S. not wanting to get out of bed!! You cannot go wrong with this hotel. I even had drinks alone at Kitty O'Sheas and the staff made me feel as though I was surrounded by long-time friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: quetzalcoyote
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Chicago on Michigan Ave during the first week in August 2011. Although this was not the worst hotel I've stayed in, it certainly was not the best. The lobby and main level area were neat and clean but my room was not. On the day of check in, the room had only been half cleaned. The floor had not been vacumed, the toilet had not been cleaned and there was no soap or shampoo in the bathroom. The shower faucet never stopped leaking and there was black mold in the corners of the bath/shower. The pillows smelled like cigarette smoke and body odor and even though the room was "cleaned" while I was gone during the day, the floor was never vacumed. I know this because of a small piece of white debris on the carpet that did not move for 7 days. Apperantly, high price is what makes this a high end hotel. On the good side, with the exception of an overzealous female security gaurd, the doormen in the drop off/ parking rotunda area and the front desk workers were very accomidating.

Reviews.Title: “An Old Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is one of the older hotels in Chicago. However, that doesn't mean it is run down. Rather it means that you should expect smaller rooms, grand ballrooms, and a large expansive hotel. The rooms are well appointed but the bathrooms are a bit old. One side of the hotel has great views of the Park and Lake Michigan. Other rooms can overlook other rooms or the city. The location is on the southern end of Michigan Ave (think Field Museum/Soldier Field) so if you want to get to the shopping areas prepare for a walk or cab ride. Overall, a nice old gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They Won't Return My Deposit”
Reviews.Author: depositless
Reviews.Content: I put down a deposit on a check which they cashed in short order. They promised to refund my money upon check out. They wouldn't give it to me. It is over a month. I made 4 phone calls and finally left a message for the finance supervisor. As of yet, I am missing hundreds in a deposit. I never used internet or room service. I'd think the Hilton chain could afford to return a couple hundred bucks to someone who never even spent it at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel- a little worn, but good location + price”
Reviews.Author: spartan14
Reviews.Content: My college best friend and I choose to visit Chicago for a weekend and wanted to find a hotel with a good price and a decent location. The Hilton Chicago fit the bill and had a Hilton double points offer, which was very appealing. It was also just a short cab ride from the train station. The check-in process took quite awhile as we had to wait in a rather long line. However, we were given a complimentary upgrade to one of their double-beded/two bathroom rooms with a lakeview (we had only booked a double-bedded room so I believe we got a bit of a deal). We were happy to have a lake view and it was immensely helpful to have two bathrooms! However, there was only one hairdryer but we deduced that was so we don't blow a fuse, and we took turns. Though it is not on the busy Magnificant Mile area (it's a little farther south), it is still in a good location and a short walk to the Field Museum. The lobby and common areas are really impressive, with historic decor.

Reviews.Title: “Lollapalooza !!”
Reviews.Author: Speyes
Reviews.Content: We are at the Hilton Chicago now, we have been here for 5 days. We arrived for Lollapalooza a couple of days early, and I must admit, we were a little worried before we got here about air conditioning (because of some of the previous reviews). However, once we arrived, all my worries were gone. We checked in, which was a breeze, and the lady who checked us in was a sweetheart. We get to our room (which was upgraded on request), and it has been a breeze since. We are staying in a Lake front suite, and it has been amazing. We were not sure how room service would be, because, last year we stayed at the Palmer House for Lollapalooza, and the room service would take 2 hrs for a couple of burgers. This is a very busy weekend for all hotels and restaurants so we understood, however, the Hilton has made every effort to ensure all is well. We got back last night, along with a couple thousand other people (and the night before), we ordered room svc right away, and each night, we waited only about 25 min. It was more quick than on a standard night in any other hotel. About the air conditioning. We haven't had a problem at all. When we walked into our room, it was stuffy, but all you have to do is "Turn it on !!" I read negative reviews, and I'm not sure if those people just don't know how to work a thermostat or what, but we were out in Grant Park for the last three days and it was HOT, and coming here afterwards was an absolute treat. We consider ourselves seasoned travelers, and I will return here, especially for Lollapalooza next year. This is a great location, great food all around, Thank you Hilton for making another year at Lolla perfect, We will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: GettingThereisHalf
Reviews.Content: Traveled there for a convention with my wife and newborn son - which can cause some anxiety. But we had no issues and the room provided ample space for his pack n play and threw his bottles in the fridge. Had a good time in the lobby with some drinks in front of the fire place and walked to a few restaurants in the area that were excellent. We love this hotel and it is in the middle of everything. Enjoyed the historical facts in the elevator too...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: monana66
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in my trip to USA this summer. The view of the rooms is amazing. And the service is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it was OK, but I expected better”
Reviews.Author: MajorBlow
Reviews.Content: I'm a Brit, and the general impression most Brits have of the Hilton chain is 4*+. This was my first time at the Hilton Chicago. I had visited Chicago previously on 4 occasions for conventions, but had always stayed at independant or 'boutique' hotels further North across the river. So from comparisons I already had an impression that this hotel occupied a less favourable location with less to boast. I chose to stay here primarily because the Grand Ball associated with the convention I was attending would be held here, and also because I got a great rate through Otel.com at only Â£108 per night all-in x 5 nights. The experience was OK, but I expected better given the Hilton name. Rooms were OK although internet wasn't free; breakfast was slow and the food 'ok'. It's a large hotel and looking tired in places. The Irish bar offered ok meals and provided an alternative to the buffet restaurant.
