The location was too far downtown for shopping or much else; you had to taxi to/from or shed shoe leather to 'go' anywhere. But it's on the main list for a free shuttle to/from the convention centre. Taxi from O'Hare airport was $50 - no courtesy shuttle to/from the airport as some other hotels provide. I had time on my way home to take the airport express shuttle service to which the hotel subscribes - only cost $30 including gratuity and even though I allowed an extra hour I only just made my flight becayse this 'express' service stops at multiple hotel pickups before heading for the airport - so avoid - you're much better off paying $20 more for a regular taxi to get you to the airport on time. Would I return? If attending an exhibition or convention and if I got a great rate, then maybe yes, but I've had better quality in more convenient Chicago locations for same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little tired”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetBTS
Reviews.Content: Despite its location (too far south), we have always liked this hotel. Our stay this time was OK, but there were a few little issues. The concierge was completely unhelpful - and not overly pleasant either. Overall the hotel is getting a little tired - it could use some sprucing up. There weren't nearly enough towel racks/pegs in the bath and the shower curtain rod was really showing its age. The lampshades in the bedroom were tilted and askew and couldn't be made right. The room was way too hot (on a 90+ degree day in Chicago) and the A/C wasn't working very well. We had to call maintenance to come and fix it. They came, but didn't fix it, so at 11:00 p.m. we were on the phone requesting a floor fan. They wanted to send engineering up again, but we weren't interested at that hour of the night. It then took them 40 minutes to locate a fan. I finally suggested they go buy one at the Walgreens down the street. They did finally find a fan, but it was filthy. The next day engineering came and "fixed" the A/C, but it still wasn't working very well. We are Hilton Gold members, which didn't get us an upgrade to the Executive Floor, though we were able to get breakfast there. The breakfast room was not staffed well - food and beverages ran out and weren't replenished. And the place was packed with families with small children running around unsupervised - wish the hotel could have done something about that. It was clean though, and the housekeeping staff was very friendly and pleasant. We didn't realize the hotel allowed pets - until the dog in the next room kept barking. Would we return? Maybe if it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A classic, grand hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: PhilattheBeach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here recently and absolutely loved it! The room was large and well-appointed, and included a mini-fridge. Windows were sealed well enough to make it remarkably quiet, given the downtown (Loop) location. The staff was very helpful. Great location for the lake, parks, and museums, and convenient to many terrific restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “staff is nice”
Reviews.Author: MS03t1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit worn in the room we stayed in, but there were signs that they were in the process of remodeling. Overall the hotel is very grand and beautiful. The staff was wonderful, very helpful and friendly. The location was good. Grant Park is right across the street and had live music almost every night. The only complaint is that some of the conference rooms were very cold, some warm and other areas were hot. I am sure it is difficult to control the temperature in a hotel this large.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 80s decor & attack of the tourists.”
Reviews.Author: DJ-Martilicious
Reviews.Content: I think the subject says it all... It's cheap for a reason, but definitely not a bad spot.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet south Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Red_Flashpacker
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the heart of the theater/arts district of Chicago across from a lovely park and within walking distance of the Museum Campus. The staff was very helpful and the room was spacious and comfortable. The downside were charged Wi-Fi and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and elegant”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this Hilton, normally stay at the Hyatt or Sheraton but my conference was held here. The hotel is positively HUGE - the elevator trivia said it would take 4 years and 83 days to stay in all the rooms! The decor is nice, a mix of old and new. A lot of history in this hotel. Quick notes; -definitely take a room with 2 beds versus a King room. The King rooms are about half the size of the 2 bed rooms. No kidding! -request a high floor to minimize noise. -nice bathroom amenities! -Starbucks out the front and to the left. They don't open until 7 am though. -phone and internet connectivity can be sketchy in conference rooms. -staff are very friendly with a special shout out to Amey in housekeeping :) I have only a couple of knocks - one is location. If you're coming to Chicago for shopping/sightseeing/nightlife, it's not really walking distance to much of that. Even though it's on Michigan Ave, it's closer to Soldier Field than Watertower, pretty far south. Second, the only free gym activities are the pool and walking track, otherwise it's $15/day which is crazy (but typical of the larger chains). Nice stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but OK”
Reviews.Author: RollOnYouBears
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable with good A/C (appreciated on a muggy Chicago trip). The furnature and finishes were dated with lots of dark wood and gilded finishes. The mattress was comfortable. Nice pool and workout facilities with a full locker room. Service was OK - bell staff didn't offer help even though I was loaded with bags and packages for a recent business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: brnxslices
Reviews.Content: Very large hotel. Rooms were clean. Buffet was Expensive. Had a billing issue but they took care of it. Had an early check out and had a few drunks in lobby that was only down side but in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic people work here!”
Reviews.Author: IowaWoman123
Reviews.Content: My husband went along with me for this business trip and we had a wonderful time! When we got there check-in was fast and pleasant. When the lovely young woman asked use about staying there before we said yes, we had but unfortunately had never been able to have a room with a view of the park and lake. She said "i'll see what I can do." and gave us a wonderful corner room with a view of the downtown, park and lake.The room was more than adequate, with a wonderful bed, wide screen tv and large bathroom. For an older hotel, the upkeep and refurbishing is very well done. At various time throughout the week we asked for information on local restaurants, events, and amenitiIs and received clear, and reliable information.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok as a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: taxicab3
Reviews.Content: Hotel personnel was great! Enjoyed the Irish bar - in certain places hotel showed it age - clean but not immaculate

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: CJTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Hilton Chicago. My room on the 25th floor was one that had access to the Executive Lounge and in-room free wifi. The room was large and had all the amenities one might expect for an upgrade. The concierge in the Executive Lounge and the one in the lobby were helpful on a couple of occasions and provided good information, as did the bell captain and doormen. This is a beautiful hotel that is located within walking distance to a number of good restaurants, the Art Institute of Chicago, and other attractions. The red double deck tour bus stops in front of the hotel, and taxis are always available. The hotel has an excellent lounge bar; in addition, for the younger, louder crowd, the bar in Kitty O'Sheas would be of interest. Kitty O'Sheas, an Irish pub, is know for its bar scene, not for its food. Within easy walking distance is Miller's Pub and Restaurant, which is excellent. The Hilton Chicago is a friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Old world class with sucky internet”
Reviews.Author: SMW_718
Reviews.Content: Room was clean & gorgeous, I do have an issue of them refolding my used towel and putting it back on the rack. And I guess they are cutting back to changing linens every 3 days unless you specify otherwise. I do hope they changed between guests. My main issue is the internet service, I used the basic Wifi for $14.99 for 24 hours. They DO NOT give you 24 hours. I started checking office emails after returning to the hotel room with dinner around 7PM, I was cut off the next morning around 8PM, that's not 24 hours, that's 12 hours. And I was cut off at 6AM the next day when I was ready to check out, so that's about 8 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bar, Rooms are OK?”
Reviews.Author: Wsr0224
Reviews.Content: Not worth what we had to pay for this. Had to stay there for a convention/work function. Air Conditioning was HORRIBLE. Our room never got down past 72 degrees. The double bathrooms were nice!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiranjyot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton this July with a friend, and the stay was overall very comfortable. It's a very old hotel and that is evident in it's style, carpets, furntiure etc... however it is well maintained. We had a single room with twin beds and 2 bathrooms (quite a pleasant surprise), well maintained, comfortable and clean, with good toiletteries. Our room overlooked brick walls - not the best view. In case you have a choice, ask for the lake view. We had stayed there only for 2 nights and used it as a base for sightseeing - so I will not be able to comment on the breakfast/ food etc. The hotel however does not offer any other complimentary services. Even internet access and parking facilities are paid, which was quite a put off! Most of the staff is polite, however they do ask for your room key rudely in the lift corridor, before letting you proceed to your room. I could overlook this as the hotel was teaming with people from a convention and it would become difficult to monitor the crowd. The plus is that it ( along with a few others like the Congress Plaza hotel, Hard Rock Hotel etc. ) is centrally located, walking distance from some of the key attractions of Chicago - Millenium Park, The Art Museum, Magnificent Mile etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, prestigious hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tampasteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my brother for a convention that was also held at the hotel. We stayed for four nights in a room with two double beds. Overall: This is a very large hotel with nice amenities, it is old, but well kept and reasonably convenient to everything. Room: Average hotel room size with two double beds, night stand, desk, coffee maker, flat screen TV. Most interesting of all was that it also had two bathrooms and two closets. Clearly the room was two rooms that have been combined, but they did a good job. The bed and pillows were comfortable, and had four feather pillows. Gym: Nice, with all the machines you would expect. They also have a indoor running track and indoor pool. The gym costs extra, but the pool and jogging track are free. Public areas: Well kept and stately. The elevators are odd in that one must press three buttons (one for each bank of elevators) to activate them. Location: Within about 2 blocks of the Harrison station of the Red Line, also the Van Buren Metra station is about 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Historical, but contemporary comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: stlanderson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is historic! The Hilton proudly displays the events from famous dignitaries to movies filmed at this hotel, and it is very interesting. However, it is not dated hotel. The hotel is updated and the rooms are clean and well kept. Location can't be beat being across the street from Grant park with Chicago museums, close to the theaters, and lots of restaurants within walking distance. We had a room with a view of Lake Michigan and took advantage of the pool and sundeck. We stayed at the hotel in July, but the rate was very reasonable. A great place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on Travelocity! Decent stay at the Chicago Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jetrombly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked through Travelocity's Top Secret Hotels and saved a bundle on this trip. The Hilton is a historic hotel that is in need of an upgrade. The lobby is gorgeous, however the hallways and rooms are not. Our room was caked in dust, a bit musty smelling, and was VERY dark. The bathrooms were very nice and the beds were quite comfortable. The location was good, not great. There really aren't too many bars or restaurants on S. Michigan. However, the Red Line "L" is located right behind the hotel and is much cheaper than a taxi. We used it to go to Wrigleyville and to get to N. Michigan Ave. Also, Grant and Millenium Parks are right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand (Old) Hotel, Helpful Staff - but A/C not good on hot days”
Reviews.Author: 1BlueSkyTraveler1
Reviews.Content: This the second year I have had a meeting (at the Chicago Hilton) during some of the warmest summer days in Chicago. The Hilton is a grand old hotel and just not up to keep things "cold" when the heat index is 105+ -- not a complaint , just a fact. Given the Grand Old structure -- this place has to be a huge burden on the staff. For example, I had a meeting professionally recorded (Hilton staff) and the engineer agreed to deliver a thumb drive to the front desk in about an hour. Several hours later I went to retrieve it - not there. However, Carsarra, a Guest Service Agent , made call after call on both hotel phones and a cell phone until she tracked down the proper person. The audio engineer and supervisor came -- apologized for causing the delay (and explain a problem with some hotel software) -- the staff worked diligently to help me -- but it is apparent the "systems" available to them are dated (hotel opened in 1927 and was last remodeled in 1984). Also, the sleeping rooms use an energy saving thermostat -- the room only cools to 73 degrees and the a/c turns off if you leave the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: tejasfox
Reviews.Content: Visiting during a busy 2day conference in Chicago. Most hotels booked solid. The full hotel allows you to meet a wide array of customers. Everyone is complaining about service, cleanliness, and overall experience. Location is good. Hotel is tired. Employees surly. Too many cool properties to choose from in this town, will never stay here again and will re-think Hilton in general

Reviews.Title: “Ick.”
Reviews.Author: maurlene
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on business - great proximity to office and central location if visiting the city; grand lobby and entrance. For you women traveling alone, the size of this place is huge (over 1000 rooms) - as I walked down hallway after hallway finally reaching my room, I wasn't feeling incredibly safe, and I was never fully comfortable any of the time I was staying there. Size of room was small, but that didn't bother me so much as the cigarette smoke and mildew smells, as well as the films of dust on the headboard of the bed. Sheets and towels weren't changed after three nights staying there, and the pots of tea/used teacups and milk I ordered 2 of the three nights were never picked up, all still sitting where I left them each night, and on the third morning I checked out. weird. Charge on my bill for parcel service, which I never used upon checkout. Wasn't that hung up on any of this until I reached my next destination, a beautiful, sparkling and clean hotel with impeccable service, clean and comfortable rooms, and I was immediately relaxed the moment I got in and dropped my suitcase on the floor. IF you're going to pay upwards of $250 per night, you deserve better than the Chicago Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BradfordwoodsTrekker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Hilton for 3 nights while visiting Chicago as a tourist. This hotel is ideally located for tourists, right across from Millenium Park on Michigan Avenue. It's very large and impersonal, and if there's a convention going on at the hotel (the Blackhawks convention was there during our stay, although that was not why we were there), there may be hundreds of people roaming around the lobby. However, our floor (19th) was very quiet at all times. Our room had 2 extremely comfortable queen beds with plenty of great pillows, and 2 full bathrooms! Loved that feature, as I was staying with my teenager and we both like privacy. The room was a little dark and the 2 windows looked out onto brick walls, so there was no view but we were not in the room much during the day so it didn't matter. Bathrooms were well-appointed, marble, nice showers and big towels, and very nice shampoos, soaps, etc. Hotel is within walking distance of Shedd Aquarium and Chicago Art Institute, as well as Millenium Park, 3 of the must-see things in the city. Public transportation is nearby and user friendly, and we took the "L" several times for destinations outside walking distance. Check-out was automatic and painless. Parking: the hotel offers self-park and valet parking at high rates. Instead we parked at a lot directly behind the hotel for $25/24 hours. Great deal! The only annoying part of our hotel stay was the in-room computer, which had a lot of advertising and the free search service on the computer only lead to more advertising. I could not even get info on the City Pass using that system. In addition, the screen automatically lights up at 8:00 a.m. even after I turned it off before going to bed. It lit up the room. I recommend unplugging it from the wall. Wireless was $15/day but we didn't need it because we had a smart phone. Would definitely stay here again if I get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff ... "needs some investment"”
Reviews.Author: DandMtraveling
Reviews.Content: Every, and I do mean EVERY staff person we came in contact with over four days was amazing. Hilton and the hiring and training departments should be proud. This hotel was built in 1936 and was bought by the US during WW II and then bought and redone by Conrad Hilton. It was the largest hotel in the US, 3000 rooms, a hospital, 18-hole golf course on the roof ... what a great history. President Obama was there during election night 2008 ... Grant Park, where he held his wonderful speech is just across the street. The property is full of history. On to our stay. Our room had amazing views of Lake Michigan ... which meant a morning sun. Hum. I'm certain it would be wonderful during the winter ... but we were there during the summer. The bathroom window was huge, no blinds ... I needed my sunglasses in the morning... and it was hot, really HOT. I am not making this up. Be careful ... one of the switches (unmarked) turns on the baseboard heat, which you do Not Need in the summer! This is the voice of experience. The air conditioning is TERRIBLE. It never got below 70, even when set to 65 (the lowest setting). It was very, very warm. I realize they are working with old systems. But I'll bet someone, somewhere could make the adjustments necessary to make the old systems work. We are Diamond Hilton members, so I'll mention the Executive area. Well, we have been spoiled, I guess. This was at the bottom of all the Executive lounges. The area looks as though it's been carved from a hall, in a neglected space. The "view" of Lake Michigan is limited. The breakfast was fine, and limited. The evening offerings were sad. In other Hiltons (in Paris, Athens, London, Lyon, and others around the world) there are offerings of wine, wonderful food and comfortable seating in the evening. The Hilton Chicago offered small tables, really horrid evening food and pay-by-the-glass ordinary drinks. We were very disappointed. I expected more from Hilton Chicago. We were really looking forward to our stay in this classic property, we would have to think about staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for museum campus”
Reviews.Author: annmarz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for event/party at hotel. Great for visiting Grant Park, Millenium Park and Museum Campus. Spacious room with 2 bathrooms. Wish they had an in-room safe. Nice toiletries. Bottle of water in room cost $6. Did not eat in any restaurants. Wish they hadfree wifi. In general hotel needs a refresh. Room A/C could have been colder.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Two_whiskers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of May. The hotel is a typical "grand old dame", lots of flowery carpets and bras fittings. I actually managed to get lost in the lobby as my friend dropped me off ath the wrong entrance. Check in pleasant and fast. Our room was comfortable, clean and generally forgettable. The iron didn't work, it was replaced when we requested. We had a city view and from one window we could see the lake as well. Location, right on Michigan Ave is definitely a major draw, although this hotel is a bit south from main atttractions. It was an easy walk to Millenium Park, a bit longer to river banks. Went to the Irish pub in the hotel on one evening for a nightcap. Certainly good to have a casual (and loud!) place onsite for all the business travelers to hang out. One thing which bothered me was a security woman next to elevator who barked at me: "Room key!" - late at night. I sarcastically replied to her: "Good evening. MAY I see your room key, PLEASE" because that's how, I believe she should've addressed me. Needless to say, the woman wasn't pleased and I was treated to a several seconds of threatening stare. Oh, well, it's not Four Seasons, right?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with lots of history and warm people”
Reviews.Author: LarisaNagra
Reviews.Content: Great location with fantastic view!! Recommend that hotel goes 'Green' as nothing seems to get recycled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Quinnton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel June 21-26 for a convention. The hotel room was very spacious (we got the one with the two beds and two bathrooms). We didn't have much of a view (but my father's room did and it was beautiful! That was the executive level though). We had no problems with our room or the hotel staff, who were very helpful during this busy time. My only complaint is related to the charges for the gym (our convention received a special rate of $25 for the entire stay; regularly this is $15 a day) and the wireless internet (we receive a special rate of $7 a day; regularly this is $12.95 a day). At lower quality hotels, these amenities are FREE. This is something the Hilton should reevaluate in the future. Even if they have to consider rolling the cost into the room charge, that would be better for the consumer in the long run. I would consider staying at this hotel in the future due to the service I received and the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, classic, big-city hotel close to a variety of attractions - but bring a fat wallet”
Reviews.Author: PASkyGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8 nights in June/July 2011. Lots going on close by at that time like Taste of Chicago, concerts, fireworks, etc. This hotel dates back to the grand era of urban hotels with its cavernous ballrooms, ornate fixtures, and long list of VIPs who've stayed here over the years. With 2 adults and 2 kids (13,10) we had a room with 2 double beds and 2 bathrooms. The 2-bathroom rooms are a HUGE plus when 4 people are trying to get ready in the morning! The room itself was a roughly 350 sq ft room and a bathroom was on each side of the main room. Beds were very comfortable, climate control was great for cooling, LCD tv had lots of channels, water pressure even at the 18th floor was very good. Getting extra towels each day was no problem. Concierge was good (but personally I thought could have given better deals - i.e. baseball tix with a 50% to 75% mark up???!!!). Check in/out was fast and staff were very knowledgeable. Called ahead a few days to reserve a refrigerator for the room - DO THIS if you can and go to a local food store (we used CVS a few blocks away) and stock your room with cereal, fruit, milk, juice, crackers, etc.- especially for when you're looking for a snack or quick breakfast. Fridge is $40 for length of your stay but we saved some serious $$ eating a quick breakfast in the room each morning as their buffet breakfast is over $20/person. Indoor pool is nice, sundeck is nice, lots of seating and even more towels available. Exercise equipment is not free unless you are a silver or higher HHonors member. Biggest gripe is the wireless internet charge of $40 for 5 days or $18 for 1 day. The Motel 5 at any truck stop provides free internet so being charged so much for wireless after paying nightly room rates of $250+ is pretty greedy in my opinion. But I must admit the wireless speed was fast and reliable. This location is across the street from Grant Park which was a great place to walk and relax - my son and I took our baseball gloves and had some catches relatively close to the hotel when we had some down time. The aquarium, Field museum, and planetarium are a 20 min or so walk from the hotel. Navy pier is a cab/bus ride. The CTA red line is 1 block west and 1 block north - that will take you to wrigley and US Cellular fields among lots of other places. Overall a nice hotel if you're in Chicago for a week or so.

Reviews.Title: “Charming History; Not So Charming Service”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this historic property. There was lots to like, although there were some flaws. I'd say it's 3.5/5 (I defaulted to three, average, in the TripAdvisor system). Had the service at check-in been better and the concierge lounge more in-line with the quality of lounges at other Hilton properties, it would have easily been a "very good." The hotel is huge and hosts big conventions. That has advantages and disadvantages -- it's advantageous in that the lobby is always busy, there's always people to watch, etc. It's disadvantageous in that the lines at check-in can be long, there are lines for elevators, etc. Overall, I think you have to know whether you like big downtown hotels or not. If you do, you'll like this property's size and vibe; if not, you should look elsewhere. Given its size, it's not the kind of hotel that's going to feel intimate and personalized, even if the service is of high quality. That said, the hotel's structure itself isn't corporate in that bland, every-property-the-same way that you often find with hotels -- the lobby and public spaces are beautiful and full of history; the hotel does a nice job of highlighting this history through wall-hangings, etc. My room was fine, although it was very small. (Given this hotel's historic nature, the rooms are all over the place -- I've stayed here previously and had a much larger room; this time, my room was small.) Everything was in good condition -- nice-looking bedding, very comfortable mattress, clean carpet, nice television, etc. The bathroom felt a little older, but still had nice surfaces. The decor is old-world, which is appropriate for an historic property like this one, but it felt relatively fresh and not worn-out. Since I was on an executive floor, I had upgraded personal care products (inclusion of body wash, mouthwash, etc.), a robe, etc. The desk had a large flatscreen monitor on it; this appeared to replace a typical guest service guide. You could look up information about Chicago, look at the room service menu, etc. Overall, I thought that the touch screen didn't add much beyond show -- the information on Chicago was limited (and, annoyingly, largely targeted those tourist-heavy businesses that had chosen to advertise on the system), the touch-screen functionality wasn't always responsive, and it took up a lot of space on the desk that I would have preferred for personal use. Service at the hotel was mixed. My check-in experience was not very positive. There was a VERY long line (even in the lane for Hilton HHonors elite members), no apology for the wait, and an agent who (1) was very transactional in her approach and (2) wasn't very knowledgeable about Hilton HHonors benefits. The doorman opened my cab door, but offered no assistance with the luggage in the cab's trunk, nor did he open the door for me. Thankfully, other service shined -- housekeepers said hello at every turn, there was nightly turndown service, room service was polite and very timely, etc. Food and beverage were similarly mixed. My room service ordered came very quickly and, for the most part, was very good. I had a salad that was full of vegetables and very, very good. The bruschetta I ordered had fresh ingredients, but the bread had gotten soggy, which made it hard to eat. While room service largely impressed, the breakfast and snacks in the concierge lounge were a huge disappointment. My advice is to NOT go for the upgrade of a concierge room at this property -- the breakfast (some stale-tasting bagels, cereal, and pale-colored melon) is on par with what you might find at a Fairfield Inn. That was a big disappointment -- you'd think Hilton would aim to impress with the concierge lounge at one of its flagship properties, but the impression given is that they've just aimed to cost-cut. The staff also didn't keep up with replacing the food in a timely manner. During both the evening cocktail hour and two mornings of breakfast, there were long lines while the guests waited for the staff to replace items that had run out. The hotel's fitness center is fantastic -- huge with tons of equipment, high ceilings, views of the city, etc. The only bummer is that it closes (I prefer 24-hour hotel gyms) and that, unless you are a Hilton HHonors elite member, it costs money to use (I didn't have to pay thanks to my Hilton status, but I still find it obnoxious when a hotel charges people to use its gym). The hotel's location is OK. It's right on Michigan, so it has great views of the lake (from at least some of the rooms) and is immediately across from Grant Park. However, it's in the South Loop area, so most of the major attractions and businesses are a few blocks from the hotel itself. Overall, I enjoyed the hotel, and it delivered a good value for what I paid. However, by no means did the hotel win my loyalty -- there are other hotels within the downtown Chicago area that easily match this hotel in terms of quality of accommodation, service, location, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel and bad management”
Reviews.Author: djdjdj100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton hotel for 5 nights. I always stay at Hilton hotels. I was checked in into a room that was so so dirty. The dust is all over. You cannot imagine the thickness of dust on the AC filter. You have to call the housekeeping to ask for amenities because they do not provide enough. I complained and they barely cleaned it well. I complained to the management and they sent the housekeeping again. At the end it was cleaned which was on the 4th night of my stay. I did not received any apologize letter or e-mail from the management and this shows how inefficient they are. I do not recommend this hotel at all. I paid almost $300 a night and you can get a better rate and room in Chicago and close to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Large, historic hotel, but needs some updates”
Reviews.Author: MGreulich
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Hilton is a large, historic hotel with a lot of character, but it is ready for some updating and maintenance. The location is very close to Grant Park, the aquarium, and the Art Institute, but is about a 25 minute walk to the heart of Michigan Ave. While there is nothing bad about this hotel, there is nothing especially outstanding either. I think the best aspect of this hotel is the gym on the 8th floor -- it is large, up to date, and very clean. Definitely check it out for a great workout. There is also an indoor pool and hot tub. The rooms are very average, check in was quick, and housekeeping was pretty reliable (although I didn't get new soap, shampoo or conditioner all week).

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcia2465
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Chicago Hilton at the last minute when weather canceled a sidetrip to the Michigan shore. We loved it. We had a 21st floor room with a view and used the executive elevators. The room was large and comfortable. The staff, especially the concierge, was very helpful. We could walk to most downtown attractions and restaurants. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel that lives on it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: Iain Y
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfort and the staff accommodating however the food is not what you would expect from a hotel of the Hilton's standard. My biggest grip are the extra charges. I have never been charged extra by any hotel to receive a small parcel (book from Amazon) or store my bags on check out whilst waiting for the bus to the airport. They also charge for the internet $35 for 5 days. The advise from the concierge on trips, where to eat etc was not great as talked out of buying a go-card with the price of the attractions included to a trolley bus pass with no attractions included on the grounds that the go-card finished at 5.30. Only to find the trolley bus pass also finished at 5.30 and you were not able to queue jump as you would with a go-card.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service ( June 17 - June 19, 2011)”
Reviews.Author: kayxd1
Reviews.Content: After looking for a decent hotel. God's favor found us this hotel. I wasn't so sure about because some reviews weren't all that great. We arrived about 6:30 am, they allowed us to check into the room. Yipee! Our room was on the 11th floor (non-smoking, 2 double beds) and after I laid in the bed, I could smell smoke. I asked the housekeeper to get me some more sheets. Before I knew it the supervisor was at the door, checking out the room. I told her it wasn't that big of a deal, but she insisted on taking care of us. She had Calvin come a remove all the sheets and covers and they replaced them with new ones. The housekeeping staff was extremely Friendly and Professionally. I felt like my need was their priority and that made me feel really good! I do have some complaints...the lady at the concierge's desk didn't tell us we had to cross the street to catch the bus! We managed! LOL! My biggest complaint is that the bathroom did NOT have a fan!! Ugh! The hotel should also update the carpet in the hallways and in the rooms (or at least on the 11th floor), or maybe even a really good cleaning, it would look a lot better. However, it was really neat that the room had a computer that said welcome and had information for me for free. That was cool! I am really big on customer service, because for many people/companies...its is lost, but NOT for Chicago Hilton! Great Job Chicago Hilton!!!!! 2 thumbs up to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Same Rate-Rooms are not Equal”
Reviews.Author: JosefGP
Reviews.Content: Wedding- block of rooms reserved. Most had rooms on top floors, nice view, large rooms.Several other couples including ourselves, had room so small could not walk around bed. King sized bed was the room. Large desk was almost up against the side of the bed. Dresser and TV right at the foot/side of the bed. View was of a gravel roof and two walls. Very dark. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Tray and tissue holder were tarnished. We felt cheated because we paid same rate as those who had top floors and larger rooms. (They did not upgrade).If booking for wedding, make sure all are in same grade of rooms. We were embarrassed to invite any of the family to our room. There was not room to move with just two people. Not happy.Do not feel price justified room.

Reviews.Title: “Last night treat, well worth it”
Reviews.Author: YBOD98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a last minute, last night stay on our holiday and we were not disappointed. Tired and dusty from the road we were whisked off into luxury, treated superbly and had a great time. Our room was high enough for great views over the city (somewhere around the 15th floor) and was well furnished and very comfortable both in the bedroom and bathroom. The swimming pool was gigantic and excellent fun for the kids, we could have stayed for hours. eating in the hotel is not cheap but was very good and appreciated as a luxury after much travelling. The staff were great in helping sort out details with luggage, hire cars and keeping the kids occupied without our last day and a half descending into chaos. They also organised all the details we needede to squeeze a trip in to the Willis (Sears) Tower whilst looking after everything for us. It may not be cheap but I have no qualms in recommending this excellent hotel to anyone. I want to return to Chicago and stay here again, preferably soon!

Reviews.Title: “A/C didn't work and we were Nickle and Dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: modnewt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early June for a conference. I've generally had good experiences at the Hilton, but this was a poor one. For starters, internet access at the hotel is $18/day. In 2011. You're kidding, right? Other hotels in the area had free wireless. Worse yet, the conference rooms at the hotel had no Internet access nor cell phone service. Unacceptable for a business conference. In this day and age, people are expected to work and receive phone calls even when at a conference. Finally, the A/C in my room couldn't keep the room cooler than 77 degrees. I complained several times and finally got them to move me to a different room, but not only after 2 attempts on their part to fix the A/C. Parking at the hotel was $20/day than other lots in the area. Fancy Carpet and pillow top beds are pleasant, but you need to cover the basics also.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: cooki48
Reviews.Content: My husband and i travel to chicago a couple of times per month for leisure and for some reason have never stayed at this hotel before. Now i will stay no where else. it is the most beautiful hotel with old classic charm. From the ceiling to floor windows to the dark rich wood throughout, there were so many things about this hotel that you do not get with the newer trendy hotels. It felt homey, spacious, and very comfortable and the staff and check in were delightful. Would recommend this hotel to everyone...it was a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hunters = Second Class Guests”
Reviews.Author: Adventursaurus
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago was a very beautiful hotel with a great pool with a view, and the conveniences of shops right downstairs, not to mention the fantastic location across the street from Grant Park. The room was perfect size and they had a touch screen in the room to guide to local attractions and games for the kids. The self-park was $43 a day, which was not disclosed to me until I received a bill under my door at check out. They did make sure to tell me as I checked in that I would not be able to take advantage of any of the H-Honors advantages since I booked with a "third-party." In other words, no points or upgrades since I booked through Priceline. We asked if there was a room that had a view of the park (since the hotel was pretty empty, I thought we could try), and they said yes there is, but when we got up there it was a room that faced that direction, but with no view at all. It looked out at the somewhat noisy air conditioning unit. There was no discounted or complimentary breakfast for guests, and when we were not ready for housekeeping when she stopped by at 10AM, she never came back, and the room was never cleaned. Bargain hunters, park the car across the street for $23 a day, and be prepared for no extra service for the discounted price. Otherwise it is an excellent location and walking distance to all the family destinations like museums and parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, stunning views from Wrigley field to Navy Pier.”
Reviews.Author: mommyoffive
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was wonderful, but for the price, I would expect a few things to be included that were not. Guests are not allowed control of the individual room temp., our room was so hot in the morning when we woke up & discovered this. I have stayed in many hotels all over the country & internationally, and have not experienced, or realized yet that some hotels apparently do this. It seems really ridiculous. The other thing that was a little annoying was that WiFi use is $7.99 per minute. I would expect that that would be complimentary at the price I paid for our room. One of the lamps in our room had a broken lampshade, it looked really ridiculous. Can't see how that could be overlooked. The faucet in our bathroom was leaky, the bathroom is tiny, and there is no fan, or window that opens. Feels like they expect complete morons to stay here with the controls on everything. I almost forgot, the room has a small refrigerator, but no microwave or room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Respectable place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: CaseyMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a long weekend for a conference. The meeting facilities were ample. The hotel is located on south michagan avenue, so the location is not perfect if you are not much of a walker. If you like to walk and the weather is good, it's reasonable. The room was relatively large for a big city and the bed was very comfortable. Bath was dated but clean. There was a very annoying access terminal in the room that was bright and apparently broken, since I could find no way to shut it off at night. I ended up calling the help line that was attached, they rebooted it but it still was busted so they ended up telling me to just unplug the monitor to get it off. When I came to Chicago before I stayed at the Allerton, in comparison the location there was better but the room at the Hilton was much more spacioius. The bar in the lobby turns into a coffee stand in the morning so you can get a cup of starbucks for about 50% more than at a real starbucks. I didn't use the parking so I can't comment, but it was easy to get a taxi at this location. The check-in staff was friendly and efficient, reminded me to give my hilton honors number even though I forgot to put it on the reservation. Check out was simple as well, though they ask you leave a message on a voicemail rather than just leaving, which seemed odd. Overall a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed, from another era”
Reviews.Author: bostnwhalr
Reviews.Content: Ok, the place is staggeringly huge. And yes, many options are costly including the wireless internet access in your room (which is free at Hampton Inn's, but I digress). You have to know this going into a Hilton, where you pay extra for these things that are often free at a Hampton. When I booked a room, the cost was a bit cheaper than the Hampton Inn, so I thought, what the heck. This place is an experience.You really feel like you are walking through history. Yes, if you're not on in a convention, it is easy to feel somewhat lost, and the hallways on each floor seem to go on forwever but who cares? The place just oozes character from a bygone era. There was plenty of staff on hand to handle check-in quickly and painlessly. One caveat: The restaurant scene within a few blocks of the hotel are somewhat limited. I found a sushi place a block away that was outstanding (can't recall the name right now!). Do go to Yolk for breakfast or lunch. Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel, slightly faded glory, but still very nice”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago is one of those grand old hotels from a gilded era, with a big, loud, bustling lobby and public areas. But for such a big, busy place, my check in was quick and easy. And once you weave your way through the throngs of nametag-wearing convention people, an elevator lobby with different banks for different floors will take you to your room. My room was large in one sense (it was long), but not very deep (the foot of one of the 2 double beds was very close to the work desk). The rooms were clean and well-appointed, but looked a bit dated and worn. But it featured a large bathroom with Neutrogena bath products, and a little bar area with a mini-fridge, faucet and coffee service. And the in-room coffee service featured Lavazza coffee, with liquid creamer rather than that powdered crap. The bed was comfy, but the mattress moved around too much. The big flat screen TV was great, and there was touch-screen monitor on the desk featuring hotel & Chicago information, as well as paid services such as internet access. The hotel is well located, right on S. Michigan Avenue across from Grant Park. It's two short blocks from the Harrison station on the El's Red Line, and the buses that run up and down Michigan (King Dr., Cottage Grove) stop right outside.

Reviews.Title: “I Don't Think Conrad Would Be Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MandMIdaho
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Chicago for 5 days. We are Gold Hilton Honors Members- and we paid for an Executive Room. When we declined the bellman/doorman's request to help us with our luggage, he then ignored us as we struggled with the incredibly heavy doors. He also stood and watched as we were accosted by a very scary homeless man repeatedly asking us for money- right in front of the hotel in broad daylight! I guess that doorman "showed us!" Welcome to Chicago. Our "upgrade" was a "2 bathroom" executive room. We weren't impressed. The reception desk was efficient, but not overly friendly or accommodating. The hotel, the day after Memorial Day, was almost empty on the executive floor, but we did not receive a "view" or "corner view" room. The room was incredibly noisy with street and "elevated train" noise - good luck getting a good night's sleep. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the hotel has a "historic" ambience, but the rooms, even on the executive floor aren't anything to write home about. There is a computer monitor in your room that turns itself on at 8:00 a.m. every morning, hoping you will use one of its services, and remains on until you turn it off. I found this irritating. There is no safe in your room. Unbelievable for a Hilton. If you want to secure your belongings, you have to use the hotel lock boxes. If you lose the key, it will cost you a $175 "drill fee" to open the box. If you are used to a customary Manager's Reception, with at least beer, wine, soft drinks and hot snacks - you won't find it here. The "manager's reception" is the same cheese and crackers and soft drinks night after night - and they throw in something "hot" like a meat-filled puff pastry which I did not find edible. The breakfast is the skimpiest I have ever experienced at a Hilton - tiny pastries, cereal, some fresh fruit. Really?? When we asked for a "How Are We Doing?" card to report on a REALLY friendly and helpful employee, Desiree, we were told at the front desk that they did not have them. We have stayed in Hilton's all over the world and that is again, unheard of! Maybe they don't want to know how they are doing. Also, when we booked this hotel, the website said the hotel had "a free local area shuttle." They do not and have not offered it for over a year. If we had it to do over again, we would have stayed at the Embassy Suites which is closer to the downtown area and the Navy Pier - and would have had a cooked-to-order breakfast and a REAL manager's reception. If this is how the Hilton treats "Gold" status guests. . .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: todavis
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying at the Hilton Chicago. Located close by Millennium Park and other great attractions. Even tho the weather was rainy, we still had a great time. We came to Chicago to just "hang out" and "eat.' We will be back! The mattresses were smaller than a double. It was like they were three quarters. Two adults will not be comfortable in a bed together unless they are 5 feet and weigh 120 lbs. That was a downside. The rooms all have a touch screen computer to search restaurants and other attractions which is free, BUT WiFi is not free. Internet access was $14.95 a day. If Super 8 can provide free WiFI, so can this hotel. We still had a lot of fun at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A HOME AWAY FROM HOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: 45cubs
Reviews.Content: have stayed here many weekends over the years often traveling with a 50lb dog.the staff is great ! we may be a little spoiled i have always stayed in a junior suite or better.some of the views we have had have been spectacular!!! yes the elevators can be a pain sometimes(when the hotel has a convention like the blackhawks they can get pretty bad and you can wait sometimes almost 10 minutes!) so ask for a low-floor if that is a big deal for you LOL.this place has a lot of history and has been a lot of fun for family and friends over the years!!! never been disappointed in all my stays here and what an awesome location especially if you travel with a dog!

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations -- Good Value -- location Not an issue”
Reviews.Author: ToddBu
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel for a 1 night stay I was not excited about the location (preference was north michigan avenue), but I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms, and restaurant were very nice. Access to grant park was extremely convenient. The room was ~$200/night, which was about $70 dollars less than the north michigan avenue. $10 cab ride to shopping area was not a big deal at all. Consider as a great value hotel in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the other Hilton Hotels in Chi Town!”
Reviews.Author: hardworkdad
Reviews.Content: I don't ask for much when I travel, a clean room and a bed I fit in (almost 6' tall and under 200 lbs). To make sure I always have a king or queen size bed I have it in my profile and double check my confirmation. I arrived at 6pm and they put me in a room with a double bed. I was eventually able to get a king in a downsized room but they never adjusted my bill. Still working on this. So much for being an Elite member who plans ahead...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, but extras could be costly”
Reviews.Author: perlusha
Reviews.Content: This one is unusually luxurious in some aspects and lacked in others. Interiors of the hotel, hallways, ballrooms and salons are decorated like royal court of Versailles, so make sure not to miss this architectural wonder. Hotel displays pictures of presidents, heads of state and even Queen that stayed there. Our standard, rather inexpensive room had two modern spacious bathrooms, which is incredible. It was very clean, modern and elegant. Water pressure, however, was a little low. Beds are the comfiest I ever slept on, bedding is top-notch, pillows are comfortable, and comforters are warm. Big closet, spacious bathrooms are a big advantage. Disadvantage: no internet, it costs extra. No business center to use free internet. You have to pay. There is a computer touch screen in the room, that allows very limited browsing of the hotel-related topics and that's it. Bring your own laptop and pay for wi-fi. Swimming pool (small and full of kids) is free, but exercise facilities will cost you extra. No free breakfast, but it does not matter, so many places to eat around the hotel. And do not touch the bottled water in the room; it is, like, seven dollars. Hotel staff goes out of their way to accommodate guests. If you request anything, like towels or coffee, they will bring it to you very quickly. Maintenance comes at lightning speed when called. I have never seen such a prompt service. When we visited Chicago, the weather was brutal: it was snowing. Heating in the room is very peculiar. Heating/air conditioning unit was blowing cool air into the room. It felt freezing, so we asked front desk to fix the thermostat settings. After a while, however, we realized that no one did anything about the problem: it still was terribly cold. Therefore we had to ask again. Imagine our surprise when we found a portable heater installed in our room. It was a lifesaver, because Chicago weather was too much for us. I could not imagine doing more for the hotel guests. Location of the hotel is very convenient, you can walk to Chicago Art institute, Symphony and Chicago architectural foundation, that offers the best guided tours of the city. Metro is close, Buckingham fountain is in the park across the street, and Millennium park with famous Bean is nearby. Eateries are abundant and moderately priced. Around the hotel there are many universities and the atmosphere is vibrant. And famous Buddy Guys is just across the street. Overall, if this hotel is good for presidents and could accommodate a Queen of England (see her thank-you letter framed on the wall), then it was definitely good enough for us. If we ever come to Chicago again despite their dreadful weather, we will stay at Hilton Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The first new technology Iâ€™ve seen in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveler3
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and stay in hotels a lot, very often in Hilton properties. I must say I was really impressed with the computer Hilton provided in the room. A great big touchscreen, welcomed me by name, and I was able to explore the hotel, surf the internet, and explore the city with a great directory of everything around the hotel. I must say this was a great convenience and I really wonder why more hotels don't offer this!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Smokey Rooms & Below Average Service”
Reviews.Author: cheechman32
Reviews.Content: Good location, fairly clean hotel. Unfortunately, our non-smoking room wreaked of smoke after we checked in. Promptly brought it to the attention of Customer Service, who after much discussion, informed me they could only offer me another room on their smoking floor which was all they had available! I find it hard to believe I was in the only open non smoking room in a hotel the size of the Hilton Chicago. Customer service offered to have housekeeping come freshen the room, I don't believe they ever did because it still wreaked of smoke when we returned later in the evening. For the price, there are nicer, more modern options where I have received better service in downtown Chicago. The W, Hyatt Towers, and Palmer House Hilton all come to mind. Bottom line, my experience at the Hilton Chicago was average at best.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: ye z
Reviews.Content: We booked at priceline,it is really a good value. the location is convienient. everything is good.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hildegard19
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the morning, but the woman at the desk offered me options to have a room immediately. The restaurants had great food reasonably priced with terrific staff members who were friendly and helpful. The staff answered my questions about the locations of rooms and neighborhood venues and were generally really fabulous. I would definitely stay there again when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: YorksmanUk
Reviews.Content: Fascinating hotel to explore with lots of history. Elegant main entrance with a pianist playing on the mezzanine level evenings. It was like stepping back in time to a grander age with floors of polished marble or plush carpets. Our room on floor 17 not over large but who cares? We had a great city to explore. Unwind at Kitty O'Shea's with a good selection of beers including the local Honkers and decent meals. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. Okay it may be 15 minutes walk from the centre (we're Brits, we walk everywhere - no matter what the weather) but when Grant Park is only over the road it more than compensates for that; plus you get the pleasure of that fabulous skyline everytime you leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: breesgreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the Hilton after getting a great price on priceline.com. The hotel itself is beautiful, and while it is south of the Magnificent Mile, we had decent walking shoes so we walked to pretty much everything closeby. The room was smaller than we expected, but given the price and location, we were fine with it. Front desk did offer to upgrade to a lake view for an additional $50 a night, which we didn't accept. Good service, and a nice, historic place to stay on a quick visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,don't touch the bottled water in the room”
Reviews.Author: rebe_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on Michigan Ave on Easter weekend. I called the morning before arriving to confirm my reservation and was told I may arrive for an early check-in at no extra charge. when we arrived I asked for an upgrade, which they did give us a 2 bed, 2 bathroom upgrade. The room is super small, but we were never in the room anyhow. It was nice having the 2nd bathroom since we had a teenage girl and boy with us. One bathroom has a stand up shower while the other has a bathtub. The beds were small, but worked, especially considering I shared my bed with my neice and it was fine and my husband shared his bed with our son, no complaints from anyone. The pool and jacuzzi were very busy, but we still managed to get a spot and enjoy the jacuzzi tub. BTW-there are 2 jaccuzis by the pool, so that was a plus. The pool is very large, and I'm sure one of the largest you'll find in Dowtown Chicago. The location was ok, we wanted to be as close to the museums as possible. The Shed and Field Museum are both within walking distance. We did get an all day bus pass on the second day, since the museum of Science and Industry is way to far to walk. The bus pass was only $5.75 each and we ended up going from the hotel to the museum, to Ed Debevics, Navy Pier, and Willis Tower, so it was well worth the cost. Much cheaper than a taxi cab would have been. There wasn't really any restaurants close by, except for Buddy Guy's Legends. Do yourself a favor and go there, I had the BEST jambalaya ever, no wonder its rated in the top ten of the taste of chicago. My neice had the Gumbo and it was also fantastic. Stay away from the chicken, husband and son had that, they both said it was dry. While we were there, we even got to enjoy some blues music. My first ever experience and it was awesome. Also you can bring kids as long as its before 8 pm, and btw- after 9 pm its a $20.00 cover to get in..We were there on a Friday night, so not sure if that cover is every night. There was a liquor store by the hotel which was an easy walk for beer, pop or wine and I must say they have a HUGE selection of wine, plus on that Friday they had a wine tasting event going on at the store, so I was able to try a sample of $80.00 bottle of wine that I will never buy. If you get the bus pass, ask the concierge at the hotel to write down what #'s or name of roads that you have to get on/off at. That way if your not familiar with the area your aren't questioning every bus driver to which stop you need to get on/off at. I am appalled that the Hilton charged me $7.68 for a bottle of water that I never touched. Its ridiculous that they would even leave the bottle of water in your room, with no note stating how much it cost. Now I did call the hotel today when I saw the charge on my account and they said they are reversing the charge, but I still think charging that amount for water is CRAZY! Also there is no internet service????? I did stay at the Hilton, right?? Overall, it was a good stay, but paying $159.00 a night(Included parking-booked on Travelocity) I do think the hotel could have included breakfast and internet, but we are in Chicago. Always, Always ask for an upgrade, the worst they will do is say no. BTW- I did ask for a late checkout and we got one, at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Distinct lack of customer service”
Reviews.Author: thegoderic
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently as an hhonors Diamond member as part of a two week trip to Chicago with a weekend elsewhere in the middle. Rooms are smaller than other hotels in comparable locations, such as the Blackstone, but there does seem to be a very rules bound attitude when it comes to customer service. On the Friday of the first week, I wanted a 3 p.m. checkout so called down to arrange. the conversation went something like:- "I'd like a 3 p.m. checkout if that's at all possible" "That'll be $75 Sir" "What, even for a Diamond" "Yes Sir, Diamonds get 2 hours for free, then it's $75. I'm afraid I have no flexibility in this" "In that case can you cancel my 5 night stay for next week" "I'd be happy to give you a complimentary 3 p.m. checkout" Firstly I don't want to stay in an hotel that has such inflexible rules for late check outs. I've stayed in many other large Hiltons that do display a good degree of flexibility including one that allowed me to keep the room til 6p.m. and then stay in the lounge for a further 3 hours when I was flying out on an overnight flight. Secondly, it isn't my style to threaten, but if threatening to cancel next week's stay brings about a change in approach, it leaves a nasty taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, smallest, most UNcomfortable beds, staff wouldn't move us.”
Reviews.Author: joyloveskevin
Reviews.Content: We are staying in this hotel now, tonight is our first night. There are 4 of us in a room with two "full sized" beds. Make no mistake, these are barely "double" beds, not even close to a queen. Our kids, who are 9 and 12, cannot get comfortable so one is sleeping on the floor. Shame on you, Hilton for not moving us to a more comfortable situation, and letting my baby sleep on the FLOOR! I did ask front desk to please help us change rooms or figure out bigger beds for us. But they were not willing to do anything for us unless we upgraded and paid more money. Oh, by the way, as I've been typing this, my husband has also moved to the floor. I have stayed in cheaper hotels with better beds. I'm sleepless in Chicago! (And furious that my child is so uncomfortable that he's sleeping on the FLOOR). Its always a shame when an individual's lack of customer service reflects poorly on the whole hotel. I also think its a shame when you book on Travelocity, a "top secret" hotel...and end up with an awesome rate, but you get treated like they're doing you a favor because you only paid $78 for your room, rather than people who may have booked differently, and had to pay more. I would be willing to bet that if we paid the regular rate, they would have moved us to a more comfortable room. I love this hotel, but I can't recommend it because of the front desk person's lack of customer service. Management, you can contact me at tandksmom02@yahoo.com, if I haven't contacted you first!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plantravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Hilton Towers on Michigan Avenue attending a conference. If you like hotels steeped in history this might be just right for your stay. It is a massive property with 3000 rooms, and lots of meeting space. We liked the mini TVâ€™s in the elevators that showed trivia presentations about the history of the hotel. We learned that the last 20 minutes of â€œThe Fugitiveâ€� with Harrison Ford was filmed in and around the hotel, and that every president of the America has visited at some point. Our room (with two double beds) was comfortable. The hotel is showing a little wear and tear along the room corridors but everything worked. The concierge desk was very knowledgeable with regards to restaurant recommendations, bookings, and directions. In fact all the hotel staff was very professional. Recommendation: Visit Buddy Guyâ€™s Legends Bar behind the hotel for a great Cajun meal and some fantastic Blues.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: lmasterz
Reviews.Content: First timer in the Hilton Chicago. It's definitely what you'd expect from a 4-star hotel. Nothing less. We were put in a double-bed room with 2 bathrooms. That was extremely convenient. Though the beds felt a bit small, the bathrooms made up for it. Fitness room is big and has all the amenities you need. Location wise, there is better as it's on South Michigan Av which can be quite a walk (especially in the cold) if you want to be within the vicinity of the "Magnificent Mile". Elevators seem a bit outdated as they shake quite a bit when going up (to the 15th floor) All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location is So-so depending on where you want to go”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for three nights for a conference and a friend came to hang out while I was there. The hotel is nice - especially the lobby/downstairs area - but the room was average. I actually thought it was a little on the small side, except that there were two bathrooms even though it was just a standard room. The beds were comfy and it was very quiet. B/c I got a conference rate internet was included, but normally you have to pay for internet. Basically most things are an extra charge, even having them hold your bags if you check out before you are leaving ($2 a bag). The location was so-so depending on where you want to go. It is definitely right downtown and very close to the museums. However, if you want to go shopping and to restaurants/bars (as we did) it is kind of a hike. To get to the Magnificent Mile and all the shopping it is about 2 miles. There really aren't that many restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Also, the blue-line L stop (to get to O'Hare) was almost a mile away. Again though, not everyone wants to walk and/or take mass transit, so this may not matter to everyone, we just ended up walking 10+ miles a day and wished we were in a different location. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. There was a small problem with my bill at checkout and the lady helping me took care of it quickly with no problems. Overall, it is definitely a nice hotel and very clean/quiet. Really it all comes down to where you want to be located within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, beware extra charges”
Reviews.Author: emergencyvacation
Reviews.Content: Hotel is up to Hilton standards except in house restaurants are nothing special. Beware charges for parking ($43 per night) and wifi is not free ($39.50 for 5 days) which is over the top when most hotels now provide wifi free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinUnclejesse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family. Absolutely beautiful-completely historic. We were on the 17th floor with stunning views of Lake Michigan. The hotel was very quiet. The beds were the best...slept extremely well. Rooms were on the small side but still very comfortable. A tad drafty as well but it is winter in Chicago in a 70 year old building. The pool was awesome-great views of the Chicago skyline. I don't know why people keep complaining about the "dated decor"-it's a super old building, what do you expect? We had breakfast at the Pavillion. It was good-pricey but good. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: hchiutx
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights for the Chicago Houseware Show. Pros: very quiet rooms; superb sound proofing so it was great for getting a good night's sleep, close to the show venue with free shuttle, close enough to the EL but probably not a good option in Winter time. History interesting to look at. Rooms are spacious enough. Cons: lost and found procedure is mirky at best - not even the front desk knows who to call and room service refers to "security" but the persons at the elevator/lobby can't give clear enough instructions. Bad chairs - not made for working. I ended up doing work in cafe's or take work to the show which is not ideal. Someone please change the chairs with the next upgrade project, or at least get some of them and assign to business travelers. Taking everything into account and having lived in Chicago for 3 years, I can probably recommend better hotel choices. If it is quality rest you are after - this is great. If you need to do some work at the hotel room - this is subpar. To play tourist this location is good. It is close to the field museum and to downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....satisfying!”
Reviews.Author: hollylooya64
Reviews.Content: One disappointment...no DVD player in the room, and no easy chair. the desk chair and the king bed. Bed was wonderful. Very quiet. Room was very clean. Breakfast in the Pavilion restaurant was OK....I recommend the blueberry pancakes but NOT the fritatta. Venture off the site for a wonderful and cheap meal at Flaco's Tacos! Recommended but not blown out of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, too many interruptions”
Reviews.Author: chicagotoots
Reviews.Content: From the front desk reception to the checkout, the hotel is Hilton. The room was quiet and soooo comfortable especially the pillows. Restaurants downstairs and Kitty O'Sheas pub for music and beverages. Only downside was we were bothered by housekeeping when they forgot a piece of paper in the room (looked like their report sheet for cleaning) there was no coffee in the room, got interrupted when the man came to check the mini bar and the housekeeper knocked on our door at 9a to clean. Come on... do we have to keep the "privacy please" sign on the door at all times?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a weekend in Chi-town”
Reviews.Author: Monica S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend who is in NYC and I were meeting in Chicago for the weekend before Valentine's day, had it all planned out. After a horrible night's sleep at the Congress Plaza Hotel, I looked this up right down the street and we moved hotels at 11a Saturday morning. They not only let us check in early but we had a room on the executive level, my boyfriend LOVED the computer in the room with the restaurant suggestions. Great hotel, it changed the pace of our whole weekend.

Reviews.Title: “I love, love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hanksgal
Reviews.Content: I love the Chicago Hilton. I've stayed here multiple times over the years and I always feel special when I'm here. The beds are so comfortable and the staff attentive. The location is great, as well.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: IwaRuggerBuggerIowa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a classic. It has a bit of history mixed in with some character. Overall, I was extremely pleased with my recent stay at the Hilton. The location is perfect. Rooms are spacious. Staff went out of there way to help and assist me with everything This is my favorite place to stay in Chicago. Cons. Cleanliness. I personally think they could have done a better job cleaning my room. The marble in my bathroom easily hides any unwanted hair - if you know what I mean. Gym. The gym is not Covered under the cost of your room cost. That is separate and is not cheap. Anyone looking to workout or run while they stay here be prepared to pay 15.00 dollars per workout. Parking. Not cheap. Why don't hey just include this in the price of the room?

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IRGPT
Reviews.Content: This iconic hotel has been around for a long time, and it is still a great place to stay. A very short walk to Millinneum Park and all of the lakefront attractions including the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium, Shedd Aquarium, and Soldier Field. Buddy Guy's Legends Club is literally out the back door across the street. It is a little bit of a hike to get to the River North and Mag Mile areas though, so if you want to be in that neck of the woods, get a cab, stay closer, or bring your walking shoes. But if the attractions noted above are your target then this is a great option. Both times I've stayed here the rooms have been fantastic and an incredible value for the price. I opted for the parking package which, when combined with the room rate, made this stay a bargain for the price. My room was a corner room with a separate sitting area. The staff was excellent. The young lady at the front desk was just great and took time to go into detail about the room, the hotel, and the surrounding area with a smile on her face. The hotel itself is beautiful and, if you have time, it is worth taking a few minutes to walk around the Normandie Lounge and the Grand Ballroom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historical Hotel - Rooms are OKish”
Reviews.Author: southhaventravelers
Reviews.Content: Take your time walking into this hotel, the entry is beautiful and you will feel like royalty. Like most upper end hotels, the more you pay for the room the less you will get for free (parking, internet, breakfast...). We got lucky and they gave us free internet access so we could continue researching and planning our weekend getaway. As for the room, very comfortable - but again this is a very old and classic hotel so they have had to put a pretty dress on a very old body. We had no issues other than an extremely slow bathroom sink (and we were near the top floor so it wasn't gravityâ€™s fault) and we forgot to turn on the 1970s switch above the digital thermostat. There were quite a few plugs around the room for charging all of our gadgets which was a plus. Overall the room was great for sleeping but we spent more of our time out in the city having fun. This hotel is four to five blocks from the Van Buren Street Train Station on the South Shore Line and just a few blocks from the Harrison Street â€œLâ€� (Red) so you can leave your car at home. We named our own price with Priceline, and because we had such a great rate, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok..Food in Kitty Oshea's horrible....”
Reviews.Author: WayneLeeds_UK
Reviews.Content: Stopped off with my daughter for 36 hours on the way to St Louis! Hotel was ok, room clean, good size and beds comfy.....although it did seem very quiet! We did make the mistake however of eating in Kitty OSheaâ€™s and for this to be part of the hotel you would have expected the food to have been of reasonable quality. However it was shocking...almost inedible.... The grilled chicken on the Caesar salad was stone cold, almost frozen & stank of whatever else it had been in a fridge with! The Irish home-made beer batter fish and chips were almost laughable - it was simply frozen fish shapes that you buy in most supermarkets....disgusting! DONT EAT IN HERE!!! Overall the stay was fine although the hotel steeped in history and old world elegance lacked any atmosphere or buzz and for me& personally i would not stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: timmy16
Reviews.Content: I am pretty mixed about how I want to rate this hotel, so here is my best shot. If you want that old and classic feeling hotel, this is the place for you. It has interesting pieces of history and gives you that 1930's feel. If you arent so into the history part...We had a junior suite which was very small and had a very awkword layout, almost like and "S" shape. The room was very clean, but dated and most of the reviews below give you a good feel for what to expect. I will add the bed was very comfortable and we got a great nights sleep! Location is decent and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Roosevelt CCPA conservatory audition”
Reviews.Author: cwspence_NH
Reviews.Content: Over the weekend we traveled to Chicago for my daughter's audition at the music conservatory at Roosevelt University CCPA for Jazz Voice. We stayed at the Chicago Hilton which was 2 blocks south of the school and well within walking distance. The Hilton turned out to be a good choice. We had a room with two double beds and a nice marble bath on the 21st floor. We loved the Crabtree & Evelyn bath products. The room had a view of Lake Michigan and Museum Campus from one of the three windows. The cost was about $100 per night, which I got from LastMinuteTravel.com but you might be able to do even better on PriceLine. For food we would recommend Yolk for breakfast - we went twice. Buddy Guyâ€™s Legends was great for dinner and live blues music. We also liked Tamarind for Chinese, where the Hilton provided at 20% off coupon. We had coffee and desert at Artist's down by Roosevelt. Very nice trip. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel NIce but room small. No kitchenette .Fitness awesome”
Reviews.Author: DowntownLisaBrown
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Jr suite room somewhat small. Bathrooms only have tub/shower together. For a suite and price I felt should have been alittle more classier for a Hilton. Bar closed early also. Waited 1 hour for luggage had to call down to get it.

Reviews.Title: “A Museum - but lacking.”
Reviews.Author: Acatchyscreenname
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Chicago for the Cubs Convention in mid-January. This hotel is a museum piece. There are many beautiful, ornate pieces in the lobby. The Grand Ballroom is impressive as well. It was clean and well kept, at least on the inside. As with any old hotel, there are areas that need work. First, kudos to the staff. Along with the thousands of Cubs fans staying there, the Bears were staying in the hotel the night before their game. Thus, there were a lot of people in the building. But throughout my stay, I had nothing but positive experiences with the staff. They were efficient and friendly, created an early check-in to help alleviate the rush. They get 5 stars. The room I stayed in was nice. No microwave, no fridge (though you can use the window sill in the winter). Wireless access in the room, but at $25 per day, it was way to pricey. My biggest knock was on the plumbing. The shower had a very small "hot" range. The plumbing also clanged in the night. 3 stars overall. The location is good, so long as you head north or east. I did walk around a bit in all the directions, and while I never felt unsafe, there were a few areas that gave me pause. It's just outside the Loop, and there are train stops nearby to get you where you want to go. The expensive wireless was a big issue for me. $25 per day or $8 per hour - there is no way I am going to pay that. Instead, I suggest going to Caribou Coffee behind the hotel, buying yourself a drink and using their free wireless. Bagcheck was $2 per bag. They did offer an hour grace on late checkout, but after that was $25 per hour. For that, I can only give one star. (I suspect that a portion of the reason for the expense can be tied directly to the unions that work at the hotel. Some of the stories I heard from folks at the convention on the costs of doing business in the hotel were crazy.) Kitty O'Shea's, the bar in the hotel, was reasonable and the folks were friendly. This hotel will appeal to a certain section of the traveling public - those who like ritzy-looking spots and who have money to burn. For folks on a budget or who don't need wood paneling, fountains and fancy floors, look elsewhere. You can always take the Red Line down to walk through the lobby and have a drink at Kitty's if you want to see the beauty of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Historical & Classy”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaTraveler_11
