Reviews.Content: Appreciated the helpful staff at this hotel. The rooms were very nice and we enjoyed the two bathrooms in our two bed room. Although the beds were not queen they were very comfortable and the best of quality. This hotel is SO full of history! We loved looking at the historical pictures throughout the hotel & especially the executive floor. It's a classy place and we will stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great setting, historic background...ordinary rooms, dated decor”
Reviews.Author: Rob591977
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at this hotel in early January for museum visits on a great weekend rate which included parking (Chicago parking is very expensive). Great location... Hilton is walking distance of Art Institute and many restaurants, theaters, State Street shopping, etc.. I wanted to try this hotel due to its historic background. My Hilton Honors status upgraded me to a "premium" room on the 22nd club floor with a spectacular view of Lake Michigan and the park. The hotel was gutted in 1985 and completely reconstructed, so retains little of its historic interior. The good part is, they reduced the number of rooms and increased the room size, eliminating most of the tiny rooms typical of 1920s hotels. The downside is, the decor and feel in public areas is more 1980s convention hotel than historic. My room was clean and well maintained, with a modern flat panel TV, king bed, minibar, easy chair, and cherry furniture, but the room was overall very ordinary. and not that big. Very annoying was a poorly-soundproofed drainpipe running past my room, which caused a very loud water-rushing sound from the wall when someone showered or used the toilet so loud I couldn't even hear the TV. Fortunately the hotel was nearly deserted so few people were showering. I had breakfast in the so-called "executive lounge", which was not as good as most Hampton Inns I've stayed at...rolls, juice, coffee, cold cereal. Very lame. For the same money, the more recently remodeled Hilton Palmer House nearby would be a better pick. This hotel has a great location, spectacular public spaces and history, but the rooms are about like any highway Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “No Free Wireless”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Traveller2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a grand old lady. As a grand old lady, this hotel needs to get into modern times. This includes FREE wireless. Free wireless is an expectation for modern hotels. Paying $25/day for wireless left a bad taste in my mouth that spread to the whole visit. The cost applied for something that is typically free is attrocious in modern times. Wireless is an issue that front desk refused to even acknowledge. Hilton Honors program was a pain also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pacersguy31
Reviews.Content: Came up with a group of about 15 people - had 6 rooms and came up for a Bears game. Great location, right off Michigan Ave and only a few miles from Soldier Field - worked well for us. Bears actually stayed there the night before the game, so got a chance to see some of Da Bears Saturday evening. Rooms were nice...2 bathrooms in each room, which worked out great. Web costs extra - not a big deal. Nowadays many of the upper echelon hotels charge for services - so it's not something that bothered me. Room was great - however, i must say...being a huge Colts fan, we had tons of beer and carried them downstairs into the restaurant in the lounge to watch the games on the big screen downstairs. Restaurant management didn't mind that we were making noise - but they sure didn't like the fact we had about 50 beers that we already had and weren't buying theirs for 6 bucks each LOL. Oh well. Would def. stay there again - great hotel, good location, and the Irish Pub inside is Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxRox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference at the end of November. Walking into the hotel you see this grand setting with ornate decorations with a very upscale feel. Once you head to the rooms and other areas of the restaurant, that feeling immediately disappeared. I arrived on a Sunday and the hotel was filled with Bears fans from the game going on that day as the hotel was close to the stadium. At times this made me feel a bit out of place as a business traveler surrounded by a ton of football fans. Beginning Monday, the atmosphere transformed to a business setting. Check-In Check-in was smooth and I was able to check-in around 1pm. I was able to go up to my room immediately and freshen up. Room I arrived in my room on the 15th floor and walked into what was probably the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, even smaller than the European hotel rooms that are notoriously small. The TV was practically on top of the bed. When I turned on the TV and started flipping through the channels I came across a fitness channel with someone doing Yoga. I looked around and didn't know where anyone could possibly even do something like that in this room. Small doesn't even begin to describe it. I also found the lighting to be very poor. I needed to turn on about 6 different lights in order to be able to read and even then the lighting wasn't very great. Unfortunately, the bathroom wasn't much better. I began referring to the bathroom as the "Brown Room" because everything, from floor to ceiling was some shade of brown. It was very depressing. The bright side was that there was a TON of counter space and a full size hair dryer was provided. On the down side, I found the bathroom to be pretty dirty, as though it wasn't really cleaned after the previous guest. This feeling was confirmed when I went to take a shower that night and discovered that the shower gel that was provided in the shower was previously used. I was not very happy and didn't exactly feel very clean. I called down to housekeeping to ask for more shower gel to finish cleaning up and asked that the bathroom be cleaned the next day. I did receive more shower gel about 30 minutes later but the bathroom was never really cleaned. Mildew was on both of the soap holders in the shower for the entire trip. At one point I took a wet towel and wiped things down because I just didn't feel clean. There were two other things that bothered me about the bathroom. The toilet was one of those commercial toilets that everyone flushes by kicking with their foot. You know the kind I mean. I really prefer a standard toilet in my hotel bathrooms with your standard handle. It bothered me, but was something that I got over. The final thing that bothered me about the bathroom was that the shower curtain didn't go completely around the shower so a lot of cold air from the window at one end of the shower would flow into the shower as you were taking one. I had to crank up the temperature of the water to stay warm. Luckily, there was plenty of hot water to do that. I will say that for a hotel in the city, I did not hear the city noise except for the occasional siren. This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at in a city for cutting out city noise. Food The first night I stayed here I ate at the restaurant in the hotel lobby. I thought the selection of entrees was a bit weak and not exactly appealing. I started with the buffalo shrimp, which were FANTASTIC!!! After that, I don't think I had anything that I really cared for. I had the meatloaf entree since it was the least unappealing thing to me and it wasn't very good. Service, however, was great and very attentive. Later on that week I had room service while I was working in my room. The food arrived about 30 minutes after ordering. I had the BLT sandwich, which was probably the worst BLT I've ever had. After those two experiences I didn't eat at the hotel again for the rest of the trip. I don't drink caffeine, but for those that do, there's a Starbucks just past the check-in counter. Cleanliness As you could tell by my previous note about the bathroom, I was pretty disappointed with the cleanliness of the hotel. I think my experience with the bathroom pretty much sums things up well. Housekeeping didn't come one day to clean my room. I'm guessing this is because I didn't leave my room until about 9:30/10:00am to head to the conference after doing some work in the room. Still, for a hotel like this, I should have received housekeeping by the time I returned to my room that evening. It wasn't like I had the "do not disturb" sign on my door either. Service Service at the hotel was hit or miss. I had good service at check-in and at the restaurant, but other than that I felt like just another number and as though they didn't really care. Location The location of this hotel is great if you're going to a Bears game or don't mind walking. I walked around downtown the first day I arrived and had to walk far to get to where a lot of the action was. The nights that I went out for dinner I found it very difficult to find a half way decent restaurant in the area. Because there are several colleges around I found a lot of Subway restaurants (which I hate) and McDonalds, but no real restaurants except for those in other hotels. If I were to come back to Chicago for pleasure I would stay somewhere different and a little closer to the action. All in all, I thought this hotel was just very average. Nothing made it stand out in a positive way and there were multiple things that just weren't that great. I wouldn't return to this hotel and probably wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: momwithfivekids7
Reviews.Content: We took our daughters to Chicago for the weekend. The room was all right it was nice and decent enough but you could tell this place needs some remolding. The cost of everything was a shocker too. The internet was a rip off and they wouldn't even let us print off our tickets for the Shedd aquamarine. We ate the hotel restaurant the first night and it was a joke. What they serve you wasn't worth the price. We were all still hungry after we left. The only thing I did really like about it was the kindness of the staff. Not sure if I would stay here again or not.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: theroamingtechnocrat
Reviews.Content: Very oddly designed hotel with confusing architecture, bad rooms and complete lack of character. Does not deserve the name of a "Hilton". It's faux-lavish style did not convince me. There are no good lobby sitting rooms and the view of most rooms is not good. The most annoying thing are the mini-TVs in the elevator forcing telemarketing ads or Nancy Grace on you.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel which needs a facelift and update”
Reviews.Author: ChristianMarolt
Reviews.Content: When checked in I asked for a nice room. Agent told me at least three times that this is a very nice and large room. Firstly NO VIEW, smallest and extremely it stunk. Then I moved me to a "better room". Indeed, the vie was somewhat better, room as well much bigger but next to it was an aircondition tower. Unbearable noise to be honest. I had once again to argue my case to get a decent room (tired after 27 hours of travel) and ended up finally with at least a good view on Lake Michigan but still quite small. Furniture is used, cleanliness for a hotel of this rating not sufficient, lifts outdated. The bell boy (Matthew) was after all extremely helpfull and really made up for the others. If I would have booked this hotel not vie HOTWIREs exceptional rates I would really have regreted my decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hilton Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Fan-10101
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many of the hotels along Michigan Ave. for business meetings in Chicago. This was my first stay at the historic Hilton Chicago. Like the sister property The Drake, the Hilton Chicago has a storied past. Like most old hotels, the Hilton Chicago has some quirks---the elevators are small, the bathrooms are tiny, while the main part of the sleeping room is large in compaison. The rooms are in pretty good shape with upgraded flat panel TVs. The lobby looks great, and the valet parking staff seems to be on the ball. The check in and check out process was very smooth and quick. If you're into views, then you'll want to try and get a room on the lake side, as high up as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with best facilities”
Reviews.Author: Etisha22
Reviews.Content: Located in prime location with all facilities. Loved the restaurant and the bar. View is awesome from high rooms. The 3000 USD/ night room would be awesome. The restaurant serves various sort of dishes and the best part is they are authentic and good. The only bad part is that the hotel is surrounded by big buildings and there is very less open space around the hotel building.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 50Phoebe
Reviews.Content: Upscale, great rooms, linens, etc. Staff was very professional and courteous. Room was made up promptly each day. Conference facilities were outstanding as well. Parking for 4 nights cost $220! That was a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice but far from most things”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October. The hotel is nice. You can tell it is old but somethings are really cool. Even though it is old they have tried to make it as modern as possible. The hotel is in an area that is far from most things but close to the aquarium and soldier field. There is so much public transportation that it's easy to get around. We are hilton honor members and we were "upgraded" to a suite. This was the smallest suite we have ever stayed in. When you hear "we are going to upgrade you to a suite" you imagine a big roomy and luxury room. Nope....not this one. After entering our room we wondered what the regular rooms looked like since our "suite" was so small and cramped. We were put on the 24th floor where breakfast and appetizers are part of your stay. So I guess the free food made up for the cramped room. The YOLK restaurant about 2 blocks away is the best. Once we found it we ate there for breakfast and lunch. Sooo yummy. The staff at the YOLK are great. Recommendations: The John Hancock building has a bar/lounge room. Instead of paying for a ticket to the observation room just go to the bar area and you get the same view but you get to enjoy the view with a drink in your hand. How yummy is that. The caramel martini is yummy. It's sweet but good. Hot Doug's.....This hot dog place is not around downtown but it's worth the drive to their location. It's the best sausage dog I have ever had. there's always a line to get into but it goes very fast. I would not go at noon. If you go around 2 you probably wont have such a long wait. Catch 35.... This is a nice seafood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ajlbb
Reviews.Content: This is a grand old hotel with prices to match. I have status with Hilton so between that and the cost/overall vibe of the hotel, I was expecting a pretty great experience. The service and room were fine, neither exceptional or poor. We probably could have gotten a better deal through a 3rd party booking site, but then you lose your reward points. Also we were able to get tickets to the Shedd Aquarium (less than 10 minute walk) by booking with Hilton, and those normally retail at $35. I guess what you want to pay depends on your reason for travel. I'd be inclined to try a different Hilton next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a lot to get in, then keep paying for basics that motels would offer free”
Reviews.Author: za105
Reviews.Content: Really? A 40 dollar motel offers free wi-fi. The Hilton charges how much, per HOUR, and it's not even fast. People stay at a hotel for service. People spend way too much to stay at nicer, prettier hotels for better service. Not worse. This is pitiful. Furthermore, in a US phone call to my mom through the room phone, the hotel dropped my call 10 minutes short. She wasn't low on reception on her phone at all, and her phone never drops calls. They just cut me off in conversation. Trash service. I will never waste so much money here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Chuck0317
Reviews.Content: What a great old hotel! We loved the Hilton Chicago. Great location close to everything. Are room had a king bed with 42in tv and seperate bar area. Very comfortable bed and very clean. There's a blues club behind the hotel, lots of restaurants, and just park across the street from their parking garage entrance and its only $22 for 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Internet Service in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ronin6050
Reviews.Content: Generally mediocre hotel but the Internet service has to be the worst i have experienced in years - and for $15/day i expected better. Surprising given that this hotel caters to business conventions (it appears).

Reviews.Title: “A relic of the roaring 20s”
Reviews.Author: Cb1180
Reviews.Content: I will start this review by saying that this room was part of a block of two rooms that was purchased on priceline, so I wasn't expecting the same level of service as I would have had I paid full price. That said - I was still underwelmed by the room and the staff. Service was mediocre at best. When we checked in on Friday evening there were 4 people in line and 2 people working behind the very long counter. Once at the counter I was offered a room with a double bed, which I politely declined and asked for a queen or king, preferably on the lake view side. I was told that lake view was $25 per night and that my reservation said "bedding assigned at check in." Which is fine - again I Pricelined it. We end up with a king size bed directly across from the service elevator. The room itself is small (typical for city setting) and extremely outdated. There was mold in the shower (both in the caulking along the base of the tub and in the grout between the tiles), the shower curtain had some red spots all over it and along the base which I can only hope were rust caused... Suprisingly, it was relatively quiet in the room except for the occasional noise from the L's going by the hotel. Checkout is at 11 with a "free" grace period until 12pm. They'll hold your bags at a rate of $2 per bag if you need them to.

Reviews.Title: “Grand service”
Reviews.Author: Rsueh
Reviews.Content: The service at the Hilton was fantastic from the maid, customer service, bartender, and bell boy. The hotel was convenient to shopping and tourist locations. The hotel decorations were breathtaking and rooms were very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, comfy bed, but just okay”
Reviews.Author: fivetacos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a three day get-a-way to Chicago. It was a really pretty hotel, rooms were nice, bed was comfy, had two bathrooms in our room but coffee maker made terrible coffee. I've had keurig coffee in a less expensive hotel. I love getting up in the morning and having coffee in my room and was disappointed. It was not good. Also, the computer monitor would not turn off so the light kept me up at night. Also wi/fi was $15/day which we felt was ridiculously priced. Parking was also way too expensive $42-43/day for parking garage. We parked across the street in a city lot for $25/day and it worked out just fine. The only thing is there were no in/out privileges. We used the metro and bus so didn't need our car. We went across the street to Caribou Coffee for our morning coffee/tea and to use the free wi/fi. We did have some pretty awesome mai tai's in Kitty O'Sheas, the lounge. However, they were pretty pricey, $10 each. But they were good! We got this hotel on priceline for about 55% less. Would not have paid $249 for this hotel. Although anything downtown Chicago is gonna cost you.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was a Complete Displeasure”
Reviews.Author: BigTraveler55
Reviews.Content: -My girlfriends name was on the room and I lost my key, had to wait 2 hours after running the chicago marathon for my girlfriend to get back to enter the room. Front Desk attendant was very rude and he had very poor grammar and did not make sense when speaking. The manger was not much more impressive. -On a Sunday they charged us an extra $50 for a late check out to leave at 1PM rather than Noon. -Parking is a rediculous $43 a day for guests? It's only Chicago... Many spots in Prime manhattan are cheaper than that. -The hotel is very old and nothing is updated to convenience standards, not in a pleasurable classic way either. Low ceilings, repulsive designs, dirty worn-out carpets and ugly styling in all of hotel. -Showers took 15 minutes for hot water to work and a $350 a night room had very little sunlight and views of another hotel room 10 feet away. -Went to the restaurant in the lobby and waited 20min for a server to come to the table. The waiter actually told us he was busy and would stop by again on several other occasions. Subsequently had very rude and poor service. -Chicago service in general is very poor relative to other comparble U.S. cities, however this was a complete dissapointment and the Marathon should consider switching base hotels. -If you are in Chicago for a short weekend the Hilton Chicago is an extremely unbecoming of the city of Chicago and Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off and sub-par service”
Reviews.Author: travelingal30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Chicago because I was attending a conference at the hotel. The room was sufficient - had a coffee maker, bed, hangers, tv, etc. That's about where my compliments end: *restaurant rates are outrageous. $21 for a breakfast buffet? $25 to use the gym? $7.50/hr for WiFi!?!?! This is unacceptable when I'm paying $249 per night. Thank goodness the ice was free. *servers in the restaurant and bar were surly, not well-versed in English, and just rude. *computer monitors in rooms are silly and turn on at random times during the night *conference was incredibly cold...everybody was wearing their overcoats the entire time, despite our complaints to management. *fridge in room was not usable. had to store cold items in the ice bucket. *Cable channels just flat out SUCKED. I was soooo bored when I had to spend an hour in my room. If I'm paying that much, at least provide the full 70 channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: Kelseymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hilton during our Fall Break (my husband had business so we moved hotels at the end of our vacation so he could work.) We only stayed with him one night. My nine year old daughter enjoyed the pool which is beautiful and quite large. It really is incredible! We had room service because the downstairs restaurants were so nice that we didn't want to have to put on good clothes to go eat. (We were being lazy!) The room service was good and not to pricey. It only took twenty minutes for our food to arrive. The television did not have Disney or Nickelodeon so I got to hear about that and the internet cost money (so my nine year was unhappy with both of those issues.) I would like to come back to this hotel but maybe for a romantic weekend not for another trip with my nine year old.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but it could be better”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic building in great location in front of Grant Park. Bed not very comfortable. Service at the Athletic Club not very good. My husband had a massage in a cold meeting room! If you go to the Marathon, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: mindy1515
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel worked out perfect for us. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and spacious grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickidi
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and elegant foyer which has been used in a few movies! Even with the least expensive room had lots of space in room, 2 windows and big bathroom. Had in room monitor and key board--little pricey to use but better thatn hauling a computer when leisure travelling. Ate in hotel's Pub friendly group and staff. Did not use their parking found cheaper choices nearby. Little restaurants and cafes in the area are safe easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel---will return”
Reviews.Author: ktschos
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago with a group of 4 families and wanted to stay close to the Museum Campus. The campus was within walking distance of the hotel. The rooms were great and the hotel was very nice. Would love to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: apratt0905
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a beautiful hotel. Yes, it's convenient to lots of attractions downtown. But I was nickled and dimed to death! We got a convention deal on our stay of $175/night. Regular rates are around $300. Parking is $40/night. Internet was something like $14/day. Two breakfast buffets and a breakfast ordered from the menu $75...and it was NOT room service. Yogurt, a small box of dry cereal, a water, a small container of fruit, and a soda was $25 at the convenience breakfast bar in the lobby. If you want to check in an hour or so early it's another $25. The one good thing is that you can take the South Shore train from northern Indiana for a few bucks and the station stops about six blocks down from the Hilton - it's an easy walk. I was never worried about the area being safe...I always felt comfortable walking and shopping...even in the evening. Lots of attractions nearby within walking distance but wear comfy shoes. We had a double room with a double bath. Pretty cool. The beds were double/full size beds...not queen and not a large full size either. But not bad for one person. It really seemed like an over-sized single bed. But super comfy!!! The two bathrooms are small-ish. But they were both full bathrooms...each had a tub/shower/sink/toilet. It was convenient when we were both getting ready in the mornings. I had seen other reviews about the rooms being out-of-date but I thought they were very nice. I saw a friend's room - she had a corner suite - living room area and separate bed/bath area. It was super nice. If you have Hilton upgrade points, do it, it's worth it. The hotel is older but very, very pretty and well-kept. The front desk clerk was over-the-top friendly as were all the hotel employees. There are other hotels in the immediate area if you are interested in something cheaper. Lolapalooza was playing directly across the street. I could hear the bands from my room..even with the window closed..but it wasn't annoying. The bands stopped playing early enough that it didn't disrupt my sleep. Saw lots of palooza fans staying in my hotel and also walking to others to the west of the Hilton. All in all a good experience. I know how Hilton has made its millions though....the freakin' fees!! My 401k will never be the same....HAHA. I marked that I would recommend this hotel to a friend because it was beautiful, was close to lots of attractions, etc., but I would also not recommend it because of all the added expenses. One thing I did like was that you could put a stop on any charges to the room when checking in. So no one can charge meals, drinks, etc. I also wanted to say that there is a formal dining area in the hotel and also a casual bar. Regardless, they are both pricy. There are lots of convenience stores in the area too if you don't mind walking a few blocks. CVS, Walgreens, Starbucks, Dunkin Doughnuts, etc....everywhere. Buddy Buy's blues bar just a couple blocks away. There is a cover charge.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a King”
Reviews.Author: hamcell
Reviews.Content: The wife and I decided to get out of town for the weekend. Priceline booked us this hotel. We were very happy. Hotel was very well maintained. It was probably one of the grandest hotels we have ever stayed in. The interior of the facility warranted us actually taking pictures of it. We were provided a room with no view. That was by our choice. They did offer to upgrade our view for an additional cost. We chose to spend the money on dinner. The room was small by today's standards. But it was still very functional. Large closet to hang and stow belongings. TV was a large flat screen. Internet service was a bit over priced. Room did have an honor bar stocked with all sorts of overpriced drinks and treats. It is quite a hike to walk to the shopping area of Michigan Ave. Cabs were always on standby at the front door. My only complaint was the lack of food places open late at night in the neighborhood. But I am sure that room service would have been available if I really needed it. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next stay in Chicago. We will be back there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience with an Interesting History”
Reviews.Author: albertaguy24
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. We had a room with 2 double beds and two bathrooms, which was a nice size. We found the hotel to be in very good condition. It is a little south of Downtown but easy access to the train and buses. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid in the grand old manner”
Reviews.Author: marteaudor
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable room with two baths, large TV, computer terminal, etc. Terrific swimming pool, great location, close to Art Institute. Only negative was a rather pricey parking garage ($43 a day) and no free Internet (but Starbucks next door has free wireless).

Reviews.Title: “Leave the room and enjoy Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: 15monthsapart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days. I stayed iin my room for five of those 6 days. I didn't get to explore until my last day and it was too late. I was hesitant to walk in downtown Chicago being a woman by herself and all. But the food was great! And I missed out by being scared. The hotel is located right across form Grant Park. I didn't know how nice that was until the last day! I ordered room service for 5 days! The hotel food was kind of nasty. But like I said earlier, there are restaurants all around this hotel. The FedEx came in handy, too. I needed business cards on the spot, and they were able to do it! Took almost three hours, but it happened.

Reviews.Title: “Several Small Issues hamper what could have been an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: GiantsFanMan11
Reviews.Content: If money is no object, then I'd recommend the Hilton Chicago. However, most people would be concerned with such things which is why I don't recommend it. This is not an inexpensive hotel to begin with, but what you don't initially realize is that nothing is included. Internet is not included, among other things, and parking costs $43 per day!!! I believe there was cheaper parking in the area, but we checked in so late at night that we couldn't spend time searching. Also, the shower was plugged up and drained slowly, the hairdryer was broken and the TV remote didn't work. Just a lot of little things wrong with the room that you'd think they'd check once in a while. On the bright side, the staff was courteous and helped us with some of our problems. Also, the hotel is very old fashioned looking, yet updated and clean. It's really a beautiful hotel. Overall, I just have a hard time recommending it because of what you get for the money along with the issues we had.

Reviews.Title: “Almost but not quite.”
Reviews.Author: robeth_8
Reviews.Content: Check in quick & efficient. Had arrived before noon but got rooms with no problem. Siste,r who had booked via now collapsed company from Canada, anticipated problems but ended up with a better room than we did. Staff, in particular Security, friendly & attentive apart from bar person. Main bar was closed with no prior knowledge or of it being mentioned in check in. In fact, it was that secretive that the Security Head was not aware of it being closed! Sign said to go to lobby bar but the surly bar person could only offer draught Bud on tap. Surely if you close a bar for a period you would think that more than one draught would be available. The pump was there, was he too busy to open a new barrel? Will never know. However, breakfast reasonable with attentive waiter. Rooms clean & as requested. View to lake front great. Location suited us but can understand some people needing to be closer to downtown. Travel from O'Hare great & Chicago itself must be proud of its punctual, fast & very reasonably priced public transport. Hard to think of any other major city that we have been to which is cheaper. Hop on hop off bus stops outside hotel so if you are tourist, advice would be to get Go ticket & use hop on for initial getting around. Overall score would be 3 to 4 with all things taken into account. Point lost on unannounced pub closure. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “we like this hotel and recommend everyone but...”
Reviews.Author: mrasen
Reviews.Content: Between September 9-12 we stayed this hotel. We booked a standard room. But we were lucky, our rooom was on 15th floor and lake front at the corner. Room is clear and comfortable. View was perfect esp around 6 am you can witness the sunrise just in front of you. We made our reservation over Priceline with $80/night-room. I think it was a good deal. Our problems were.. 1. There is no (complimentary) internet access 2. We are a little far from downtown (we solved this problem to buy 3 days CTA)

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift and some training”
Reviews.Author: DDiggler
Reviews.Content: I felt bad for the family in front of me; 10:30PM and they had to wait two hours for their room. Rooms are pretty beat up. Parking is obnoxiously high. They also charge for wifi. In short, they seem to be nickling and diming their patrons quite a bit. I thought the staff was a bit rude, certainly indifferent. Maybe pay your people a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel...real Chicago feel!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Army1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Valentines break and found the Hilton to be the perfect setting to see all the city can offer. Hotel was very grand and traditional and the staff there were friendly and well mannered. Located right by the museum campus and lake michigan, the hotel setting was romantic and quiet. Transport into the downtown area was a couple of blocks walk away, we really liked the elevated railway and found it relatively easy to use. Hotel facillities were of a high standard, especially the pool and free ice machine in the corridors. The room felt luxurious and homely with a nice ambience, the bathroom was spacious and clean too. Would defnately stay at the Hilton Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find fault with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aardie21
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been booked for the first night of our route 66 three week holiday. After a really long flight, it was great to arrive here. I always have high hopes of a Hilton and this didn't disappoint. Staff were courteous, our room was spacious and very clean. I liked the addition of the Crabtree & Eveyln toiletries in the bathroom - the best out of any of the hotels we stayed in over three weeks. We had a great view from our room, which was (from memory) on the 21st floor. For us this hotel was perfect and certainly some of our subsequent hotels fell well short of this one. The elevators were a bit crowded at times, but the hotel was very busy and this was a weekend in July. The hotel was in a great central location, only a short walk from the Lake. Because this hotel had been booked for us via an agent in the UK, we didn't have the same issues as some other reviewers regarding value for money - so I couldn't really comment on that aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel Needing Updates and a Good Scrubbing”
Reviews.Author: tejas100
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline with a winning bid of $70 per night. Priceline rated this hotel four stars. I have stayed at other four star hotels in Chicago (Palmer House Hilton & Westin North Michigan Avenue), sadly this is not a four star hotel. I was excited to stay at this hotel due to its history and Grant Park location. The lobby is regal and stately, if a little worn. The greatest disappointment was my room. I was given a room on the 13th floor (I should have known!) at the end of a hallway. The door to my room was difficult to open and there was a used pillowcase on the floor. In addition, the room had a distinct odor, like antiseptic and pesticide mixed together. The furniture was dated and the bed springs creaked - this was most surprising to me as most HIlton beds are great. A few other tidbits I noticed during my stay - toenail clippings on the floor (I guess they don't vacuum) and mildew in the shower. The fixtures and style of the rooms are circa 1979's idea of regal and stately. A friend of mine stayed on the 6th floor and visiting his room (which was smaller) confirmed my review. Some people would say that I shouldn't complain as I only paid $70/night through Priceline. I say that Priceline should re-examine its rating of this hotel. This hotel is not on par with other four star hotels it lists in Chicago or in other cities where I have bid and won rooms such as Los Angeles, Houston and New Orleans just to name a few. The Chicago Hilton might not care about its Priceline guests and place them in its least appealing rooms. This is a mistake as most of my travel is work related (over 50 room nights/year for work) and I choose to stay at Hilton or Hyatt hotels. I will never book this hotel when I travel to Chicago for work, nor will I recommend it for coworkers. I might use Priceline for personal travel, but pay the full rate when traveling for work. Earlier in the week, I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton and found that to be a true example of a four star experience. The Palmer House is also an excellent example of an old hotel that has been renovated to keep its history while updating for the 21st century. It was exceptionally clean too.

Reviews.Title: “Over-run with families with small children”
Reviews.Author: suebhoney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location south of the river and north of museums. However, it is worn around the edges, the room was VERY noisy, the hotel was very crowded, and room was not well-prepared (we were towel-shorted, bathrobe-shorted, and cleaning was substandard.). The parking fees are excessive, and the valets, bell & doorman were sub-par. We checked in before 5pm and were unable to secure the king bed that we requested and got double beds. We requested a upgrade to the executive floor in order to avoid all the out-of-control screaming munchkins, push buggies, & red wagons. It wasn't worth the additional money. There were far too many families & small children here, even on the executive floors!!! The executive floors should be a place of respite & quite for work & reflection. Instead, the executive floors were a playground with children playing in the halls and running around barefoot in wet bathing suits. Parent, this is not a waterpark, for pete's sake. I would most certainly AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS on weekends, in the summer, and during school break. Not sure that I would stay again at any other time. I don't think it was a good value for the money spent. We checked out early & went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and convenient to everything ***** 5 STAR ACCOMODATIONS & SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: shy_kitten
Reviews.Content: Every floor, elevator, shop, restaurant is opulent. This hotel is well maintained. The service is top notch - from the bell hop to housekeeping and everywhere in between. Our room had TWO FULL BATHROOMS. The beds were very comfy and loaded with soft pillows and duvet. Large screen TV, 2 closets, plenty of drawers, desk. Concierge helped us find parking before we arrived in the city. The bell hops got us quickly unloaded and loaded. The doorman hailed us taxis without delay. Maintenance was lightening quick to address our room AC issue and had it blowing ICE COLD in no time during the week of extreme heat. Ahhhhhhh. Housekeeping kept our room as neat as a pin and well stocked. Room service was prompt, courteous and delicious. We had the chance to eat at Kitty O'Shea's and it was very good. It was convenient on a night we wished to stay in and we were able to charge meal to our room. The pool was wonderful retreat after a day in the humid heat. Even tho it was a busy Saturday night, there was plenty of space and the pool waters were cool and not overcrowded. The hot tubs were very relaxing as well. Before returning to our room, we were able to catch a cool breeze on the terrace overlooking the city lights. We were most thankful for the vigilent eyes of security. We had dropped a phone while exiting a taxi. We thought it was lost for good. We left word with the front desk hoping that the driver would return it. To our pleasant surprise, security had found it and was already trying to contact us. This prevented much hassle and expense on our part that would have certainly overshadowed our vacation. ***** FIVE STAR ACCOMODATIONS!!! FIVE STAR SERVICE!!! *****

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: LegacyPlanner
Reviews.Content: Our symposium stayed a week at the Chicago Hilton and despite some negative comments on TA I was overall very pleased with the hotel and service. This is a legacy hotel property of historical significance. When it was built in the 1920s, it was the largest and most expensive ($30 million!) hotel in the world, with the finest, most modern amenities. Staying here allows one to travel back in time to an era of elegance and opulence. That said, it is a property that, while recently renovated, has an older feel to it, taking you back to a different generation of traveler. We were upgraded to a spacious room, lake view, with two beds and two full baths. (My friends on the executive level said their room was tiny, so be sure to request a larger room). There are plenty of pictures already posted of the large marble baths. One has a tub/shower combo, the other a shower. Double beds were clean and comfortable. Two closets, beds and baths make this the perfect room for two people traveling. You don't have to trip over each other and there is plenty of space. We paid conference rate of $175 (with taxes, $200). When we arrived at the room, we had no shampoo (lots of conditioner!) and our headboard had a grease stain on it (probably from someone sitting up in bed) but a call to housekeeping brought hangars, soap, shampoo and a pleasant supervisor who wiped down the headboard. On the whole, housekeeping in the room was fair. Sometimes we were left amenities, sometimes not, and the furniture was a bit dusty, but overall, it was just fine. AC works well when you are in the room but automatically shuts down when there's no movement. You can fiddle with the thermostat, but it appears to be preset to 73, which when it's 95 and humid, feels just perfect. Staff is pleasant and helpful. Conference facilities were very good. Location is great for folks wanting to head to the planetarium or Field Museum nearby. Room service and food service overall is convenient, although hotel priced. The Mercat restaurant in the Blackstone Hotel next door has the world's latest Iron Chef, and we ate there two nights it was so outstanding. There was a huge convention here, as well as the Chicago Air Show, and the hotel was packed. It never felt overwhelming, however, and the concierge and reception staff kept their cool and were always cheerful and professional. I am a Silver Hilton Honors member but they still allowed me a very late check out with no additional fees. I'd recommend staying here, but make sure you ask for a lake view (it's worth the $25 upgrade if you have to pay it - otherwise you're probably looking at a brick wall) and try to get the two bed, two bath rooms. If so, your stay should be pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimimorang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Chicago from Aug 8-12. Got a good deal on Priceline at $70 per room. Arrived at the hotel in the morning via subway from O'hare, walked a few blocks to the hotel. We knew that rooms wouldn't be ready since the hotel was full from the Lollapalooza event but I didn't expect that we would be charged for storing our bags for 4 hours until the room was ready! $2 per bag and we had 5 pieces. I thought this charge was unnecessary for a guests checking in. We had to store our bags the last day too so we had to pay the bag storage fee yet again. We were able to get our room keys in the early afternoon. We had two rooms across the hall from each other (Rooms 577and 581) with two double beds and two bathrooms in each room which was very nice and convenient for us. Ordered an extra bed for our 3rd person (we had 5 in our family) and was told that there would be a additional cost of $40 for the whole stay. When we received our bill at checkout they did not charge us for the cot. One of the minibars had food that was half eaten and beverages used from it. We reported this problem to Robert at the frontdesk right away and he said he would send someone up to replenish while we were out. When we arrived back at the hotel in the evening, there was a message from Robert to follow up on the minibar situation. Nobody had come up to replenish so I called Robert back and he sent someone up immediately to do so. Robert as well as all other hotel staff from housekeeping to security were all very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean with two beds, two full baths, two closets, tv, minibar, coffee/tea, writing desk. No view from the 5th floor but we didn't mind since we weren't paying the regular rate of $204 for our rooms. Unfortunately they charge to use the fitness room and pool. We paid the weekly internet fee of $40 which was better than paying the daily rate of $20 for 4 nights. We enjoyed our stay and would return again. Hotel and rooms setup are very similar to the Palmer House Hilton on Monroe Street where I stayed last year. I preferred the central location of Palmer House Hilton better than the Chicago Hilton but we bought a 3 day farecard at CVS so that we could ride the transit system unlimited times. #3 and #4 bus stops right outside the hotel on Michigan Avenue, very convenient. CVS, 7-11, subway, buses, restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: TKMCD
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for 8 nights and were delighted. We read some previous reviews which put us off a bit. Many said couldn't get non-smoker rooms or bad smells. We had non-smokers and yes there was a strong smell on entering the room, but we think it was a cleaning agent and it was non-existent when we were in the room. It was great having two bathrooms for the one room, the beds were really comfortable, TV was a flat screen, room was quite large, and service was always courteous and prompt. Location on Michigan Ave was great with parks and lake across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but pricey”
Reviews.Author: firebird350
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel the weekend of the Blackhawks convention. I booked my room in November of 2009 for $299. Pretty good for downtown Chicago. I didn't know at the time the convention was happening. It was so crowded and loud. We got to our rooms, I was staying with friends and requested rooms on the same floor but we could not get it. The rooms are nice the view not so nice only if you are in the front of the hotel. We were looking at bricks. THe only problem is the walls are very thin. You can hear everything in the hall and in other rooms. The floor staff were very friendly and helpful. Elevators were way too long of a wait. Took 10 minutes for one to stop on our floor. I would have taken the stairs but it was 14 flights with luggage. Linens are a little tired but overall I would stay again if I had to...

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all of our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious for a downtown Chicago room. The staff were all very friendly and the rooms were very clean and quiet. Only knock migh be that it seemed to be a long wait for elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Convention Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a very elegant comfortable hotel. It is however a huge property that hosts many groups so the common areas tend to be very crowded. The lobby is beautiful and grandiose and has been renovated. I don't have any complaints regarding the quality of the hotel but I agree with a previous reviewer that it does get annoying to be charged extra for everything extra (has made independent hotels more appealing). Another small nuisance is the standard chain cable package (30 channels +/- a few) that was available - I couldn't get the White Sox game in the room because it was on a local channel (while you can go to a motel and get hundreds of stations). My room was very large with a super comfortable bed. The bathroom had ample room as well with a long counter. Overall I thought the room was excellent (minus the tacky gold trim in the bathroom). The hotel location is pretty good for those not familiar with Chicago. It is in the South Loop area and right across from Grant Park and close to the lakefront (ideal spot for runners). The hotel has a lounge and popular (but expensive) bar called Kitty O'Sheas. Given the Priceline deal I received I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but hotel's policy's are off putting”
Reviews.Author: meleetyme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old school grandeur. Marble and baroque wall paper. Brunch is very nice and also packed and comes at a reasonable cost. The hotel is rather large and check in and check out times can be very much like going to a large airport. A few areas for improvement are as follows: I was travelling with a group and we had two separate reservations. Upon arrival we asked if we could have rooms at least on the same floor as each other. The front desk person informed us that we might be able to but at that moment the rooms she had available on the same floor were smoking rooms. We were not amenable to that so she suggested that we try to check in later when more rooms would be available. I asked when should we check in she suggested that we try every 1/2 hour or so. I told her that she should call us when our rooms were ready and she agreed that she could. At a hotel with this "grandeur" I felt that she should have suggested this not the other way around. Our second issue occurred when we attempted to use the gym only to be told rather rudely that it cost $20 per day to use the gym. It was said in a rather condescending "You know this costs $20, right?" by the attendant. First of all a fee to use a gym in a hotel that you are a guest of is absolutely outrageous. And at that cost I could pay for 1/4 - 1/2 a month use at most gyms. "Higher end" hotels seem to have this problem with adding on fees for everything from the use of the internet to the gym whereas lower cost hotels see these as part of the package. This is the difference between American Airlines and Jet Blue. The hotel industry needs to do better. Our last issue with this place and the most major one related to them charging our stay on our credit card prior to check out versus simply placing a hold. This became a major issue at check out as we had planned to split the bill. In the end it took the staff about 20 minutes to resolve this issue. I have never had a hotel do this before and did not appreciate having the stay charged on my account even though I was sharing the bill with friends. Lastly the business center has a very high per minute cost. Please stop nickling and diming guests for things that have negligible costs to the hotel. It makes it difficult for patrons to truly compare the costs of hotels when there are so many hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel near the museums and Grant Park”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago this past weekend and stayed at the Chicago Hilton for 3 nights. We got the room off Priceline for $95, which I thought was decent for peak summer season. At check-in I was able to easily and quickly request the type of room I wanted and they also were able to upgrade me to concierge / Executive level for $50 per night. We were there with another couple (shared a room) so that cost was pretty reasonable when you consider the free continental breakfast every morning. The room: Since we got Executive level, it was quite nice. Large, with a pretty corner view of the museum campus and Soldier Field. The only complaint I have about the room is the bathroom was on the small side. The beds were very comfortable, although a bit on the soft side. Since we were up on the 24th floor, we had minimal road noise and it was good for sleeping. The room was always cleaned nicely and there was a turn-down service with good chocolates every night. AC worked great - no complaints here! The Executive Level perks: We were on the 24th floor, which is the same floor that the Executive Lounge was on. The continental breakfast was adequate, although very busy! They had bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc. The usual for this type of breakfast. The one perk I did like was the room was open all day for guests to get coffee, water, or pop if you were thirsty. This was very nice since the rooms only had an already-full mini bar for a fridge. As I said earlier, the room was also quite large - which I know was an Executive perk since I had read many reviews of how small some rooms were. Other amenities: We didn't use the parking as I think $43 / night is highway robbery! I did notice some surface lots in the area that were as low as $22 / night though, that seemed quite cheap. The pool and hot tub area were very nice although busy. There were plenty of towels and the outside deck was a nice touch. Overall, I would stay here again if doing a primarily sightseeing trip to Chicago. This hotel is much closer to the museum campus and the Art Institute than it is to the Mag Mile shopping area. We walked a lot and used the "El" system to good advantage - the closest subway stop is only 2 blocks or so from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton with centipedes in your bed”
Reviews.Author: nathanf1975
Reviews.Content: Only paid $89 on Hotwire for this historic but rundown hotel on Michigan Ave. Let's be honest, the only things keeping this hotel going are its history and the location. Two lights and the phone in the room didn't work. Plus, there was a hole in the carpet. Beds were just so-so but good enough for a centipede because I found one in my bed! Within walking distance to all the best sites including the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, and the Art Institute, but is it really worth it? Btw, internet access is $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room-Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: LizIvan124
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline and I have to admit I was a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews. I paid 120.00 Per night- The room was clean, and big enough for all three of us. Customer service was great! FYI this hotel is located about 6 min away from M Mile...cab ride was about 6.00 each way...Tv had around 20 channels and first night we were there the cable went out. I hated that I had to pay 15.00 to use the gym...I travel a lot and Ive never had to pay to use the fitness room at any other hotel. Overall, it was a good hotel and for the price I cant complain

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethtownWiggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for a family gathering. Two rooms, both Kings and both with lake view rooms...incredible!!! 5 windows facing Grant Park, the museums, Navy Pier and N & S Michigan Ave. It was awesome. Friendly efficient staff. Booked the room & breakfast special...and it was well worth it...great breakfast buffet, that was open until 11:00. Wonderful location! Pool was great on Friday, busy on Saturday..but still nice. Valet, room service, maids, front desk...everyone was friendly and we can't wait to go back! Our A/C was great..., and plenty of space for six of us to gather around the sofa, chairs, etc. Bathroom was a bit small, but we were using only half of the suite...beautiful marble and great shower.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, but the building is a bit old.”
Reviews.Author: yellows55
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Hilton through hotwire, I was skeptical because of it's so-so-reviews(plus I do not consider most Hiltons to be 4 star worthy). I called the hotel the day of my reservation to let them know I would need an earlier check in, and I wanted a larger than standard room with double beds for my friend, and did not mind paying for it when I arrived. The agent was very understanding on the phone and he assured me he would make the arrangements for me. When I arrived at the front desk, true to the agent's word, there was a room ready for me at 1pm and the concierge told me he had definitely assigned me to a larger room and to call back if I needed something else. The room exceeded my expectations. There were 2 double beds like I had requested, but the best part was that it had two complete marble bathrooms i.e. with a sink, bath tub, and shower, toiletries, and extra towels. The agent also sent housekeeping up to set up a fresh pot of coffee, I guess because I had mentioned that I had a long flight in and a busy day ahead of me. I had not expected that and I was pleasantly surprised. The decor definitely seemed a little outdated to me, but it did not bother me as much as it would have had it not been for the great service I experienced. On my way to check out, housekeeping saw me from a different hallway and actually wished me a safe journey!! That pretty much summed up how I felt about this Hilton location. They have wonderful employees and that makes it a 4 star hotel to me!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinakbetboy
Reviews.Content: I was here for a square dance convention being held at the hotel. The hotel staff were courteous, no problems with checking in, and checking out. The ballrooms that the dances were held at were gorgeous, specially the Inernational Ballroom. The food for the convention banquet was very good. I had a chicken breast for my entree and wasn't expecting much from chicken, but I was surprised at how flavorful and juicy it was. I stayed in a corner King bedroom. It was clean and neat, not too big, but adequately sized. It had a great view of Grant park, right across the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to a lot of downtown attractions, as well easy access to public transportation. I walked to Grant Park, Millennium Park, Willis Tower, Magnificent Mile, Chicago Cultural Center, Museum Campus...all 5 to 20 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: kryswithak
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay at this Hilton through bidding on Priceline. This is a great hotel if you are able to get a discount. I can't see myself paying full price for this hotel. The hotel is further south of Michigan Ave however, you can take the bus and it will take you right to the action further down Michigan. We had the king bed room that faced the Sears Tower on the Executive Level. The reviews are right about how small these rooms are. The hotel is extremely dated but clean. It was great for just a weekend. I did go to the pool area. It is filled with kids which made me not stay long. Lastly the concierge gave us passes to some great clubs. They gave us a pass that let us in Y Lounge and Sound Bar. We also got free admission and a drink to Enclave. You have to ask in order to receive. I can't say I would return to this hotel. I would rather be further north by all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a 100% Class Act with Better Room/Facilities Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: ARLVAGUY
Reviews.Content: This hotel focuses on convention/leisure activities rather than business -- any hotel that still charges for internet access clearly doesn't cater to business travelers! So, keep that in mind in selecting this hotel. The beautiful lobby, excellent convention halls, top-notch gym/pool facility and overall old-world charm certainly play to convention/leisure travel. The beds (my room had two doubles) were absolutely comfortable with great pillows. A/C worked perfectly. Room was very quiet. Plenty of elevators so little waiting. Very friendly staff and great cleaning service. Decent selection of TV channels and plenty of paid TV options. // So, what's the problem? Well, my room suffered from shoddy maintenance issues: The bathtub dripped (and I don't mean just a little); the sink faucet was coming loose; the cable to the TV kept the curtains from closing properly; the TV remote was missing upon arrival; the clock was set too fast (and can't be reset by you -- I had to call an engineer). The gym's Precor/Icarian equipment is some of the best, but you'll find minor maintenance issues such as broken pins. I heard other stories of similar minor maintenance issues going unfixed in other rooms. This seems to bear out my experience with other Hilton properties. This is a shame because this Hotel has so much going for it, including a convenient location with very good access to Chicago's subway system (the El), many near-by tourist destinations and good convention and local food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and amendities”
Reviews.Author: dedas1
Reviews.Content: I am including parts of my letter to the Hilton which they refused to acknowledge or respond to: Dear Hilton, I am writing to express my stay at the Chicago Hilton during a business meeting from June 3 through June 7, 2010. I typically do not write letters to express my stay or concerns. This particular letter I am writing since I did not feel that the value of our stay met with the high expectations that should have been associated with the Hilton Hotels. ..... During our stay, we did request a non-smoking room. It was clear that the room was not as such..... It was acceptable, but not overly comfortable. What I did find dismay was that the accommodations and the service was sub-par. ..... The television was clearly outdated as a 500 pound CRT, leaving very little counter space for any belonging to be left out for convenience. I was somewhat surprised that updates had not happened as advertised with a flat screen television. Not only that, the television was broken. We had to call for service after putting up with a non-functioning remote for the first two nights when the remote finally just stopped working. The remote could not control the volume or the channels, despite the electrician coming on two separate nights and repairing the television, only to leave and have the television stop functioning again. It was just too disruptive to continue requesting his services....... I would have expected that the maid service would offered better service unspoken. The usual complementary coffee and tea bar in the room was nice to have. But unfortunately, the maid never replaced any cups after we used up the 4 that were provided on the first day. We thought this may have been a slight oversight, but when it was not adjusted the third and fourth night, we just did not bother. Similarly, when we ran short of Kleenex tissue on the second day; we thought it would be replaced the next day. I had to guess again. I am sorry to bring this to your attention, but I am sad to say that we did not find value in our stay or worth in the price. We are previous members of the Hilton Gold club, although we realized that we had let if lapse over the last 3-4 years. We have stayed many times at Embassy Suites and Doubletree, finding great value for the money and more than adequate accommodations. I am sad to say not with our most recent stay. For your records, we stayed in Rm 1918 during the above mentioned dates. Maybe the Hilton will respond or others will find the same and the managment will respond appropriately. I do not think I will stay her again. There are just too many other hotels in the area that offer better service and accommodations ie the Intercontennetal down the ave.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! Class, Style, History, Elegance!”
Reviews.Author: KMate
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the ambience of this hotel. The entrance off Michigan Ave was stunning. The chandeliers, grand ball room, winding staircase- all magnificent to see. Check in was quick and easy. We stayed on the executive floor - never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. All staff were quite pleasant and cordial. Especially the afternoon attendent in the executive lounge (didn't catch her name, but she is there every evening except Mondays and Tuesdays)! Room size was adequate. We had enough space to leave the roll-a-way bed open the entire time. Can't stress enough how comfortable the beds were! Elegant drapes and bedspreads. We had 2 bathrooms - one had a window which opened about 4 inches - nice for ventilation. We could see Buckingham Fountain from our room. Nice flat screen TV. Very quiet stay - we never heard a sound from other rooms or from the hallway. Since we were on the executive floor (we paid extra for this) we had use of the executive lounge. This was very convenient ! Had continental breakfast every morning - Bagels, mini muffins, cereal, fresh fruit, small pastries, juice and coffee. They also offered afternoon hourdourves - two items each day - proscuitto wrapped around aparagus spears, mini pizzas, crab rangoon, mushroom tarts, as well as bottled water and cans of pop. You could also buy beer there. The view out the windows of the lounge was of Lake Michigan - very nice. There were also cookies at nighttime. The only complaint I had was that guests from other floors took advantage of the executive lounge. Like I said, I paid extra to stay on the executive floor and didn't appreciate having to wait in line behind a freeloader to toast my bagel, not be able to sit in the lounge because all the tables were taken, or not be able to use the 1 computer in the lounge because someone who did not pay for the convenience was there. Traveled with 3 teenagers - hotel was within walking distance of Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Grant Park, Millenium Park,, Taste of Chicago. We walked down to the river and the magnificent mile - families with younger children may want to consider a taxi or subway. We actually did end up taking a taxi to the Field Museum because it was raining. The bellhop estimated it would cost $7.35 for our family of 5 to get there by taxi - That turned out to be the exact fare - cheaper than the subway, and we stayed dry. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Loved the hotel, the city and the people of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, Great Location, Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: JubeeWeinstein
Reviews.Content: I must say, I was a bit nervous after I booked this hotel seeing a mix of positive and negative reviews on Trip Advisor. I got an excellent deal on the Hilton Chicago via Priceline. We are a couple in our late 20's that drove down from Wisconsin, parked at a blue line station, and rode in to the city via the Blue Line with a transfer to the Red Line. The Hilton Chicago is about 2 blocks away from the Harrison Red Line. Was a convenient way to save money on parking by taking the train, and the short walk to the hotel was not bad at all. Upon entering the hotel, we were in awe of the beauty of the first floor. Check-in took about 5 minutes due to their being a long line. We had a great room on the 12th floor with 2 full beds and 2 full bathrooms. As previous reviewers have stated, the beds and linens are very comfortable and clean. Our room was very clean as well. There was a large flat screen TV on the bureau. Plenty of room for 2 adults. Again, gotta love the 2 bathrooms. I would say the only complaint I have was that the rooms were a bit warm and stuffy. Air conditioner seemed to be set at 74 degree's which was a little too warm for our liking. We probably could have called the front desk and had this resolved, but really didn't spend enough time in the room to justify a call (other than sleeping!). On day 3 we ventured into the pool area. We wished we wouldn't have waited until our last day to check this out. After spending time in the pool and hot tub, we sat outside on the attached outdoor patio (this all being on the 8th floor). There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, or via a short ride on the Red Line. Like I said, I had negative thoughts due to reviews i've read prior to checking into this hotel. It's too bad others have had poor experiences, because we had a great experience! I can't comment much on the restaurants in the hotel. We only stopped at the bar area near the concierge desk for a Starbuck's coffee and pastry. Coffee was reasonably priced, pastries were pricey, but that was expected. If you do wish to use the wireless internet, there is an additional charge for this. We chose not to use this as we both have iPhones. Due to the Priceline savings, we saved about 50% off the price of this hotel. I think even if I did have to pay full price I would have written the same review and would have felt it still being worth full price. It was a great stay, and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays because of the staff”
Reviews.Author: PatsAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Chicago Hilton Towers are the best I have ever experienced. They all were really nice and friendly and went out of their way to make me feel welcome. Everyone went out of their way to be pleasant and provide great service --from the girl at check in to the doorman. The housekeeping staff and the concierge staff were especially excellent. The area is a bit noisy but it always was quiet by about 11:00pm. The hotel itself is old but grand. The rooms are small but comfortable. Hilton beds and pillows are the most comfortable of all the hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: DMR15
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the hotel was great the kids 5 &10 loved the pool and the view of the city was lovely especially at night. We had a standered room with two full size beds and sofa bed. The second stay we had to ask to change rooms the view was in the horse shoe and it was awful. The room had no sofabed and was smaller but they were nice about switching rooms and getting a complimentry roll up bed for my daughter. The third vist was the worst the room was small and in the lower 15th. floor and the train and construction I had it change but they had to make a big deal bring in management and the 17th floor was too much better but o.k. considering that first room. The worst part of this hotel is it has NO MICROWAVE or fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ash76
Reviews.Content: I've been stayed there for 4 nights. it's a wonderful hotel. It's a huge hotel, very friendly staff and great location. Nice clean room, good proximity to shopping area. Close to the park. Good ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loop Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schmengi9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a two-night stay at the Hilton Chicago that we successfully bid on through PL. The hotel is situated on the southern end of the South Michigan Avenue corridor opposite Grant Park and in close proximity to the Grant Park South and Millennium parking garages and the Harrison stop on the CTA Red Line. Other L stops and State Street businesses are also within a short walk. We parked at Grant Park South for $28 a day, which is as good a price as you will find in that area of downtown. We requested and were given a king/ non-smoking room at check-in, and there was no mention of PL other than the standard "you're pre-paid" comment you usually get when using PL or HW. The hotel is 75 years old, so the rooms are perhaps a bit smaller than what you might get in a newer vintage hotel. That said though, we though there was ample room and plenty of storage between the full-sized bureau and closet. The bathroom was also spacious, with a good-sized marble counter, and the shower was more than adequate. We thought the room was clean overall and that the bed was quite comfortable. My only minor complaint about the room was the TV, which while adequate in picture size, was an older "tube" that consumed most of the top of the bureau and was angled away from the bed. We were busy both days in the city and didn't spend a lot of time in the room or make use of the hotel facilities, so I don't have anything to add there. We thought service was fine overall, but will give special kudos to the hotel for responding quickly to a service request. We had trouble our first morning with a slow tub drain. When we asked maintenance to look into it while we were out during the day, we came back to find the problem resolved and a handwritten note with a dedicated line to call if we had any follow-up concerns, which we did not. We found the Hilton Chicago to exceed our expectations and would definitely stay here again on a future visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!! Please do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: yearoundtravel
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to all the bad reviews posted by others at Trip Advisor. Paid about $190 to get a room here...totally not worth it. When we first checked in, we were told that the non smoking room that we reserved is not available and there is no other room available. When we get to the room, the smell of the room was pretty bad...so we asked the front desk to check again. He told us that there is one room available, but it was a living room of a suite. But the living room has been secluded now from the suite and the sofa can be turned into a bed. Hello!?!??! Did I pay for the room/bed or a living room with sofa? I could have stayed at a friend's apartment (for free!!) and sleep on her sofa if I wanted to do that. Pros: - Looks good from the outside (inside totally not worth it) - Close to the millennium park (about 6-8 blocks?) But I am sure there's better hotels that are closer to downtown and better for the price. Cons: - Got a smoking room even though I reserved non-smoking room. When I read reviews online, it seems like this is their common practice to do this. Beware!! - Room is dirty (There was a BIG spider on the wall when we got into the room) - Some portions of the carpet was WET (Gross!!) - Bed, decorations, bathroom are OLD. They really need to get updated. - Internet is $7.50 per hour, with no business center to check your email (Hotels like hampton inn can offer $130 a night with free internet and breakfast...and I don't know why Hilton can't...pretty ridiculous) - They seriously nickel and dime you for everything!! To leave your luggage for a couple of hours, you have to pay $2 per bag. - Beware of the extra charges. They slip me a bill for $6.40 for I do not know what. I called the front desk and asked what the charge is for, and they asked me if I took something from the bar and I told them no. Then they just dismiss it (imagine if you had not called). - Arrogant and full of attitude staff Definitely not a place I want to stay the next time I come to Chicago. Totally not worth the price!! Everyone should just avoid it. Every staff has some kind of attitude like this Hilton was the best hotel in the city (maybe in the late 80s or early 90s) but I don't think it is up to par with other hotel I've stayed in. My previous stay in Chicago was at Sheraton by the river...much nicer, more elegant and friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “posh..wow”
Reviews.Author: alpabharati
Reviews.Content: one of the finest five star hotels of chicago..located in convinient downtown chicago its conviniently located and provides very prompt service right from the concierge to dining to check out.. beautiful rooms.. well done interiors and excellent ambience.. great place to stay.. well worth the cost..we are used 5star treatment even in a 2 or 3 star hotel in india and take it for granted but its not so easily available abroad.... in hilton..its the same.. its luxury in all splendour.. something which is not so easily available in most western hotels makes it well worth the stay.. i didnt mind spending on it..

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: missymlincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel before beginning a rail trip across the US. Everything about this hotel was first class from the reception to the hotel rooms

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hilton is spinning in his grave right now”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveler0912
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were attending a national meeting at the Hilton Chicago over Memorial day weekend. We had reserved two rooms several months before and brought two children and an adult friend. After a full day of travel I attempted to check in. The desk clerk scanned his computer screen, then announced "we don't have any rooms for you". He went on to state "several people with your meeting decided to stay an extra day......." Excuse me? Control your hotel for god's sake. His solution? "I can put you in two smoking rooms tonight then move you tomorrow". I looked over at my 3 and 5 year old spinning in circles and my wife managing the 3 suitcases and various carry-ons and caved. I said we would try the rooms. We dutifully made our way to the smoking floor. When the elevator doors opened, the wave of smoke immediately made our eyes water. We bravely went to the rooms. Two words: NO WAY ! To think that putting two little children in a gross disgusting smelly smoke infested room is idiotic. Oh, by the way, my wife and I are health care providers which is the reason we were attending our academy's meeting. After dropping off our luggage and quick change, we went to the hotel restaurant right across from the check in desk as we all were hungry. After ordering, I went back to the front desk and told the person who put us in the cancer rooms that it was not going to work out. His next option was to put us in a "parlor room". We went back to emphysema central, packed our stuff up and all crammed into a room with a roll-away and pull out couch. He promised two rooms that connected together the next night. Mind you, this is the Hilton Flagship. Pathetic! The next morning, I went to check on the room status. There was much fumbling around and of course, the rooms were not going to be connected as previously promised. However, they said they would call when the 2 separate rooms would be ready. We went on with our day. That afternoon, the children went down for a nap (we made a bed for one by cramming two chairs together). I went again to the inept front desk to get a luggage carrier so I could move our opened suitcases and "stuff" while the kids were sleeping. The same person who thought second hand smoke is good for you was there. I explained I wanted a luggage carrier to move my self, he said "you can ask the bell captain, but he won't give it to you". I looked at him and said "You will get it for me". After more fumbling, I did get the luggage cart. Bottom line: Inexcusably, did not have our previously reserved rooms. Down graded us to two smoking rooms: perfect for 2 young children, and two non smoking health care provides (ridiculous). Crammed us into a parlor room, were we had to make a bed out of two chairs. We ended up moving 3 times, with all our luggage, toys, etc. I did insist on speaking with the manager who listened but was less than interested or sympathetic.
