This episode should be considered an embarrassment by the hotel. Something tells me though that this is business as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Only there one night but we loved the room and room service”
Reviews.Author: princeoverthewater
Reviews.Content: There for the start of a Route 66 adventure. Really comfortable room with a fast room service and delicous meal. I accept that we didn't use all the hotels facilities bur I would still recommend it. Parking is in a mult-storey attached to the hotel and is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Member3
Reviews.Content: After the negative reviews, I expected the worst but was pleasantly surprised. Kind and attentive staff, spacious room (2 beds + 2 bathrooms), comfortable bed. It is a grand old hotel with large seating areas and comfortable chairs on each floor as well as in the lobby area. It is not a modern building but most everything worked. The only negatives were (1) the room never got as cool as requested. Most of the rooms were occupied so perhaps the air conditioning system was maxed out and (2) restaurants and shopping are quite far away. As others mentioned, there is the typical nickel & diming that goes along with a full service hotel for parking, internet, gym use, etc.. There is a nice Caribou Coffee a block away from the south entrance if you don't want to deal with the hotel restaurant for breakfast. All in all, a good stay. The hotel is close to the museums so this is a good place to stay if that's your intent.

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel - but rooms can be a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: loveDCA
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old hotel with a grand lobby and first floor. Even the hotel bar (the Kitty O'Sheas) was surprisingly fun for a hotel pub. Only complaints are the cramped room, I had a single king sized bed and there wasn't too much room to move around the room and the bathroom was a little on the Motel 6 side of the balance. Oh, another complaint is that they didn't have an in-room safe. But service was fine and location was fantastic. Fitness center was beautiful but wasn't open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, ragged hotel with a lousy attitude!”
Reviews.Author: 4NDude
Reviews.Content: I write this review as a HHilton Gold VIP member who loves to stay at Hilton hotels worldwide. However, this Chicago Hilton seems to rest on its old laurels and is worse than an airport hotel. The staff are indifferent; room service terrible (did not show up for more than an hour); cleaning crew do not respect the do-not-disturb sign; lamps & telephone do not work; the sink was clogged and after I called to request a news paper, I was told to call the bellboy. This all as a "preferred guest". I shudder to think how the regular guests are treated. While I got upgraded to a room with a view on the 21st floor, watch out for the street noise, trains and general noisy patrons that can be heard even on the higher floor. Finally, watch out for this hotel nickel and dimeing you for everything--$2 to store the bag with the bellboy, $15/day to use the fitness center (I got it for free as an upgrade), and I was asked to pay 44c for stamp when I dropped off a letter to be mailed! I did not feel welcome at this hotel and I while I am scheduled to stay at three other Hiltons over next few months, I will not stay at this hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: devcon30
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff, clean rooms, reasonable price. All I need :)

Reviews.Title: “It could not have been better.”
Reviews.Author: SRS51
Reviews.Content: When we were in the room we felt like we were the only people in the hotel it was so quiet. Everyone from the cleaning people to the front desk was nice. We loved the location as we could walk out the door to Grant park and it was a very nice walk to the Art Institute - we came in part to see the Matisse exhibit. We were there only two days but could have stayed a month. Chicago is a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: teenie022
Reviews.Content: I agree with most others. Its a nice hotel but very dated. I was disappointed to see that the hotel really had not been updated since my first stay 15 years ago. If you're looking for a hotel within walking distance of the Magnificent Miles this is not your place. It's about a 30 minutes walk for experienced walkers like me (I power walk 10 miles a day). Otherwise you will have to take a $16 round trip taxi or get on the #3 bus $4.50 round trip. Next time I would suggest a hotel on S. Michigan Ave. You'll be closer to the "happenings." My room was comfortable. I had a view of a brick wall. The beds are full sized not queen. Yes there are 2 baths but one is practically unusable. One has a sink, toilet, and a tub/shower combo and the other with a sink, toilet, and shower only. The shower is tiny. If you are tall or a bit heavy you won't fit. I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant they were too expensive. You will have to walk several blocks to find a restaurant. I stayed there because my conference was there. The only thing I liked about the hotel was that it was a couple of blocks of the Orange train which I used to go to an from Midway airport and that it was in walking distance to Lake Michigan (remember I'm a walker). This came i handy since every amenity in the hotel was extra....internet, business center, exercise room. This will be my last stay there.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, if aging queen. Still a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: jcalderh
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a cookie cutter, sterile experience, this probably isn't your place. But if you want to experience an elegant throwback to an earlier era, the Hilton Chicago is ideal. I was here for a conference, and from check-in to check-out, this was a great experience. I had a corner room with two double beds, that was huge. I had no problems with the heat or ventilation, but loved that I could open my three windows and feel the breeze. The location is great for walks in Grant Park, but there aren't many restaurants nearby (and the HIlton's restaurants are nothing to write home about). Service throughout was excellent. Yes, some of the furnishings are a little dated, but that didn't detract from a great experience. If you're there, be sure to peak in to the Grand Ballroom which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying”
Reviews.Author: Scarabs
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through hotwire, expecting a 4-star hotel. What we got instead was a run down, seedy looking place that might have been 4-star several decades ago. The entrance was grand, everything looked a little old, which is okay. The room however, was where everything fell apart. Looking old is alright, but when everything is broken in your hotel room, something is wrong. Upon walking into the room we realized no one had been in there in months, judging by the rank stale air. The clock hadn't even been changed for daylight's savings time! The lampshade had holes in it, the sink had a hole in it, the toilet didn't flush properly and left toilet paper everywhere, the A/C was nonexistent and the shower was terrible. When I touched the shower handle, it fell off. I put it back on, to realize the shower didn't even work! The handle wouldn't turn even when my boyfriend tried it. We called down to the desk, who told us someone would be up to look at it shortly. This was at 10:15pm. At 11:10 I went downstairs to complain because we were tired of waiting and wanted a room with a working shower. The front desk lady was rather distant but told me they would "send security up shortly to 'escort' us to a new room". So I went upstairs and found out that the maintenance guy had come up while I was gone. Apparently he had had to put his entire weight on the handle to make it turn a little bit and told my boyfriend that he was glad it wasn't a 'real' problem. After waiting a few minutes someone came with new keys, which were for a lake view room. When we tried to turn the A/C on in this room a strong smell of ozone and burning hair quickly enveloped us and we had to turn it off and open a window. Also the outlet in the bathroom of this room didn't work. At this point we were laughing and trying to figure out all the things that were broken in the room. In the process we found that the bed has a tilt to it, the drying line hangar was broken, and the plush down comforter which used to be white had acquired an old gray color. In short, the only nice thing about this hotel is the location and the giant entrance hall. Everything else is not worth your time, nor the time of Hilton apparently to fix it up in a historical and nice part of town. The room compares to a sketchy 1.5 star room. If you're looking for an expensive laugh, go to the Hilton Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: amjsw
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an antique heating/cooling system. It is on heat in the winter and cool in the summer -- never both. Makes it a big issue in spring and fall. My room was 80 degrees with the three windows wide open. No way to cool it down, and all the fans were taken by other guests. (Looks like everybody has the same issue!!) Stay here only if you like to sleep bathed in sweat...

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel, similar in style to Waldorf in NY”
Reviews.Author: denisetraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and has a style similar to the Waldorf in NY. In both hotels you feel like it's a little dated and needs a facelift but it's okay because it's historic and lovely in its own, old school sort of way. When my husband and I checked in we asked for a room with 2 beds (because that our idea of a good vacation - ha ha) and it turned out to be a really cute room with not only 2 beds but 2 bathrooms. I guess they design it that way for working people who are forced to share a room on a business trip. Anyway, it was sort of fun having our own little bathrooms next to each of our beds. The beds were very comfy and we slept well. This hotel has a big lobby with lots going on. If you like the big hotel experience with restaurants, shops, etc., you'll be right at home here. The location is on Michigan Ave but not in walking distance to the magnificent mile section of Michigan Ave. You'd have to drive or take a cab for sure. As for things that are in walking distance, the museum campus is very close so you can go to the Field Natural History Museum or the Aquarium, which are both great. There's also a nice park across the street if you're there during nice weather you can enjoy that as well. There are some restaurants in walking distance to the hotel but it's not a particularly happening section of town. If you want to be in the thick of things, you probably want to stay in the magnificent mile section of Michigan Ave instead. Overall we had a really nice weekend in Chicago and would stay again. By the way we booked the day of the stay (no advance reservation) because it was an unexpected stay when our flight to NY was canceled. We paid $179.00 a night for the room with 2 beds through Hotels.com and we had free high speed internet because we're on hilton hhonors gold.

Reviews.Title: “Membership doesn't have priveleges”
Reviews.Author: rdrynan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hilton for a conference. I am a new Hilton Honors member, so I wasn't sure if this would mean anything. At check in, they didn't acknowledge me in any way, and then they set me up with one of the worst rooms in the place! I did get moved to a nicer room after having to ask. When I ordered room service, they told me I had a wrong (old) menu. 15 minutes later they delivered a new menu - the same version! They finally read me my choices over the phone. The next day, my room was cleaned, but they left garbage on my desk! On my last day, I had to check my bag for a few hours after I checked out. I was a little surprised that they charge you $2 for a service most hotels provide for free (or for a tip).... Not the worst stay or worst hotel, but I definitely didn't feel 'Honored' or rewarded.

Reviews.Title: “I had a confirmed reservation and was forced to relocate to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTHO
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this hotel and when I arrived was told that due to an "overbooking situation" I was being relocated to another hotel about 4 blocks away. I had booked my hotel two months in advance. They transferred my deposit to another hotel without my permission and did not cover any of the hotel costs for my inconvenience. In fact, I was expected to pay the Hilton rates for the other less expensive hotel. I later found out that the hotel did the same with over a hundred other guests in order to accommodate another group that wanted to have a meeting at the hotel. The customer service during the conference was also very poor. They promised a shuttle that didn't run as promised and had staff who seemed clueless in answering the most basic questions.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to pay $40 extra for the refrigerator, $17 a day for wifi, and be charged in advance, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: dannyday
Reviews.Content: Even though we had already been billed for the first night for 5 rooms on our credit cards, no one had bothered to tell us that 3 of the reservations had been moved to the hotel next door. Had even called to confirm 2 days out. Discovered that the hotel had overbooked for the conference we were attending. Negotiated for about an hour to keep our team at the same hotel. Once we found out about the frig charge (I mean, c'mon!),decided we'd prefer the other place anyway and got all of our reservations moved. The claim was made that a credit would be put on my card. Haven't seen it yet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton, good gym, rooms dated, food terrible”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This has been a Chicago mainstay for years. Its close to museums but not so close to shopping or dining. It is one of the closer hotels to the Convention Center at McCormack Place without actually being outside the center of town. The rooms are reasonablly sized but decor is dated. The food service is expensive and below the standard of other hotels of similar cost in Chicago. The gym and pool are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ribar1en
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton Chicago several times now, as it is where one of my conferences tends to return to every couple of years. Please note that I'm not a huge fan of Chicago, so that might influence my judgment, but the staff is not friendly and the rooms are quite small and not very special for the HUGE price tag. The best part is that it is located across the street from Grant Park, and the museums are all just a short walk away. I enjoyed walking to the aquarium every morning to watch the dolphins play through the window right by the lake. I wouldn't go back to the Hilton anytime soon if it weren't for upcoming conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Historic Place, a bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give it 3.5 b/c it is better than a 3 but not quite worth 4. It is a bit out of the way if you like walking, especially during cold months, from the action. There's not much around the hotel, and it feels a bit seedier on the streets around this hotel (not on Michigan), hotel than say around the Palmer House HIlton. However, it is a MUCH cleaner feeling place. The lobby is nice, but could be renovated a bit while still retaining its character. The room is pretty nice. Carpet could use an update. The beds are great, bathroom is nice. It does feel sort of gloomy in a way in the rooms. I am sure there is a way to keep the character and notch down the gloom. If you park in the garage directly behind the hotel, it is 20$ a day cheaper and worth the extra 2 minute walk, even in the cold.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akm107
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Hilton is a very nice hotel. The hotel has a lot of historic sentiment behind it (which is quite interesting). If you are looking for a modern-chic hotel, this hotel is NOT for you. Like many historic Chicago hotels, it has been re-furbished to an extent, while maintaining its old-school charm. We booked our room a couple nights before arriving on Priceline for $70, just for fun. As a Chicago native, parking is expensive EVERYWHERE. Paying $42 to park overnight is a little expensive for the South Loop area, however the conveinance of being attached to the hotel makes it worth it. **Note: You will have to pay for parking EVERYWHERE. There is no such thing as free parking in downtown Chicago!** Or, if you are not too scared to take public transportation, please do so as many buses and the Harrison red line train step is very near the hotel. This hotel is located in the South Loop area, which is a generally safe neighborhood. The Hilton is nestled between Grant Park and many of the Columbia/DePaul campus buildings. Check-in was quick and easy, no hassles. Many people were eating in one of the restaurants adjacent to the lobby. The room was quaint and the bed VERY comfortable on the 6th floor (665). No great views or anything, but then again I didn't make any special requests when booking, nor said anything when checking in. Ample towels available to use, bathroom was clean and decorated nicely in gold, no complaints there. I genuinely liked this hotel very much and think that its a no-frills kinda place, but a safe, comfortable stay. Location wise, I'm indifferent. You are within walking distance (15-20 min) of Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Soldier Field, Grant Park, and Millenium Park. There are a lot of mom&pop shops around to eat, however you'll have to walk north down michigan ave towards the Loop for chain places to eat. If you are looking for a place close to the shops on Michigan Ave, this place is NOT for you... unless you want to take a cab/bus down there, which is a hike. Great bell hops. Nice hotel. Try it out!

Reviews.Title: “If you think you have a confirmed...”
Reviews.Author: scdm
Reviews.Content: If you think you have a confirmed reservation, you could be sadly mistaken! I confirmed a reservation 6 months in advance and 2 weeks before my reservation , I discovered they cancelled it and transferred my res to a lesser hotel. Evidently, they had a better offer from a large group! So, BEWARE!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but had better”
Reviews.Author: sueggb
Reviews.Content: the common areas were very very nice and the staff was incredible. Nicest I've seen in a long time as a matter of fact. The rooms, however, were very common. "gold" does NOT equal "posh". I left a note for the housekeeper to please leave creamers and sugar. she managed to not only not leave the creamers and sugar, but didn't replenish the coffee. But she DID manage to throw away the water bottle i was still using :) they have 3 restaurants- we only hit the bar... $9 drinks.. yikes! all in all, i'd stay here again, but only with another great deal from priceline ($70/night)

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids and very close to Shedd, Field Museum and Soldier Field”
Reviews.Author: Dave3249
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in February for a quick weekend trip with the kids (6 + 2 year old) and their grandparents who stayed in separate room. At check in we requested two rooms next to each other and they accommodated the request giving us two very large rooms on the 18th floor overlooking the lake and Shedd aquarium. (pretty nice for paying $90 a night per room on Expedia!) Parking was an additional $43 per night. At check in they took all of our considerable baggage and it arrived at our room very quickly. Lobby and first floor of hotel is beautiful! The rooms were clean and very large with plenty of space between the beds and bathroom (about 15 feet) which was great for the kids. The room had three large windows and a small closet for suitcases and coats. The beds were very comfortable and bathroom was typical but clean and nice. The pool area was very great and looked recently updated. Staff was always present and the area was kept clean and tidy. It was a large pool with plenty of towels and the water and air temp were very warm which was great for the kids. Two average sized hot-tubs were also nice for the adults. Right next to the pool area was the exercise club which is probably the nicest I have ever seen in a hotel. The track you can use for free but they do charge for use of the equipment. (~$20 a day I believe) Parking in this part of town is of course a huge hassle. The hotel allows you to self park in the attached garage for ~$43 a night and you can come and go as you please. You can also valet it for about $10 more per night. The self park is very easy and just a short walk. The hotel is about about a 15-20 minute walk to Shedd aquarium, Adler Planetarium, and the Field museum. It looks shorter on the map but even at a brisk pace it will take a good 15 minutes to work your way around the park and Lake Shore Drive. Navy Pier (and the Children's museum) is about a mile to the North and in the summer it might be a nice walk along the lake but it would take some time. Overall, this was a the perfect hotel ($ and quality) for us for a family weekend. This is a LARGE and older hotel but it has been updated/maintained just enough to make it a 4 star property. It definitely isn't five star quality but absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “DAV-DAVA National Convention”
Reviews.Author: DeniseOH
Reviews.Content: Nice older hotel....small rooms, but 2 bathrooms....wonderful beds!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Night in Chi Town”
Reviews.Author: luvthetaz73
Reviews.Content: We had a great time!! The room was huge and the price was small!! What more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Bar! TRIPLE check your bags when you collect them from the baggage room!!”
Reviews.Author: Rathcoole24
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our annual american shopping trip for 4 days. The hotel has a good location for sight seeing -the tour bus stops right out side the hotel and your only a couple of blocks from Millenium Park in one direction and the Field Museum etc the opposite direction if you want to walk. We booked rooms on the executive floor for a small amount extra which means we had complimentry pastries/ cereal / tea / coffee etc for breakfast and unlimited access to soft drinks all day/night - well worth the money when you think how much an american breakfast would cost every morning ( we booked through 1800hotels.ie for these rates) . There is an Irish Bar in the hotel that served nice food and was a good bit of craic in the evening with the Irish people working behind the bar. The hotel is about 6/8 blooks from the discount stores on State Street. - Filines / Marshalls and those kind of stores. If you want to stay right beside all those shops and not have to walk the Palmer House Hilton would be a better location as it's right beside all those shops. The more up market shops are further up the street, but if you do the City Tour you'll get to see where they are. All the big hotels have the outlet buses that stop outside but as we hire a car every year I'm not sure how long the buses take - it takes 40mins to drive to the outlets. If your travelling over shopping like so many Irish people do PLEASE be careful when collecting your bags from the baggage room and TRIPLE check everything! We had a lot of cases plus hand luggage and a very young Bell Boy that really did'nt know what he was doing and didnt get any help from the older guys that were busy chatting. The hotel ordered our mini bus to bring us to the airport. When the bus arrived the Bell Boy only brought out 1 trolley with our bags (eah..1 trolley for 6 Irish women shopping!!)and told us that was all our luggage. We insisted we had a lot more luggage and asked for our baggage tickets back to get our own luggage. As the Boy went off to get help with our tickets we went to the baggage room ourselves to get the rest of our bags. When the confused Boy came back with no help we had most of your luggage out of the baggage room. The Boy said he would double check the rest of the tickets to make sure none of our bags where left in the luggage room and follow us out to the bus as at this stage we were running late because of the the whole fiasco! Moments later we were told all our bags where on the bus and off we went after tipping him $40. On arrival to the airport we realised 1 bag was missing and immediately contacted the hotel. The hotel said they did not have the missing bag. After serveral calls to the hotel they finally told us they located the missing bag and said they would put it in a taxi, but we would have to pay the $45 dollar fare. They refused responsibility for the missing bag and told us they would not Fed-Ex the bag over to Ireland if the taxi did not reach the airport in time, it was not their problem if someone missed their flight over this bag. That was a very bad ending to a good stay in a hotel and would raise serious questions to the lack of concern or security around baggage considering the President of the United States held a party there only 1 year before!!

Reviews.Title: “Paid too much for what we got”
Reviews.Author: KimmyWI
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small, for a hotel with the name Hilton, we expected a little more. Bathrooms need to be updated, fixtures were very worn. The hotel was nice, but not worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Tasty Food & staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: artsaribekyan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days while travelling to Chicago for a biz trip. Everything was great. The food was really tasty and the room very comfy. The weather was horrible but Hilton of Chicago had no power over the weather :) The staff was helpful and very nice. Great service. It was my first time in Chicago and I'm glad I stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, old, big city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: esh9953
Reviews.Content: This is one of the first old, big city hotels I have stayed in and it is awesome. Was here for two nights and the staff was friendly and the hotel was nice and is really big. The lifts were fast and the architecture is beautiful. The main lobby is incredible and if you get the see the ball room, it is something special. I really liked the upkeep of this old building and you couldn't ask for a better location of the Magnificent Mile. The staff helped us find good restaurants and they were never wrong. Being a Hilton Honors member got me access to the fitness center and although I didn't have time to use it, I checked it out and the pool and gym look very nice. The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious, my colleagues apparently had two bathrooms in their rooms (I am guessing it has something to do with remodeling over the years. Also, I have never been to a hotel that is this busy. There are people all over the place on the main floor and it is really kind of cool. Ate at he breakfast buffet and had no complaints, it was busy but we still got in in quick and the service and food was good. If you can, stay at this hotel, you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I hate it!”
Reviews.Author: Justini007
Reviews.Content: A week later I'm still arguing with the hotel about charges I paid for at check â€“in time. There is nothing special about this hotel besides location, the rooms are small you are charge for everything the service has no clue what they are doing, I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Chose this over Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: shantikay
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my 6 year old daughter as a surprise birthday gift for my boyfriend. The determining factor was the swimming pool. That's an important point for a kid just learning to swim and wanting to show off. The pool here was great although pretty busy. There was a big conference going on the weekend we were there so tons of high school kids stalking about. Despite all the raging hormones and annoyed chaperones, the front desk employees were very polite and treated us like we were the only people there. They gave my daughter a free jigsaw puzzle of the hotel! We had a fantastic view of the lake, Navy Pier, and the Museum Campus from our room the 21st floor. I only actually noticed the trains once and I just assumed it was traffic noise. It was not unexpected or bothersome. We were in a major city. The room was huge! The beds were comfortable and my daughter thought the gold bathroom fixtures were the fanciest things on Earth! Our room had an unexpected little wet bar where I assume the 2nd bath would be had we opted for one of those rooms. I was glad that the room looked exactly like the pictures I'd seen. No surprises and no sense of switch-a-roo. The layout of the hotel can turn into a bit of a maze and we had to actually pay attention to the wall signs to know where to turn. That only made it more of an adventure for all of us! We took a ridiculous number of pictures of the ball room and light fixtures and stairways. We walked to the Field Museum and Shedd Aquarium and Sears (Willis) Tower with only minimal whining from my daughter. We met friends for dinner at a fantastic pizza place (Lou Malnatti's) which was also just a 2 block walk away. We didn't eat at the hotel because there were so many interesting places within just a few blocks. We had breakfast at a diner-type place called something like the Artist's Shop, again, only a few blocks' walk away. Since I'd read all the fine print, I wasn't surprised at the fees for parking, internet, etc. Pretty standard, in my experience. The general cost was a little bit higher than I'd like but it was a birthday splurge and I thought it was worth every penny. Overall, I would certainly stay there again. Maybe next time I'll try the concierge floor with the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Grand but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: rottieluver
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over a weekend. The Christmas decorations (trees and gingerbread house) were spectacular. Close to museums and Soldier Field and a short cab ride uptown to shop. Yes, the old hotel is a little frayed around edges but it still maintains much of its grandeur from years past. It was clean, staff friendly, and good location. I would stay again. The two room/two bathroom suite is wonderful!!! The corner rooms facing Michigan Ave are very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: epixie29
Reviews.Content: The location is great as you are close to several downtown attractions. The service was excellent. At the time we stayed, the workout facility was under construction so was not fully usable, but the view out the windows from the workout facility was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, good location, extra charge for internet access.”
Reviews.Author: ivassilis
Reviews.Content: First time in Chicago for the famous medical conference there. Stayed with a colleague in a spacious room with lake view. Two bathrooms and one big closet served us well the few hours we spent in the room. Beds very comfortable. Breakfast was the best start every (early) morning and Concierge was eager to indicate a couple of decent restaurants nearby for dinner. Reception personnel and Room Service was polite and fast to respond. The only let-down was the extra charge for internet access. When will they realize that internet access is essential for everybody and not just for "business" people? Like many, we were overseas visitors in the city with no mobile data plans, and that's why everybody was storming the computer stations in McCormick Place. The Magnificent Mile is a 15-min walk or a short bus ride up north. But, better walk- a lot of nice places to see/visit on your way to the shops. Overall, a great stay in a marvelous city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FolsomDude01
Reviews.Content: I just spent thirteen nights at this hotel for an annual convention at the McCormick Place convention center. In the10 years I've done the convention I have stayed at many different places in downtown Chicago. This was my first stay in the "South Loop". The hotel is a bit older and yes it could use a mild remodel BUT the hotel still worked well for me. Everyone I came in contact with including the bellman, concierge desk, check in, etc were all very nice. The hotel's Irish Pub, "Kitty O'Shae's" had great pub grub served late which helped with the odd hours I worked and there are many GREAT restaurants and pubs within a few blocks. The concierge desk made a couple of great recommendations for dinner and went out of there way to get me reservations. The room I was in was quiet BUT do be aware the back side of the hotel has the trains running by. As others mentioned Internet is a charge and so are ALL phone calls but all in all Ill definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “hotel and a lot of history,”
Reviews.Author: koi7
Reviews.Content: hilton downtown, it has a lot of history, and a few film have been made here, when it was build it was the largest hotel in the world ,it was called the stevens.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: I look for hotels that are cleand and quiet, and this one fits the bill. Roomsare well appointed, bed is comfortable. Somefood options about 3blocks up the street. Parking behind the hotel for $25 per day. I have stayed here before and will stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but weak on little things”
Reviews.Author: JanetLJ
Reviews.Content: I was just at the Hilton for four days for a Conference. I always roommate with a friend, and this is my first experience with having two bathrooms, and two closets. That makes a lot of things easier! The room was large and clean and the beds very comfortable. The towels were large and wonderfully plush. I thought the service was good and the staff very pleasant. Now the little things that seemed so odd: I drink tea. I used up the two tea bags provided in the room on the first day, and they were never replaced, though the cups were regularly replaced. Fortunately I bring along some tea myself, so it wasn't a hardship but an interesting oversight. There are only two lamps in the room -- one over the desk and one between the beds. They were barely sufficient for a room that size. Also, there was no way one of us could have stayed up to read, etc., without the bedside light disturbing the other person. Finally, whoever got the idea that elevators need televisions in them should be fired. If there must be televisions, at least turn them down! I was there for the National Communication Association - 6000 of us. We talk to each other, even in elevators -- especially in elevators! In every elevator, the sound on the television was so loud you had to raise your voice to talk. By some coincidence, on the last day every time I got in the elevator a commercial (yes, a commercial!) for some kind of welding service was running, backed by heavy metal-style music. A woman got on the elevator and asked, alarmed, "Is this a new style of elevator music?" If only......

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you are in a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaRN
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hilton with my wife who is in a wheelchair, and we found the property (and to be honest most of Chicago) to be very unfriendly to the handicapped. The front entrance to Michigan Ave is not handicapped door equipped despite have two revolving doors and at least 10 others. Very disappointing for a Hilton property where we paid about $300.00 a night to stay. If we were staying more than the 3 nights, and the cancellation policy wasn't so poor.we would have switched to another hotel. The entrance doors are heavy and to close together to have a wheelchair between them so you cannot even open the double door entrances one at a time. As such my wife was hit twice in the face by the door despite having friends help to open the doors as the wind blowing made the doors so heavy people would lose their grip, My wife travels independently throughout the nation approximately 80-100 nights a year for her employer, and she would rate this property one of the worse in the nation just for the front entrance. Other than the poor entrance the hotel itself is very grand and once inside is very nice to go back in time and enjoy the elegance of the common areas. We were on the 24th floor which is their "executive floor. Unfortunately any Embassy Suite has better food and selections than what we were offered. Poor quality wine was $8.50 a glass. In fact the last Americann Inn we stayed in Park Rapids, MN had a better breakfast. Of course you could order the two eggs, hash browns, bacon and toast with juice at the hotel restaurant for $76.00 for 3 people???? Yes very spendy and not inspired in the least. Of course for just under $300.00 a night you would expect free Wi-fi internet, but no that would be another $20.00 so I was glad I had my verizon card. I guess you can tell I was not impressed other than the old Chicago feel the property had. Anyone with a disability should think twice before even getting in the front door. It will make a difference in choosing a Hilton property again. I almost forgot if you are not on the lakeside you can count on hearing the elevated train go by every 8 minutes like we did on the otherside of the property. It made a conference call very difficult.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel got madd elevators .”
Reviews.Author: IsaacM3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so many elevators you would have to switch elevators to go to a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay was Better”
Reviews.Author: Roxi7
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay at the Hilton Chicago, and this experience was more pleasant than my first. (Note: My first experience was not unpleasant.) This hotel is historical, so don't expect a modernized Hilton. Do expect modern electronics, however. My room was clean. The walls were as thin as the Hilton hotel walls tend to be, but I didn't experience any street/city noise. The convenient to McCormick Place, but it's a bit of a walk to the main tourist attractions. This is not a complaint, though, as it's a quick cab ride to any of the main attractions. The hotel restaurants are nothing to write home about, but they are decent. Expect the hotel to be very busy because it is large and can accommodate many people. Also, don't be surprised to share the hotel with conference attendees, who may be attending a conference in the Hilton or at McCormick Place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location! Hotel needs a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: upsetmomTexas
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago for ACS meeting this past weekend. We decided to bring our children along to explore the beautiful city of Chicago. This weekend was also the marathon so the hotel was at capacity. Overall, the location is absolutely perfect with kids. The hotel was understaffed and needs a major renovation. We did stay in a "suite", but all it had was some sort of a bar, and a little more room. The view of the lake was amazing. The location made all of Chicago's attraction so convienient, that it was worth it. My husband was upset that internet was not free for the $400 plus per night price tag...

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: AHM
Reviews.Content: Classy old hotel with a lot of history. Friendly staff. Rooms are bigger than typical hotels but in need of renovation. Clean though but decor is somewhat depressing colors. I even had problems with my lock and TV. Both fixed on time. Safe area but there is nothing around it. The hilton is not on the main part of Michigan Avenue with all the stores and shops. Right across from Grant Park. A bit of distance from closest CTA station so dont necessary recommend taking the metro from OHare. I was here for a meeting. IF I had to come back with family, would stay at another Hilton somewhere in the middle of touristy areas. But if you had to stay here, it is a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed60062
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here for only one night so did not take advantage of any of the amenities in the building. We found our room quite comfortable, clean. and well-maintained. We heard some street noise but there was no sound from adjacent rooms or the hallway. The only problem was that the clock radio was set for an hour earlier and we didn't notice until morning. Apparently it never got set ahead for Daylight Saving Time last spring (this is October). And I could see why--I could not figure out how to change the time and most likely no one else could either. As is the case with center-city hotels, extras are not free. You pay for parking, internet service, breakfast, etc. Visitors should be prepared for this. Also, expect to pay extra if you want a view because most rooms are going to face other buildings. And expect big city noise: sirens, garbage trucks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDA1
Reviews.Content: Superb service began the moment I arrived. Check-in was quick and painless. I won the room on priceline for $75. To my surprise, I was awarded a room with not only two double beds, but also two full bathrooms, on the 21st floor! A refrigerator was delivered very quickly at no charge. The bed was extremely comfortable and linens were supplied in abundance. My only complaint is that the thermostat in the room seemed to be broken, and it was chilly. A call to the front desk resulted in 2 blankets being delivered in short order. A mainenance man seemed to fix the thermostat so that the number on the box seemed to match the temperature in the room. The fan still blew cool air, however. The room temperature never did get above 71 degrees, and would be acceptable to most. Turning off the fan and using the extra blanket seemed to do the trick. I noticed the bathrooms were comfortably warm. The location is convenient to Millenium Park, Grant Park, and Buckingham Fountain, but a bit far from most nightlife. Overall, I had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gfratian
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the price paid was a bit higher (but you get what you pay for, right?)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pundit5307
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was really good. we enjoyed the place.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Sonja_W4
Reviews.Content: Attended a customer conference here in August 2009 and I was very impressed with this hotel. Having attended this same customer conference at different venues in prior years, I have to say that the hotel/conference experience was the best at the Hilton Chicago. It is a charming hotel with beautiful rooms. The ballroom is amazing. The conference space is well laid out and you don't have to hike really far to get from one conference gathering to another. The location is wonderful. You just can't beat being able to walk out the front of the hotel and be in the park and then within a short walk of Lake Michigan. I did have trouble with the first two rooms smelling very strongly of smoke. They changed my room, but for all the trouble, I wish they would have offered to upgrade me -- at least to a lake view! The food served was delicious -- especially for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: caballoloco
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to stay at â€œThe Hiltonâ€� in Chicago right in front of Grant Park overlooking Lake Michigan. Boy! I was so disappointed â€¦ The room carpet was dirty, the TV broken, the bathroom old and leaky. We paid over two hundred dollars a night for a hotel that charges 20 more for the Internet, 6 dollars for a bottle of water and over 20 for parking!! The room service "added" charges were obscene!! and the menu unappealing. One of my colleagues got a room without temperature control, and when the breakfast he ordered from room service Monday was still outside his room on Thursday!!! The service was regular at best, I will definitely not going back to the â€œHiltonâ€� Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial!”
Reviews.Author: Piglet56
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in the US (at the start of our Route 66 tour) and had been pre-booked in the UK. It was expensive (it is far cheaper to book whilst in the States than from the UK). Parking was on site, a multi-storey affair, but extremely expensive - about $49 for 24 hours. The overall feel of the hotel was good, but it is huge and somewhat tired - you wouldn't call it cosy. Our room was big and we had two bathrooms (first time ever!!) which we thought was rather excessive, but actually enjoyed having!! Not particulary great views from our room, and we had one of the better ones. As the hotel dates from 1920s (?) it had elegance and beauty, but the hotel is very big and it does need a bit of updating. On saying that, we really enjoyed staying there and it is in a good position to walk to the Sears Tower (which is now the Willis Tower) and to a lot of attractions. We didn't need to use our car whilst staying in Chicago. Staff were helpful. Didn't eat breakfast there - too expensive. If you turn to the left when exiting from main entrance, you can find places to eat not too far away. (Unfortunately on our first night we turned the other way and couldn't find anything and we were tired and hungry!!) Chicago was fantastic; the skyline incredible. Worth going up the tower and having a trip on the river / lake. We bought a sat-nav to help us find our way around and we are glad that we did. It was as cheap to buy one as to hire one. It was the start of Route 66 and we did struggle to find the beginning and ended up just getting out of the city and picking up the route at Joliet! Doh!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hilton while on a business trip. We took the Orange Line from Midway Airport, and it is five blocks or so to schlep your luggage. Check-in was fast and friendly, and we quickly arrived at our room on the 20th floor. We were upgraded to a king bed with two bathrooms. It was probably the largest room I have ever stayed in, and we will be forever spoiled by having two bathrooms. One bathroom was quite large and the other was an average size for a hotel. The water in the showers was hot and plentiful, and the towels were large and fluffy. For the most part the room was pretty quiet, with only the occasional water noise being heard. EXCEPT - the El train is only about a block away. You will hear it in your room, especially if you are on the back side of the hotel. The hotel elevators are plentiful and quick, so we never had to wait long despite the conventions being held in the building. We did not eat at the Hilton, but we did enjoy drinks and some wonderful Irish music at the hotel's restaurant/bar, Kitty O'Sheas. This is a beautiful hotel, and we found the location convenient for walking to the nearby parks and attractions. Biggest beef? The charge for internet service is ridiculous - anywhere from $14.99-$19.99 per 24 hour time period depending on the speed you desire. And be aware that the charge is per computer. My husband and I both had our laptops, but only the one who signed up for the service can use it. I can't believe you can buy a dollar cup of coffee at McDonalds and use the internet for free, but you can't have free internet when you pay over $200 per night for a hotel room. It's robbery!

Reviews.Title: “Some Disappointments, But Better Than Average”
Reviews.Author: dianaschnuth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend in Chicago, and booked a room at the Hilton at the recommendation of a friend. We were lucky to get a deal online that included discounted self-parking; otherwise, I think we would have kept looking elsewhere for a better price. The staff was friendly and professional and got us checked in quickly, letting us know that if we wanted a lakeside room (as I had mentioned in my online reservation request), it would cost an additional $25 per night. I passed on the lakeside room, as it would have essentially negated our parking discount. As it was, we got a south-facing room on the 11th floor with a view of the Essex hotel next door: which is to say, absolutely no view at all. Other minor disappointments included a lack of a refrigerator, a small bathroom, and neighboring toilet-flushes / waterpipe noise loud enough to wake us at night. Also, we would have enjoyed winding down at night with some television, except that our favorite cable channels (Food Network, Travel Channel, Discovery, other "geek channels") weren't available at the Hilton. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable, the AC had a digital thermostat (and the cleaning staff didn't readjust the temperature, which was appreciated), and the halls were relatively quiet. The elevators to the 11th floor were quick, and each had a tiny television showing CNN. We stopped into Kitty O'Shea's on Saturday and Sunday night for dessert and drinks. The live Irish duo Saturday night added to the ambiance, which we enjoyed. The hotel is relatively close to public transportation -- in particular, the Harrison exit for the Red Line. My husband and I didn't feel uncomfortable walking around the neighborhood at night, whether to get back from the train station or to just wander around and enjoy the city. Overall, this was a pleasant enough stay, but I think we'll look for something a little more personal and less pricey next time, even if it means staying a few stops outside of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: AthleticTraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a long weekend at this premium hotel. It is a beautiful historic hotel with staff that is professional and helpful. Our partial lake view room had two full baths. For our family of four, two "historic sized" baths were far better than having one large modern bath. Overall the room was clean and well maintained. We chose not to eat at the hotel, though there was a Starbucks nearby, there were very few other places to eat within walking distance. There is also a good size lap pool which we enjoyed as well. We used transit systems as our primary means of transportation. The Harrison (red-line) red-line station was a block behind the hotel and provided quick access to downtown. We also appreciated the express bus (CTA #10) to the Hyde Park attractions that left from across the street. To get to the Harrison station you will pass a college dorm so you may come across students being students. Another option is to catch a bus (CTA #3) to downtown from across the street. We found the people (and students) of Chicago to be very friendly and willing to offer advice and directions. We look forward to our visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but money-grabbing”
Reviews.Author: diveteam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before we started our Route 66 Road Trip. Upon arrival at the hotel the self parking is blocked off so I ask a jumped up bell boy with a stupid hat if I can park as I have a reservation, the very rude chap virtually barks at me that it is full and have to use concierge parking, I donâ€™t like concierge parking as not only is it over priced $53 per day in this case, I am not lazy and am able to drive into a car park myself. When I pull up to the concierge I ask if I can do self parking and he says ok, no problem. The jumped up bell boy then shouts at the guy and says it is concierge only and really talks down to him. So I have to hand over my keys and pay the scandalous fee. It was blatant that there was room in self parking and this was just another way of squeezing money out of their customers, as all the reviews on trip advisor states. Check in was swift and they upgraded my room because I am a Hilton HHonors member. Room was nice with comfortable beds, two bathrooms, plenty of closet space and clean. We even got vouchers to get complementary bottled water. The hotel is in a great location right on Michigan Avenue and a few minutes walk from the Millennium Park. If it wasnâ€™t for the unpleasant experience during arrival I would have given this hotel a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but fairly expensive”
Reviews.Author: Candelisaton
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very beautiful on the inside. the lobby was big and really beautiful. the rooms were the best part. i was with a friend and they had 2 double beds and 2 bathrooms. ive never been in a hotel with two bathrooms in one room before!! the location was ok. it was beside state street but i would rather stay on magnificent mile next time as theres better shopping up that way. they do however provide a free shuttle to magnificent mile everyday which saves you getting a bus. the one thing that goes against this hotel is the price. its very very expensive. was working out at aroun 200 euros a night. if you can afford it then its a great hotel but for that kind of money you could stay on the magnificent mile which would be a better location.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many great hotels, why stay at the Hilton Chicago?”
Reviews.Author: GypsyFooted2
Reviews.Content: The lobby was beautiful, as was the ballroom. Check in was very slow, although the staff was courteous and friendly. I had looked at the rooms on line and was greatly disappointed when I opened the door. It was small and crowded with furniture (although no easy chair in ours). When I opened the bathroom door, it hit the toilet. I've had bigger bathrooms in a Motel 6. The carpet could stand replacing and the bathroom tile grout could use some professional work. The bathrooms have been well-covered by others on here. We had a "commanding view" of the next tower of the Hilton, a few feet away. I had requested extra pillows, which were not there. There was no coffee or tea in our room. I couldn't get an answer from the front desk or housekeeping, so I called the hotel operator. She had someone bring more than enough up in just a few minutes. If you like the news, sports, and Hilton/ Chicago channels (and a few others) the television will be adequate. We couldn't find a telephone book or any other kind of directory (i.e.: churches; hospitals, etc). The air conditioning system was apparently right outside our window and ran constantly. I will say the air conditioning our room worked very well. As other people mentioned, the internet was too expensive. I found the bed too soft. The restaurants were overpriced, but we did eat at Kitty O'Shea's one night. I had potato leak soup($6.00) and my partner had Shepherd's Pie ($13.00). We've eaten both all over the UK and didn't recognize either dish. The Shepherd's Pie was especially bad and seemed more like a canned beef soup (light on the beef) with mashed potatoes on top. There was no discernable seasoning in either dish. The service was slow, but friendly. We had trouble several times with our room key not working (I heard other people expressing the same thing). The front desk assured us that it was because we had it near credit cards, cellphones or something else with a magnetic strip. What we found was the keys worked sometimes and not others. The cleaning staff was friendly and accommodating. Self-parking was $43 a night; valet parking $55 a night. Just down the street hotel valet parking was $32. The room service menu showed prices increased by $1.00-$2.00 per item, then an 18% tax, a 3%tax, and a $4.50 room service charge! So a bowl of oatmeal at $8 a bowl room service..... The one Concierge person I talked to was not friendly and I seemed to be bothering her. There just seems to be a lack of attention to detail in many areas. One upside is that Buddy Guy's Legends is only a block or so away. For my money, I would go back to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “They'll nickel and dime you for everything possible”
Reviews.Author: DCPlanner
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago is a beautiful, historic hotel located across the street from Grant Park. The meeting space is stunning, full of ornate details. My room was average, but I was unprepared for the extra costs associated with my stay. First, the fitness center has a charge of $15/day to use cardio or weights. Next, internet for 24-hours will run you $19.95. Also, if you need a late check-out they'll charge you $50. In order to avoid this fee, I checked out and then left my bags at the baggage storage. Guess what? A $2 per bag fee. I also had a problem with the lock on my door - I came back from dinner to find my door ajar. When I followed up with Security, they were professional and came up to my room to inspect. However there was no follow up from the hotel regarding my safety, no offer to change the locks, no offer to move me to a different room. I've been to Chicago many times and I would definitely stay at another hotel that won't charge me an arm and a leg for "extras."

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel If You're Paying With Your Own Dime”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: The only saving grace about this hotel is its great location. It's strategically located on Michigan Avenue, convenient to the "L" and other public transportation, and within walking distance to most major tourist spots. Other than location, it has little going for it and I would only stay there is someone else were paying the bill - as was our case. The hotel is in desperate need of a makeover: the lobby is dark and dank, public areas are drably furnished, and the rooms are tiny and compact. The two windows in the room overlooked the building next door; there was no view. We inspected its sister hotel, the Palmer House Hilton, and found it too to have little to make the guest feel welcome. Both hotels appeared clean, but it was difficult to tell what was below the surface. I know from checking Chicago hotel rates frequently that we could have done much better price-wise if we had been paying the bill rather than the conglomerate that did pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaFlowers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for our first vacation away together. We stayed for a week. Check-in was not till 3:00, so we decided to kill time by wandering through O'Hare and then taking the blue line to the Loop (Jackson) then walking to the hotel. We got lost (our fault) but if your compass works (ours didn't) it shouldn't be too far of a walk, even with suitcases. The check-in process was quick and the staff was friendly to us (we are both 20 but we look closer to 16, so we were happy to be treated like adults). We ended up arriving a little early anyway (around 2:30) and they let us have our room. The room was small-ish but there was enough room for two people and suitcases. The one thing I did not like about the bathroom is the industrial-type flusher on the toilet; I prefer my hotel to have a homey feel so I did not like the public washroom-style toilet (the toilet worked fine though). The bathroom had enough counter space for both of us. The bathroom did not, however, have a fan, so the mirror was always foggy after a shower. The shower was big enough, and had a good waterflow. Also, there was enough space on the edge of the tub and in the soap holders, etc. for all of our shower stuff (and if there wasn't, the ledge of the counter is right outside the shower). The only time we could hear the room next to us was in the bathroom, so that was fine. However, on the Friday we were there, there was a lot of noise in the hallway, and some drunk person was knocking on our door and trying to get in. Also, the people in that room were smoking (I believed it was a non-smoking floor). We could smell it in the hallway but after a few days the smell crept into our room. The staff we dealt with for these issues was friendly and accommodating (the lady at the front desk walked us over to the security kiosk about the noise complaint). We had hoped that the mini-bar would have a fridge in it, but it was just a cabinet with munchies (we were not even offered the key but we could see in it). Also, the bottled water in the room was $7, and the vitamin water was $5. Needless to say, we drank tap water, but there are Walgreens and CVS everywhere so you could go buy 24x500mL bottles for probably $10. So whatever you do, do not drink that water provided in the room! The room service menu was ridiculously expensive, and they add a $4.50 in-room dining charge, so if you wanted a sandwich it would cost you more than $20! We did not order, but I do wonder what a $20 club sandwich tastes like. The location was awesome. We attended Lollapalooza festival in Grant Park, and the hotel was close enough that we could go back to use the bathroom (and sit in somewhere air-conditioned) and get back in less than 20 mins (and not have to use the porta-potties). We timed our walk to the Hancock Centre and it was about 40 mins, but it's very easy to catch a bus or a train to the Magnificent Mile. The concierge lady we talked to was useless. We asked a simple question (when do we have to leave the hotel to be at O'Hare for 7:45?) and she kept telling us to leave 2 hours before our flight (which was at 9:45). We kept trying to explain that we had an international flight and had to BE there 2 hours early. Eventually she said it could take "20 mins to an hour" so we decided to catch our cab around 6:30 just to be safe. We ended up at the airport with about 2.5 hours to spare (but O'Hare is big so we shopped and explored). The cab ride back cost us about $45 after tip and took about 1/2 hour-45 mins. Overall, I liked this hotel, and I might stay here again if I can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “special chicago hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: pshilts
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son and I went to see the yankees lose to the sox. The hotel was so clean and stately, I was very pleasantly surprised as was my son. The service at all stations was right on. The concierge was helpful late on a Friday and early on a Saturday. With their help tickets were obtained. I will remember this concierge service for a long time as it was that attentive. Food was outstanding. Location is in the Loop on Michigan and very close to the Museums and the Lake. Room appeared oversized and my critical 13 year old son thought the whole thing was cool(my word, not his). Great pool and excerise room(I coildn't believe the quality, including the running track for cold weather)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Scottie05
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday night the 17th of May from Sydney,Australia where we live, to go back home to Edinburgh,Scotland to visit family and friends. United lost our luggage between LA and Chicago,but said it would arrive on the next flight,so we only had the clothes we where wearing. Next morning,still no luggage had arrived,went out for the day to tour your beautiful city,came back late afternoon,still no luggage. My wife phoned United,they said they had 2 of our suitcases,but where waiting for the 3rd to arrive before they would send them to the hotel. Well you can imagine what my wife said to them,and insisted they at least deliver the 2 cases so we can change clothes etc,shaver,toothbrushes etc. 2nd day,still no luggage,by this time,late at night,my wife is in tears,we had to go to Target to buy some underwear T shirts etc,this is where Peter the bell captian comes in. He was under the impression that United had delivered our 2 suitcases,and when we informed him that we where still waiting,he couldn,t believe it. He was straight on the phone to United and informed them in no uncertain manner but polite to get our cases over to the hotel as soon as possible,and informed them " Is this your company policy to hold guests to ransom with there suitcases" This is how good Peter was,he went and got us tooth paste,toothbrushes,deodarant,shaving kit and 2 vouchers for breakfast the next morning. Now that is what I call customer relations,nothing was to much trouble to him, and "Hey Presto" our luggage was delivered a few hours later. Thank you again Peter for a great job done,infact I think my wife gave you a big kiss on the cheek the next day. Could not fault this hotel in any way,staff where so polite friendly and helpfull,also Karen on concierge? for helping out clothes wise,lovely hotel,it was like walking into a palace back home in the UK. Will use this hotel again when we visit your beautiful city [which can,t be quick enough],we both fell in love with it and please please do not touch your lovely old buildings,Sydney demolished most of theres,other cities could learn a lot from Chicago. I think Chicago has the most friendliest,polite,helpful people I,ve ever came across and cleanest city I,ve ever visited,went to New York afterwards and I can assure you its got nothing on Chicago,you leave it for dead. I,m voting for you to get the Olympics in 2016 William and Lilian Scott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: Fijura
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Chicago is a very big hotel, and for someone who usually stays in independent hotels, was a shock to my system! Very much a number not a name there, as one would expect, with that many rooms. I did like the hotel but thought it let itself down on a couple of things. The rooms were nice, and spacious but just felt old. TV remote didn't work the entire time I was there (which was irritating when wanting to watch the news for 1/2 hour before evening events etc) and when I told them, was told, oh yes, it;s a common fault, the box has reset itself, so we would need to reprogramme the TV! The member of the bell team who bought my luggage up, did himself out of a decent tip by being overly familiar - using my first name and turning it into a cartoon character's name which it resembles - not a good first impression. The lift situation was appalling - they had a couple of big conferences going on at the same time as I was there and had to wait on the first morning 35 minutes to get downstairs (usually would walk the stairs but had a presentation case and over 20 floors up! so not an option) The lifts were a continous problem for everyone I spoke to. Kitty's was nice and food and service was quick and good. In general the hotel was good and the service was fine but the little things do make the difference and probably the bell hop didn't help my feeling about the hotel. Another thing - is the leaving luggage charges - I have never been charged for this in my life, and was therefore very surprised by that!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: DessertsDivaFL
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago. I was there for the Pampered Chef National Conference. My companions and I stayed in the two bed-two bath room which was spacious enough for the 4 of us. The only issue was the room was not completed cleaned out when we arrived. The fridge had the previous guest's leftover pizza and other dinner items left inside. The fridge was also missing items which we also reported because we did not want to be charge $3 for a missing Snickers bar. We received a conference discount so for what we all paid it was worth staying. However, I would never pay the full price for this room. It is just too expensive for me. We did not eat there but I do recommend Diner 11 (or was it Eleven Diner) which is a few blocks away. Bed pillows were too soft for me but the mattress was wonderful. We had a nice view overlooking the park and Lake Michigan. Ask for it, it is worth the view!

Reviews.Title: “Probably better hotels in the area/Too pricey in minor issues”
Reviews.Author: louiselove
Reviews.Content: The Hilton has its perks, nice rooms, gorgeous decor around the bldg, pretty good location, not the most expensive hotel in this location but still overpriced and a good overpriced Irish restaurant/grill/bar Kitty O'Shea's that is worth going in for the 13 dollar cheeseburger almost. I heard from a friend that Kitty O'Shea's is really fun to go to on a weekend night, so I suggest doing that if you enjoy pricey drinks (cheapest beer on top was 5 dollars, and it was not a full pint) and pricey bar food. Burgers were some of the best (my boyfriend and I are the we) we've ever had..cook them as we requested for them to cook them. What I didn't like about this Hilton (and I've stayed at others where I didn't feel this way) is that you feel like the hotel wants to rip you off from the getgo. 6 dollars for a bagel and cream cheese through room service, 7 dollars for cereal, 17 dollars/day for internet I believe was the rate, and there was no fridge in our room yet there was in replacement of a fridge a cabinet looking thing that supposedly had complimentary bottles of water for us (for being Hilton Honors Members), which we couldn't even get open and then just a tag (no bottle, empty or full, in sight) of a bottle water that says 7 dollars..Took us three attempts in calling + getting transferred to make sure we were not getting charged for this ridiculous bottle of water. Also, if you are a drinker, be sure to bring your alcohol in advance. It is close to two places (a carryouts bar and a warehouse liquor store) that sell booze..The actual cheaper one for beer is the nice warehouse liquor store. At the carryouts place it is 7 dollars for a 6er, whereas it is 20 dollars for a case at the Warehouse store..anywho, that was just a side note.. LQQK up in the area what are good deals to for going out like Villain's is pretty close + has good Sat. night speciails.. All in all, I had a pretty good time @ the Hilton and the Blackhawks Convention being the same weekend didn't bother me at all. Another thing to beware of is the pool situation. It is a nice pool but only has 3 dividers for people swimming laps..also there are two hottubs, but of course children were crowded both of em even though anyone under 16 was not allowed to be in the hottub. So, that sucked. The sun deck is really nice and large, so try to go there on a nice day. Unfortunately, this past July weekend did not produce the sun I was hoping for. That would've been enjoyable. And if you're into working out but don't believe in paying 15 dollars/day to use a hotel fitness center, this may not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: Bee56
Reviews.Content: This is an old and elegant hotel. I paid top dollar for the hotel (through the conference) and was disappointed. They charge an additional $15 a day for use of their health club (which in many hotels is included) and they are also extremely petty in charging upon checkout for any luggage that needs to be stored for a few hours (they charge per piece of luggage). They also charge for wireless internet connection, which in many hotels is now complimentary. Our room was nice enough although the air conditioning did not work properly. All in all, I was rather disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful building, okay rooms.”
Reviews.Author: meanny28
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru priceline at $85 dollars but that was not a bargain seeing that I paid $55 for overnite parking!!! The service was nice, clean rooms. Even though I arrived exactly at 3, all the king rooms were taken but was offered a executive room for $50 more, no thank you. So I got a room with two double beds and two bathrooms, that was nice. Crabtree & Evelyn products in BOTH bathrooms, plenty of towels. Our room was very quiet even with the taste going on outside and we were right by the elevators. Great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel - needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: First off - Beautiful building and architecture. Check-in was OK - friendly - but not overly. Room was nice - very roomy and clean. The hotel is old. Period. The rooms are updated, but the walls, etc... could use some work. Upside: great pool and fitness center which is completely included with your stay! Grand old hotel and architecture. Downside: The Grant park southside area is a little rough and the streets to the west are also a little seedy at night. Downside: Internet: 15.00 day / Parking 45.00 day

Reviews.Title: “The Staff steals from you!!!”
Reviews.Author: GentleDragon
Reviews.Content: I left my $130 flat iron (hair straightener) on the bathroom counter because it was too hot to put into my bag. I was going to carry it down to check-out with me, to give it time to cool off. I came home, unpacked and realized I had left it on the counter! I've been calling them like crazy to get to the bottom of this. I've spoken with the HEAD of Security, who called Housekeeping- of course, no one has seen or heard of anything. I spoke with the lost and found SPECIALIST, who also has not seen anything. She also gave me a lame excuse about how there is a new guest in the room and they may not have turned it in. WTF?! If there is a new guest- I'm guessing a housekeeper would have cleaned the room? If the housekeeper was honest she would have handed it in. If the lost and found specialist was honest she would say it was still there and not try to blame it on someone else. Granted- I am the dingbat who forgot it on the counter- but who the heck gives them the right to take things?! And it has only been 36 hours since I checked out! I know thieves move fast- but jeeze...really?! I could go buy a new one- but they nickel and dimed you for everything! Even luggage hold/coat check, using the fitness center and printing boarding passes?! WTF?!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: giant57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous and a great value. Right on Michigan Ave., it is located across from Grant Park in the heart of the city. Our room was very clean, well appointed, and had everything we needed. It is truly a grand hotel with old style elegance. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The concierge recommended Millerâ€™s Pub for dinner (just a short walk away) and it was perfect. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fine.”
Reviews.Author: L-and-J-McSweeney
Reviews.Content: There's nothing either bad or good to say about this hotel. It was fine. No poor customer service, no great customer service. The decor was dated, but clean. The room was small, but there was nothing missing. If I were to go back to Chicago, I would probably choose another hotel, but if I had to stay here, I wouldn't complain either. There's just nothing exceptional about it. There are a lot of additional charges, internet had three tiers of service (which just sounds like a scam), lowest of which was $15/day. To check my bags for two hours after checkout was $4. A lot of nickel and diming for a pretty expensive hotel room without a lot of features. Also, the room was quite noisy. Even on the 14th floor, with the blackout curtains pulled, there was a lot of street noise throughout the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in corner suite”
Reviews.Author: AiredaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I needed to move out of our home for 24 hours while it was being "spring cleaned." This year, we selected the Hilton because they welcome dogs that are up to 75 pounds. Our large, male Airedale is over 70 pounds - so, he isn't allowed in most "dog friendly" hotels. At the very last minute, we booked a one-bedroom suite on the 25th floor (executive floor). The entire experience at the Hilton was excellent. From the moment that we arrived, the staff was very accommodating - especially to our dog! They made sure that Oliver had a dog bed, bowls, treats and lots of attention and praise. They even offered to walk him in the park across the street! The suite was updated and since it was a corner (south east) suite, we had windows on two sides - very nice - lots of light. The bed was comfortable and well appointed with plenty of pillows. Room service was very good - we ordered dinner at 8pm and at 8:20pm it arrived, hot and well prepared. Breakfast on the executive floors was excellent - nice options (including "take away" coffee cups with lids) and very friendly and helpful service - especially the concierge. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised - we didn't expect much since it's the "old Hilton" - and, since we just needed a night someplace that welcomed our dog, our expectations were pretty moderate. Hilton greatly exceeded these expectations - we would highly recommend this hotel to families with kids or dogs - the hotel staff goes out of their way to make sure that you're welcomed. Finally, I have to say, the common areas are beautiful and very grand (especially the front, 2 story entrance). With the very reasonable rates that Hilton is charging this summer, you can't go wrong - especially if you're from out-of-town - the location, across from Grant Park, can't be beat! P.S. - Be sure to check and see if you can upgrade your room rate by $10/night to allow for indoor, attached parking (the usual rate (if you don't include it in your room rate) is somewhere around $45/night!).

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pammie724
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel four times for a trip to the city. I loved it ,so elegant and friendly this hotel is underrated in my opinion. My granddaughter loved the fluffy beds and the ballrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & with Hotwire an awesome price”
Reviews.Author: KingHuskey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire ($76 per night) and please keep in mind with Hotwire you do not know which hotel you are getting until you pay. We were very happy with the location of the hotel since it was within walking distance of the metro stations, Soldier Field, and all of cool sites of downtown Chicago. The price and location, again were awesome! The room was good, comfortable bed, nice bedding, two bathrooms. The main issue with the room was that you could hear the rooms next door bathroom, every flush and shower. Another lame point, but almost expected, was the nickle and diming for every amenity, ie internet, the business center, you name it. Oh yeah, nothing was stolen from our room :)

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe anyone gives this five stars”
Reviews.Author: familylondon
Reviews.Content: Rooms dated with poor housekeeping - towels not replaced, had to ring for extra shampoo, etc. Room service very expensive and almost inedible -chicken like leather. Extra charges for the internet, the gym, the luggage check, flight check in etc Drinks in the bar v expensive. Only plus point - breakfast was reasonable with decent crispy bacon. The pool was shut and being refurbished so lots of building work. Big soulless hotel trying to increase revenue by over the top charging for every extra with the service, decor and ambience to back it up.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Family74Bombay
Reviews.Content: in the windy city ,this is a very good place.amazing rooms and service.everything is a walking distance .An absolute must for business trio as ease with which you can conduct and schedule meetings here is unbeatable. Good decor and impishly modern

Reviews.Title: “Grand business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ppmac
Reviews.Content: This is one of those grand old hotels which seems like it has been around forever. It has a grand entrance with high ornate ceilings and sweeping staircases.
